I am in the process of making a website just for family and friends and would like to have a basic video editor on the site. For example, when someone uploads a video to my page, I want them to have the ability to open up the footage in a video player and have two very basic functions. As they watch the video, I want them to be able to pause the video and click a button in the editor to create a freeze frame for 5 seconds at that point. Then I want them to have one tool that will give them the ability to draw on the screen during that freeze frame. A basic paint tool or something. When they are done drawing, they just hit a button in the editor and that edit is complete. Does this make sense?

Play video - Pause Video - Press a certain button in editor to create a freeze frame - Use tool to draw something on the screen - Press button to complete edit - Video continues to play after freeze frame normally. Any they would be able to make as many freeze frames as possible.

If anyone can help, please let me know. This is a fun project I am working on for myself, but I definitely have the money to pay the right person that can help me or guide me in the right direction to getting this done. Is this a difficult task?

body:
Looking for a Senior PM for a short term contract in Bellevue-

Senior Program Manager with experience delivering large-scale ERP and supply chain projects. The role requires an individual who has exceptional Program Management experience, understands the SDLC, has a proven track record of delivering software related supply chain projects, has managed teams between 50 -100 resources, and has hands-on experience at managing project budgets greater than $5 million. Covestic's client needs a person who can immediately step into the role and be effective.

Primary responsibilities of the role include:

- Taking ownership for delivery of a global supply chain implementation project.
- Ensuring project scope, schedule, dependencies and constraints are up to date and well understood by the team.
- Understanding the business drivers behind the project.
- Ensuring team leads define tasks and resource assignments at a manageable level.
- Reporting on and managing project scope throughout the lifecycle.
- Managing multiple projects in parallel.
- Directing team effectiveness and driving results both internally and with the client base.
- Facilitating complex team meetings involving business and IT resources.
- Demonstrating credibility as a business partner to ensure business and technology decisions are reached to support business goals and objectives.
- Balancing resources, schedule and budget to meet delivery dates.
- Managing, tracking and revising the project budget.
- Generating alternatives and improving creative solutions.
- Promoting project best practices.
- Presenting project updates to large teams and executive audiences.
- Acting as the focal point between all functional groups.
- Negotiating with client and/or organization leadership to meet project objectives.
Experience - External:
- 8+ years of project management experience.
- PMP certified.
- Prior program management experience on large supply chain projects.
- Long and successful history of delivering infrastructure and software related projects.
- Strong understanding of the PMI / PMBOK Methodology.
- Extremely strong communication skills, both written and oral.
- Experience independently managing large, complex projects with more than 30 resources.
- Well-developed leadership skills in a matrix organization environment.
- Minimum of a four year degree.
- Prefer Oracle experience. Must have multiple ERP implementations of Oracle, SAP or PeopleSoft experience.
title: Senior Supply Chain Implementation Program Manager

body:
Job Title: Service Desk Technician (SDT)

Security Clearance Level: Candidate must have a Top Secret [TS] clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI clearance to start at all other locations.).

Work Hours: Full time across multiple shifts

Terms: Full Time, W-2 position

Compensation Rate: $35K to $45K per year plus benefits

Job Description:

Minimum/General Experience: Two years of college and five years of directly relevant Information Technology Service Desk experience (Professional Certifications may substitute for up to 1 year experience) or seven years experience in lieu of education.

Functional Responsibilities: Interfaces directly with supported end-users to provide advanced hardware, software, network and applications problem resolution. Is current with industry standard desktop operating systems and office automation software suites.

Specific Responsibilities: SDTs must be able to clearly communicate via phone, portals and instant messaging with end users, technicians and the Government customer. HDTs must have advanced experience troubleshooting core services (file, e-mail, print, web, portal and transport). SDTs should be qualified to perform the following functions:

Serve as the initial point of contact for resolution of desktop/laptop related problems in a 56,000+ customer enterprise.

Troubleshoot, research, diagnose, document, and resolve technical issues surrounding Windows XP, Windows 7, MS Office applications, email, other special applications, Internet connections, and hardware/peripheral equipment via telephone.

Document, track, resolve, and report on problems and work orders using Remedy Action Request database system.

Monitor networks, secure and non-secure; modify user accounts via Active Directory, submit changes to file management and peripheral devices via Remedy, escalate network incidents and provide direct support to USSOCOM customers located throughout the world.

Monitor network status remotely using several Network Management Systems, and create applicable work orders for discrepancy resolution as necessary.

Determine which special team can best resolve the problem and assign the task to the Desktop Support, Customer Support, Network Administration or System Administration Teams when a solution cannot be provided telephonically.

Provide input to management reports summarizing overall network and work order status, and contract SLA metrics.

Ability to install, maintain and troubleshoot network, system and application issues.

Knowledge of workstation hardware and Microsoft Technologies.


Technical expertise in the set up, operation, and troubleshooting of all associated and follow-on operating systems.

Monitor secure and non-secure networks 24X7 and escalate incidents to system administrators, network administrators, computer security administrators and management teams for resolution. Must be familiar with Dameware and Terminal Services.

Required Skills:

DoD Directive 8570.01, Information Assurance Training, Certification, and Workforce Management: Candidate must obtain an IAT Level I certification within six months of hiring. DoD approved IAT Level I certifications include:

Computing Technology Industry Association's (CompTIA's) "A+",
CompTIA's "Network+", or
International Information Systems Security Certifications Consortium's (ISC2's) "System Security Certified Practitioner (SSCP)".

Preferred Certifications: MCSA and ITIL V3 Foundations.

Education:

Required: Two Years of College (seven years of experience in lieu of education)

Preferred: Associates Degree with an IT background.

Essential Elements:

Physical Requirements: Sitting at desk 95% of the time. Phone use 10% of the time and PC or laptop 50%. Filing required 5%. May require lifting and carrying boxes of supplies or files up to 25 lbs. (2%). Extended periods of sitting while on PC/laptop or phone.

Work Environment: Work will be performed in a cubical environment inside a large facility (100%).

Equipment and Machines: General office equipment, which includes: telephone, fax machine, copier, PC/laptop, and other miscellaneous office equipment. (100%).

Attendance: Work assignments dependent on requirements by the client. It is important to be able to work at least 8 hours a day for 5 days per week. (100%).

Other Essential Elements: Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation. Must be well organized with the ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously. Must be able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing. Must be able to interface effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Grooming and dress are usually business casual, but are dependent on client's standards. Must not pose a safety hazard to employees working in the same general area.
title: Cleared Help Desk Technician

body:
AltaSourceGroup is seeking a talented and dedicated Front End, C# UI developer with strong WPF and Expression Blend skills. Our client is developing a brand new desktop application used for Major League Baseball, so if you're a sports fan, there is a fun element to this project! It would be working along side a sr. backend .NET developer that needs a UI specialist to come in and help carve out an eye catching, easy to use UI for users of this MLB application. Best part, if you're local to the Puget Sound, this role is 100% telecommute! See below, you MUST live in the Puget Sound to qualifiy, but is so you can go to work in your pajamas. :)

Requirements:

- 5+ years of overall software development experience, specifically on the .NET stack. Our client is using C#.NET 4.0 and WPF on this project.

- 3+ years specializing in front end, UI development work. You understand the importance of an easy to use, elegant UI for users to feel like it's intuitive. You have a passion for the look and feel even though you are a strong mid tier developer with .NET as well!

- 1+ years of professional development expertise with WPF and Expression Blend. A good understanding of the Entity Framework would also be a big plus; again you have a passion and expertise for the GUI.

- Previous MySQL database expertise is a plus but not required. Though this is primarily a .NET stack application, the back end does run on MySQL. The Sr. developer on the team that has created the app can help on the backend development where needed.

- NOTE: Candidates MUST be local to the Puget Sound for this position as we need the ability to meet you in person, not only for the interview, but ongoing as needed during this important project. Candidates outside of the area will not be considered.

If you feel qualified and interested in this immediate contract position, please call Chris at 206.940.2906 and email your resume. Chris has been a Sr. Technical Recruiter and Software Engineer for a combined 9+ years and values building a long term relationship with his candidates. Come work with a recruiter and company that understands your value and goals and join the team at AltaSource today!
title: Front End UI/WPF telecommute dev role for MLB!

body:
Hello,

I have a couple business laptops. One recently had the HDD crash and I learned my lesson. I didn't lose my data becasuse I did have that backed up. Thank goodness.
However, the down time of getting a new drive, restoring the OS and installinga all my programs was quite time consuming especially when you need the laptop up and running asap. So my idea is to buy an extra hard drive for each laptop and already have it ready to go with OS and programs installed in the event of another HDD failure. Not sure if this sounds crazy but it seems like a good idea to me. :)

I wanted to reach out to anyone who has a suggestion for "best practice" to copy my exisitng hard drive on to the new backup one so it is ready to go. I guess I need to mirror the drive so it is plug and play, so to speak.

Any thoughts on the best way to do this and the best software for this??????

Thanks for your help.
title: ??? - Backup Hard Drive - Complete Image

body: I have a phone system i am trying to set up, but have not worked with VOIP before and am running into some problems. I am trying to get it all set up, but have discovered that there are a few too many technical details that I do not have time to spend hours researching.  I am looking for someone in Houston who has experience working with THIS EXACT SET OF SOFTWARE/HARDWARE who can quickly and easily get me up and running.  At the moment there is a single SIP trunk, though I do plan to set each device as a separate extension for internal transfer/paging.  If you are EXPERIENCED in this sort of thing (not a first-timer learning as you go like i am), please contact me with your availability, experience, and pricing.  Thanks.

body:
Java EE Web Developer/Engineer

TerraXML seeks Java developers and engineers with strong web development skills to join its product development and support team.
This position will be engaged in development, customization, and support of TerraXML's web based content delivery product.
This is primarily a software developer position.
Qualified candidates must have strong problem solving and analytical skills.
You will have high levels of interaction with both technical and non-technical personnel.
You will be part of a team developing new innovative software products for web based content management and product life cycle customers in a variety of industries.

Highly Desired skills (candidate must have several of these):

- Web Development Skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX)
- Web/Application Servers such as Apache HTTP, Tomcat, JBoss, WebLogic
- Java EE technologies such as JSP, Servlets, Apache Commons, Web Services, JMS, etc
- Java OO Development and Java XML tools
- XML Skills (DTD, Schema, XSLT, XPATH, XQuery, XForms, DITA, Docbook)
- SDLC methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Unified Process)
- Product development experience, including analysis, design, implementation, test and documentation phases
- Excellent interpersonal and customer engagement skills

Additional Desired Skills:

- Content Management Experience (Windchill, Documentum, Alfresco, etc.)
- Spring
- Native XML DB (Exist, MarkLogic)
- YUI 2 Javascript Library

Location:
- Boulder, CO area preferred. Position does not necessarily require a daily onsite presence. Relocation not available at the moment.

Compensation and Benefits:
- Compensation commensurate with experience. Full benefit package including health, dental, 401(k), and stock options.

Interested parties, please respond to this posting through email for immediate consideration.

Who We Are:
TerraXML helps Fortune 100 companies plan, design, and implement product lifecycle management (PLM) and enterprise content management (ECM) solutions that leverage the benefits of XML. Based in Boulder, Colorado, our resources average 12 years of experience in consulting and implementing solutions that address the full spectrum of XML and ECM challenges.

What We Do:
TerraXML provides products, services, and training for customers needing Product Lifecycle Management, Content Management, and Dynamic Publishing solutions. We develop solutions for a wide variety of industries including publishing, financial services, government, defense, insurance, medical, and life sciences. These solutions include applications for maintenance repair, regulatory compliance, policies and procedures, submissions for FDA, patents, e-learning and dynamic custom course creation, publication authoring and publishing to web and print, S1000D, DITA, and intelligent search, and dynamic data mining functions.

Our Clients:
Our clients are among the most successful and trusted brands in their industries. They tend to have difficult business problems and complex environments. They have decided to adopt XML as the underlying intelligent data format for their corporate information and wish to provide "anywhere accessible" applications to their users with advanced features and functionality that can only be enabled with XML. These companies count on our expertise to address their most pressing initiatives.




* Compensation: commensurate with experience
* Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
* Please, no phone calls about this job!
* Please do not contact job poster about other services, products or commercial interests.
title: Web Developer

body:
Read this entire ad before replying. Please.

What we DONT need: Companies or firms in the web-development/design business. Overseas contractors (this is a domestic/US position). Note: if you are an overseas contractor and would like to give me your information for future use, you may do so. You will not be eligible for this position, though. (We work with overseas contractors from time to time.)

What we need: A freelance/contractor to work with my company on an ongoing basis as a web developer. This is not restricted to a single project. This has the potential to develop into a long term position with project management possibilities for the interested individual. Employee status may be considered down the line but initially, this will be a 1099 contractor position. The initial work will be part time but may quickly develop into a full time workload if interested.

You should know these technical skills:
- PHP5 with primarily OOP experience
- MySQL (other databases are a plus)
- JavaScript (particularly jQuery, ExtJS, or similar)
- Experience using SVN or similiar (or a willingness to learn)
- Any XML, API, or specific framework experience is a plus

You should match this profile:
- You are a professional person and good communicator
- You can keep your deadlines and take responsibility for your work
- You can work well with others when needed
- You are organized and manage your time well

What I want from you:
- A resume, CV, or some other listing of your skills and experiences
- Personal and/or professional references (more than one)
- How much you request per hour
- Your normal availability for work and how much work per week you could initially dedicate to our projects
- Your general location and timezone

Replies without the above information will not be read. Reply with "Grandpa" in the subject line to show me that you read this entire ad.

body:
Our company is currently looking to fill a position as a Senior Buyer. Below are the job description and job requirements.

Job Description:
Working in a production and engineering environment, the Buyer will be responsible for the planning and buying of high precision mechanical components and mechanical assemblies. Using an ERP (SAP) this position will process purchase requisitions, issue requests for quotes and process change orders. In addition this position will qualify new suppliers and work with engineers on new product development. Must have a strong technical background in Mechanical background and/or the ability to understand mechanical designs a plus.
Process purchase requisitions, issue requests for quotes to suppliers, process systems generated purchase order numbers, and process purchase change orders.
Administer daily documentation to support procurement process including obtaining documentation for specifications, drawings, artwork, pricing, and certifications, returned material authorizations, purchase agreement data, case files, acknowledgements, last time buys, and routine administrative support.
Fully responsible with complete ownership for procurement business system data input, management, and integrity. Take the lead to maximize procurement team's effectiveness through management of data elements relative to buyer code changes, part parameters, quote table maintenance, supplier database information, error report analysis, and part number/supplier code information.
Solicit quotations from preferred supply base with limited direction in support of purchases and/or bids.
Negotiate price based on historical and similar part pricing to determine best value, perform price analysis for purchase orders as required, select sources form approved supplier listing, document, approve, and place orders/changes orders in accordance with delegation of authority and documentation requirements.
Responsible to assure suppliers meet the Manufacturing Requirement Planning systems need dates while achieving inventory objectives. Resolves chronic part/source delivery or quality problems.
May require on-site visits to supplier for problem resolution and/or commodity team visits.
Participate as active cross-functional member of the commodity team by providing supplier/market information to gain insight into the assigned commodity and supply base.
Participate in special projects.
Strive for 100% internal and external customer satisfaction by obtaining and maintaining a clear understanding of the customer's needs and providing products and services which totally satisfy customer requirements.
Operate in accordance with Corporate, Operations, and Division policies and practices, and in compliance with accepted business ethics.

Job Requirements:
-SAP proficiency STRONLGLY preferred
-Microsoft office proficiency (Basic Word, Excel)
-Working knowledge of PowerPoint
-minimum 2 years previous buying experience (more mechanically focused - electronic parts or build-to-print mechanical products)

If you are interested in this job please email me and attach your resume as a word document.
title: Senior Buyer 2

body:
We're a new, green start-up business that does deliveries around town on bicycles. We dream about our bicyclists carrying mobile phones that automatically send tweets and text messages to our customers when they are near to their destinations, and a number of other cool, cloud-enabled, super-green features. In other words, we're looking for somebody who can take our customer service, inventory tracking, route planning, and other systems to the next level. No individual business process that we have is terribly complex -- we don't need the world's most sophisticated scheduling software, CRM system, or route planner -- rather, we just need the systems we have to talk to each other. Our preference is to purchase existing, robust software packages in the cloud and then to begin stitching them together through their APIs and light customizations -- we've got a lot of the systems selected, and now we need to do the stitching and customization. Right now, we're using Zoho CRM, our own MySQL database, Quickbooks Online, Recurly/Intuit to process payments, Tropo to send SMS, MailChimp for email, Joomla for our web front-end, and are evaluating a few options for route planning and inventory control.

Once you're selected, we'd develop a prioritized roadmap of all our web application to-dos. After we did that, we'd like to begin an ongoing, regular, hourly relationship with a web developer who can work with MySQL databases and a variety of web application APIs. Most of the work would be performed remotely, but we'd really like to work with somebody who can visit our facility and observe our operations to get a sense of how the software will actually be used in the field and in our facility and who can interface directly with the people who will be using it.

Please submit a mini-proposal with the following information:

1) Relevant project experience, ideally with links to other websites on which you've worked
2) Your resume
3) Your proposed availability (i.e., up to how many hours can you work per week) and hourly rate based on a commitment of 10-20 hours per week of work.
4) Whether you'd prefer a 1099 or a W-4 relationships -- we could probably structure this arrangement in either way.

Thanks! And feel free to ask any questions.
title: PHP / MySQL Developer

Panasas, Inc., the leader in high-performance parallel storage for business-critical applications, enables customers to rapidly solve complex computing problems, speed innovation and accelerate new product introduction. Addressing the Big Data market, all Panasas storage products leverage the patented PanFS storage operating system to deliver superior performance, data protection, scalability and manageability. The company's global reach extends to 50 countries with a diverse line-up of fortune 500 companies in key verticals including life sciences, finance, oil and gas, government, research, manufacturing and aeronautics.

Building on five consecutive years of uninterrupted revenue growth the company achieved record revenue in 2010, increasing by more than 40 percent for the year.

Panasas has a culture where bright, dedicated people can flourish with the opportunity to shape an industry.

To learn more, please visit us at www.panasas.com


Software Engineers- Storage / Networking / File Systems

These positions will be located at our Sunnyvale, California headquarters


Click here to apply.


Responsibilities :
  • Design and Develop new functionality.
  • Develop unit and system tests and execute them prior to handing off code to the QA team
  • Participate in the end-to-end analysis of the system's performance.
  • Participate in file system performance tuning.
  • Resolve bugs found by QA and in the field.
  • Work with Service team to make sure that new features can be easily maintained and serviced.
  • Participate in the training of QA and the service teams on new features that have been developed by the team.
  • Work on high priority/critical issues found at customer sites.

Experience and Qualifications :
  • Minimum of 5 years industry experience developing storage-related software products is required.
  • Extensive knowledge of C/C++, in-depth knowledge of Unix internals and excellent design and programming skills are required.
  • Experience in kernel level development, multi-threading / parallel programming and fault-tolerance techniques are required, preferably on FreeBSD/Linux.
  • Strong problem solving skills, strong debugging ability in both live debugging and dump analysis, are required.
  • Must be an excellent team-player.

    • For Cluster Networking:

    • Experience in performance modeling, analysis, and tuning is highly preferred

    For Distributed File Systems:
    • Knowledge of network file systems protocols (NFS, CIFS, AFS) is preferred.

    For Storage:

Translate requirements into functional service designs and create service models along with supporting documentation (activity and sequence diagrams).
Identify opportunities to reuse enterprise technology services
Ensure that service designs adhere to standards, principles and governance processes.

Provide service designs deliverables which can be estimated by the appropriate implementation teams.
Ensure designs and patterns are adhered to in the delivery channels.

Perform peer reviews of designs and solution proposals to ensure conformance to current practice and quality of work being generated.

Bachelor's Degree

body:
POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Position Title: .NET Programmer
Reporting To: President/CEO
The Company: Global Wave Group
Location: Aliso Viejo, California & Telecommute

COMPANY SUMMARY

Global Wave Group is a technology solutions provider to the financial services industry. Our value proposition is to enable bankers to become more efficient in processing loans, thereby allowing them to spend more time speaking with their customers and generating new business to help grow the bank's portfolio. Our business model is focused on helping banks streamline credit operations, manage credit risk and become more efficient by use of our technology products.

Our flagship product, Credit Track is a web-based CRM, loan origination, workflow, approval, monitoring and reporting software suite that helps bankers manage their loan portfolio and mitigate commercial lending risks.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Global Wave Group (GWG) is seeking a.Net Programmer to be a part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment that designs and develops web based solutions for our clients. Our firm is projected to have significant growth for the next several years. We focus on technology driven solutions and work on a requirements based approach to satisfy our clients' needs. This is an ideal opportunity to be part of a cutting edge and innovative start-up environment within our organization.

The programmer position will develop and trouble-shoot new and existing code for our Credit Track software product, which is written in Microsoft .NET.

Designing/modifying applications using ASP.NET, C#.NET, VB.NET, Ajax, SQL Server.
Full life cycle development for a brand new project.
Maintain and enhance existing software technologies in .NET.
Maintain, test and improve upon our existing applications.
Work with our clients to ensure trouble-shooting and technical support of code.


REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS


The ideal candidate will be responsible for design, analysis, development, and implementation of new data driven web based applications, as well as providing support for existing systems. Strong SQL Server (2005 minimum and 2008) and .NET (2.0 minimum) programming are required. The programmer should be able to work independently and within a team of developers to deliver end-to-end web solutions for moderate to complex projects; the candidate should be able to define and implement the software development life cycle utilizing existing development and source code version control procedures.

Web Application Development

Proficient in HTML & CSS
Excellent knowledge of JavaScript and Ajax
Knowledge of IIS & Windows Services
Proficient with Visual Studio 2008

Database Design/Support/Administration

Stored Procedures, view, maintenance and support
DTS/SQL Server Integration Services for data migrations
Microsoft SQL Server 2005

Qualifications

Experience with Software Development Life Cycle methodologies
6+ years of web development experience in Microsoft technologies
Database Experience with SQL Server 2005, 2008; performance tuning and re-architecture
Experience with Microsoft Excel based reporting from web applications
Strong understanding of .NET Fundamentals (Interfaces, inheritance etc.)
6+ years of experience in VB.NET, ASP.NET, C#, Ajax, XML/XSLT/XPATH, ADO.NET, Object oriented programming
Experience with web services (specify 1.1 or 2.0).
Experience with windows services is a plus
Knowledge of design patterns and architectural patterns
Experience with Visual Studio 2005 and/or 2008
Experience with Source Control - VSS
Experience with SQL Server 2005, 2008
Experience with database design, querying, stored procedures, views, joins, performance etc.
Adaptability; self-starter; team player; quality minded; focused; committed; work independently
Excellent analytic problem-solving, critical-thinking skills
Written and verbal communication skills appropriate for the position

EDUCATION

A bachelor's degree in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, Business/Technology or similar degree required

body:
Location: Shelton, CT
URL: http://www.suresource.com/secure/employment.asp

SureSource LLC is a leader in providing direct to consumer ecommerce sales and service for consumer products manufacturers and leaders in the licensing industry.  Become part of an exciting ecommerce team as you develop and program state-of-the-art webstores ranging from The Krups Online Store (Krupsonlinestore.com) to the Guinness WebStore (GuinnessWebStore.com).  If you love diversity, creative freedom and working with a talented team, then SureSource is for you.  
 
SureSource LLC is located in Shelton, CT.  Serious consideration for remote work location will be given.  We are a direct employer - not an agency or consulting firm. 
 
Scope & Responsibilities
The primary role of the Sr. Java Developer is to design, document and implement changes and improvements to our web based systems and services to support business growth.  They should have a solid understanding of web code architecture and have a strong background in ecommerce web development.
  • Help guide architectural direction in response to and anticipation of business needs.
  • Recommend improvements to facilitate business needs and growth.
  • Can understand business requirements and translate them into working web and DB systems
  • Can identify and fix problems or bugs within existing code base JBoss EAP, Seam, JSF, XHTML,  RichFaces , JSP, JAVA, EJB3, Spring
  • Update and create new code adhering to web security and standards (OWASP)
  • Implement 3rd party API solutions into our current web architecture
 
Experience & Core Competency
The ideal candidate will have 4+ years professional experience in .com and web-based applications development.  B.S./B.A in related discipline preferred.
 
Proficiency in the following areas:
Programming Languages
  • Has a functional knowledge of web based architecture and implementation
  • Understands the software development life cycle with a knowledge of Agile Methodologies
  • Understands object oriented coding practices, and structured programming
  • Can create modify and implement well structured functions and objects
  • A strong sense of application security, and has worked with ecommerce or other sensitive customer information
  • Can recognize the impact of code modifications to any and all related systems
  • HTML, CSS, SSL, XHTML, XSLT, SEAM, JSF, Facelets, EJB3, Hibernate, Apache Mod Rewrite, JBoss EAP
 
Database
  • Understands a relational database management system
  • Can  write interpret and modify SQL, Stored Procedures / Functions
  • Has a working knowledge of database design
  • Understands table normalization
  • T-SQL, SQL, Stored Procedures, Stored Routines, MySql, MSSQL
 
 
Our state of the art facility is located in Shelton, CT, easily accessible to Route 8, Merritt Parkway and Route 34.  In addition to competitive benefits and salary package, we offer an on-site fitness center and game room.
To receive consideration, please apply online http://www.suresource.com/secure/employment.asp

NO PHONE CALLS, PLEASE.  NO AGENCIES.  (Due to the high volume of applications, not all candidates will be contacted.)
SureSource is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and a drug free/smoke free workplace.  Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.  SureSource requires that all applicants be eligible to work in the United States WITHOUT sponsorship.  EOE

To apply: To receive consideration, please apply online http://www.suresource.com/secure/employment.asp
title: SureSource LLC: Sr. Java Developer

Request for Qualifications
Children's Network
CARES Plus Computer Tutor

SCOPE: The Children's Network of Solano County is looking for Independent Contractors to provide computer tutorial assistance to child care providers referred by staff of the Children's Network as part of the CARES Plus program. This assistance may include helping providers:
1. Evaluate current hardware and connectivity to determine appropriateness for the online elements of the program;
a. Assist providers with understanding and implementing improvements, if needed and appropriate.
b. Assist providers with identifying appropriate public computers or other cost effective solutions.
2. Obtain the basic computer skills needed to:
a. Send and receive emails and
b. Complete online courses and trainings.

SKILLS NEEDED: The contractor we select will have had college level computer courses and some experience with the following:
1. Tutoring adult learners and/or those who have had very limited exposure to technology/software applications;
2. Working on-site with individuals one-on-one in areas related to basic computer navigation skills (i. e. - window screen elements such as buttons, bars, windows and icons; basic terminology, using the mouse/keyboard, exploring the start menu, accessing various drives, launching programs such as MS Word, using the internet, etc.); and,
3. Troubleshooting and/or configuring PC Hardware and internet connections.

We anticipate awarding a minimum of two contracts and are looking for at least one contractor to be fluent in Spanish. Payment will be at the rate of $35 per hour. To be considered, please provide a copy of your resume and at least two references that describe and attest to your skills, knowledge and abilities, by no later than September 19, 2011.

Submissions should be sent to Ronda Kogler, as follows:

Via return email
Via fax to (707)421-6495, or
Via mail to:
Children's Network
2320 Courage Drive, Ste 107
Fairfield CA 94533.

We are a web design and development company located in the lower mainland of BC. We are looking for a *full-time* contract senior web developer/programmer to join our team. You must have at least three years of experience in web development, backend programming, database design, design and developing websites using the Drupal CMS 5.x, 6.x and 7.x, and have experience and knowledge in using APIs for e-commerce utilization. In addition, the ideal person will have 3+ years of experience in PHP, MySQL, XHTML, JS, CSS, jQuery and AJAX.

PHP/MySQL 3+ years
HTML/XHTML, table-less coding in CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Ajax libraries and functions
Post-secondary diploma or degree in computer science, software engineering, web programming or equivalency with a minimum of 3+ years' experience in web development
Strong Quality Assurance skills -- able to review work and thoroughly test out the project to ensure all features are effectively working

BSQUARE is currently working with a high-profile client on a confidential project. We are looking to build a team of 4-6 developers with Linux kernel and driver development experience in various areas. Positions available will be:

  • Senior Software Engineer
  • Software Architect/Senior Software Architect

Desired Skills & Experience
Candidates should possess technical proficiency in some of the following technologies:

  • Kernel development: (Interrupts, HAL, memory)
  • Driver development (Various peripherals, LCD, Audio, serial, USB, etc.)
  • Bluetooth

Candidates must be located on the West Coast (US). Both FTE and contract positions are available. For contract positions, term is for approximately 6-12 months with possible extension.

----Interviews will be starting within the next 2 weeks.----

Contact me immediately to be considered or to refer someone for these roles.

Company Description
BSQUARE is an industry leader with a proven track record in providing production-ready software products, engineering services, solutions and automated testing for smart, connected devices. With deep technical knowledge of mobile and embedded technologies, BSQUARE enables device makers to develop and ship best in class products.

Since 1994, BSQUARE has provided satisfied customers with innovative software solutions allowing them to get to market faster with reduced risk and cost. BSQUARE maintains strategic alliances with Microsoft, McAfee, Adobe, Datalight and all major silicon vendors and other leading technology companies. With in-depth knowledge of operating systems and silicon technology, expertise in all stages of device development, time-saving solutions and licensing knowledge, BSQUARE helps device makers take smart devices from concept to market.

BSQUARE Corporation is headquartered in Bellevue, Washington with offices throughout North America, Europe, and Asia.

BSQUARE Corporation is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Desktop set up techs needed - Many Jobs available

body:
PROJECT BACKGROUND
In Feb 2011 I advertised to fill a position as "Site Admin/Content Manager" to create a comprehensive and monetized site out of WordPress pages I designed as ideas. The premise was a Dad-centric site, based on Event Planning/Scheduling (think hybrid of Evite + FB + Meetup.com) but more. The many desired functions hinge on, and are limited to, a strict site focus for Dads. Moms heavily outdo Dads in this arena. I had many responses and chose one. The site progressed in the Spring, but due to issues out of my control, the work slowed and recently stopped.

PROJECT NOW
I speak to you as the President of DadsPlan, LLC, the latest and last incarnation of this idea. DadsPlan.com is not launched, but there is a back-end and framework built around of myriad of cool and complex ideas. The site thus far is built in php and uses Joomla. The code is being packaged to be sent to whoever will accept this offer. Obviously I would like an expert in php/Joomla, as I want to avoid recreating the wheel. I've been told there is functionality I have not seen, but will be documented with the packaging. My hope is find someone who can take off running where this was left off. If some of my ideas can not be implemented using php/Joomla, I'm not married to them, and will discuss as plan moving forward.

REQUIREMENTS
    - php/Joomla: or other languages/packages if php/Joomla not practical to finish
    - SEO/SEM
    - Experience /w Monetized Sites (Shopping Carts, PayPal,, Adsense, Direct Affiliate Links, Donations)
    - Event Calendars/Scheduling Calendars. (Current Calendar in JEVENT)
    - Aestethic Eye: Comfortable with front and back-end programming. I have functions to be implemented and an idea of how to present them all (in a dash board style) .
    - Act as Primary: Only to deal with one person. Ex: If graphics or potential App Dev needs to be farmed out, it's on you to find and coordinate. I'll trust and pay you.
    - Time and Good Communications. My prior independent programmer became over-extended, and not quick to give status updates or show incremental achievements.
    - Creativity: Seamlessly integrate form and function, and offer ideas to me. I'm not a control freak, or a genius, I just want it clean and working.
    - Enthusiasm:
    I'm not building a boring blog, a corporate page, or some faceless shopping site. Though it needs to be monetized, this is personal to me, because it is an extension of my life as a married Dad of two. I've seen what's out there, and it's very bloggish/news aggregation. NYC has a growing Dads Meetup, but it still pales in functionally to what I have in mind. I consider this a Social Utility for Dads, and I wouldn't continue if I felt I was offering the same old thing. I have enough cool/unique ideas, and pending business relationships to tap - I just need the tech.

PAY
Negotiable. I'm open. I ask all applicants to state your usual rates to me, and provide links to work you've done. Until someone looks at the existing code, it not clear how many hours may be needed to get to a launch status - which may effect the rate.

BUSINESS OP?
In my Feb 2011 posting I offered the idea of an official partnership. As an LLC I can accommodate as such if it means more personal investment on your part for a share of profits - we can talk and make formal arrangements. But for now, I'm assuming to hire as a contractor and just see what goes from there. Again, I'm open. And once the site is running, I will probably require ongoing tech.

TIMEFRAME
Launchable by end of Fall. There's a lot of ideas (I maintain a sharable Google Doc for this). Maybe not all need to be in place for an initial launch. Was aiming for the Summer, so I'm already behind.

WHAT EXISTS NOW?
Read the INTRO at http://www.DadsPlan.com/home and you'll get a feel of WHAT's there and WHY it's there.. The programmer set up a basic page to show the Intro...then added the start of a JEVENT Calendar. We had problems Mirroring some functions from his home server to DreamHost, so we had to stop here. I already redesigned in Photoshop a dashboard look for a homepage, so we would work off that.

LESSONS LEARNED
From my last posting, so many people responded, many with very nice work. Now that I have a better idea of the final product I can more adequately compare submitted work to my vision for a match. Even with that, I imagine many qualified applicants...so I will implore you to state in your email, if applicable, why you could not only program the site, but offer any personal experience that could be used to better my own ideas. My specific ideas and my direct email will be shared with those who apply.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

I know this Site can succeed with the right person coding. I also have Social Media specialists waiting in the wings to increase visibility when ready - unless you are that person also.
I look forward to hearing from you!
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

body:
I just got a new laptop and I'm pulling my hair out because I can't get the screen setup correctly.
The laptop screen shows way too bright and there must be something in my Windows 7 configuration that makes it so that I can't see highlights in certain drop-downs (I can show you this easily over Skype). However, my external monitor works just fine.

I'm confident that the problem isn't the screen itself (it actually looks pretty good) but rather there must be some Windows setting/adjustment that is goofed up.
If someone can Skype with me ... I'll share my screen and you can try to fix it.
I will only pay for a successful outcome, so please don't reply if you're not a pretty savvy IT person or otherwise very good at debugging Windows display settings through your experience, trial-error, etc.

For the right person... you'll probably see my screen and know exactly what the problem is and fix it in under 10 minutes. I'm thinking $25 is fair.
If you reply to this, please give me some indication of your likelihood to fix it/experience/etc. Craigslist often has a bunch of goofballs reply, so for the person out there that is the "real deal"... please give me some way to pick you from all the nutjobs. :-)

Thanks!
title: Fix my screen remotely over Skype

body:
Hi techies,

Unitek College in Fremont has an interesting challenge for you. We have an Epson Powerlite projector that is mounted at near-ceiling level. This projector is connected to a laptop that is continuously running a powerpoint slide show, 24 hours a day. We want the projector to turn on and off on a schedule, without human intervention. Basically, we want to turn it on at 6 PM, and turn it off at 10 PM every night. Note that simply using a timer switch to power it on and off does not work in this case. We need to send infrared commands to the projector on a schedule. NO HUMAN INTERVENTION.

It has been suggested to us to use X10 equipment and software to do this, or to use USB-UIRT and girder to send the infrared commands to the projector. If you are interested in doing this task using these methods (or other methods that you think will work), send us a brief plan, and a fixed price quote. If there is equipment to buy, we will pay for it. If you have questions, email us, we will do our best to answer. We are flexible on timings (evenings or weekends work, weekdays work too).
title: Tech challenge - get projector to turn on and off on schedule

If you love playing with computer technology - Win-PC, Ubuntu, tweaking OS / BIOS, making apps, installing applications, modding, etc. - this gig is for you!

We are a 6-year old CE/Tech company seeking a technologically-savvy, motivated, dependable individual to assist our product development, and with various technical, and logistical tasks. This position is a FT or PT position - and we are flexible in working around your schedule. Job duties are focused mainly on product development, supporting our customers, tweaking software, building and maintaining web apps, OS installation, hardware mods, and other administrative / office duties as assigned. Ideal for recent graduates or college students.

SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
* Must have a good PC hardware and Software experience (likes to play with innovative technology). Should have assembled PCs (from scratch) and should know each component in detail.
* Knowledge of Linux, and Win-OS . - Should have a good working knowledge of OS installations and modifying them. (We will quiz you on Linux)
* Experience in working in customer support is a PLUS.
* Knowledge of programming language: JAVA, C++ or PHP <-- pls. state this specifically in your resume/cover-letter.

YOU ARE AN IDEAL CANDIDATE IF YOU HAVE THESE QUALITIES:
* Independent problem solving skills and ability to resolve challenging scenarios.
* Have significant experience with Win-OS, Linux, / HTPC / XBMC on Linux platform.
* Computer Science / IT background a big PLUS.
* Excellent organizational skills - Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
* Ability to analyze incidents using previous experience and knowledge to resolve them without escalation.
* Excellent communication skills (written, listening, speaking).

Students from ITT-tech, NOVA, GMU, Virginia Tech etc. are encouraged to apply. If you have 3+yrs of PHP experience - we are definitely interested.

If you are passionate about computers, electronics and have good customer service skills, this is exactly the job for you!

If you desire to learn how a small tech company runs, contact us with your cover letter, resume, and references for further consideration.
We are located in Chantilly VA. You should have your own transportation for commute.

This is a ON-SITE, WEEKDAY job only. You can do Part-time (less than 40-hrs / week).
Do NOT apply if you are located more than 20miles from Chantilly, VA

Maintain knowledge of current SEM practices to develop and recommend new strategies. Support all efforts to meet marketing & organizational goals. Proven ability to optimize for organic search on the major search engines.
Strong familiarity with Social Media and Community Websites
Experience managing, tracking, and optimizing online marketing campaigns SEM and SEO
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

body:
Us: Very small, very high-powered company with a wide variety of interesting
technologies, an assortment of development languages, and some significant
development needs that we'd love to find a contractor or partner to deliver.
We'd be thrilled to open the door for a long-term relationship, with the right
engineer.

You: Very bright, very capable, results-oriented software engineer who groks
the need to deliver high quality code quickly, wants to solve interesting problems
nearly every day, and can't resist the challenge. Someone who has every
reason to have an ego the size of Texas, but actually is quick to admit
mistakes and happy to learn better ways to do things. Someone who just
cannot _not_ keep learning and growing.

We really don't care how many years of experience you have--10 years of
experience fixing bugs in enterprise Java likely wouldn't prepare you for
this environment. A few years of writing code in your basement might...if
you're open to learning better ways. We're happy to help round out the
right candidate with coaching and mentoring, but you have to demonstrate
the right stuff before we engage.

The right fit will likely be someone who has the following:
* Experience with three or more of the following:
- Unix/Linux/Solaris
- VBA
- ActionScript
- Microsoft Word development
- MySQL
- C#
- Javascript
- Micro-languages (sed/awk) and/or compiler development experience
- C++
- Tomcat/Java
- Drupal/PHP
- .NET, managed code, etc.
- Python
(Really, we use those and more...if learning a new language is
a challenge for you, this isn't the right fit.)
* Great communication skills (and you're not afraid to use them)
* Flexibility
* Resourcefulness
* A heartfelt understanding that any problem can be solved in a finite time
with the software that you write.
* Inability to grasp the phrases "I can't do that" or "I don't know if
I can do that"
* A thorough understanding of why "these are not the 'droids you're looking for"
is adequate for a complete response to a proposal or suggestion.

If you're interested, contact me directly. If you have a friend who might be interested,
please pass this message along.

Right now today, we have several short term contract projects which pay between
$500 and $1500 upon successful completion. If you deliver to our expectations
and the fit seems good, we have no end of other work that needs to be done.
Continuing to contract with someone who can deliver quickly would certainly
be possible...full-time employment with benefits isn't out of the question either.
No promises on anything, obviously, and until you're shown that you can deliver,
it's not a conversation that's worth having.

Principals only, please. If your response indicates you haven't read or understood
this message, you won't receive an answer.
title: Excellent software engineer wanted for multiple gigs

Bachelors Degree required

Description:
ePromos is looking for a Junior Web Developer to add to our technology team. As we get ready to ramp up a major project on our website, the Junior Developer would assist in the development of new features as well as be required to learn and maintain our legacy systems.

Responsibilities:
Perform maintenance and create new features for the company website.
Maintain in-house websites and add new features to assist our staff.
Work with our technology team and CEO in prioritizing projects.
Create time estimates for projects assigned to you.

Skills Required:
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to interact and communicate professionally with all levels of staff and management.
Willing to learn from Senior Developers and Management.

Education and Qualifications:
Must have a Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems/ Computer Science (or similar field).
1-5 years Web Development experience.
Strong understanding of PHP or JAVA/ JSP.
Experience with SugarCRM (a plus).
Based in Portland, OR Metro Area. Ability to work from home and meet with ePromos developers in Portland.

About ePromos:
Have you ever seen a baseball cap, golf ball or umbrella with a company logo? Then you've seen our products! We are leaders in the $19 billion promotional products industry. We are ePromos - the promo know-how people. Whether it's corporate gifts, tradeshow giveaways or awards, our personalized merchandise is used by tens of thousands of companies and organizations to promote themselves and drive home their message. In today's hectic world of information overload, tangible promotional products are one of the most effective forms of advertising. Our unique blend of technology and inspired employees creates a value proposition that keeps our satisfied customers coming back to us over and over again. In addition to our outstanding "promo know-how" our website, www.epromos.com has been recognized with eleven Best Website Awards from Promotional Productions Association International. We are also recognized as an Inc. 5000 company. We are a great team of fun loving, hard working professionals in a casual and creative work environment.

Compensation and Benefits:
Salary $40-50K commensurate with experience. An attractive, comprehensive benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, short term/long term disability, term life insurance, a 401(k) plan, paid vacation, and numerous company celebrations. We have been recognized as an ASI Best Places to Work Company.

We are looking to re-create an example of a component of our service prior to full development.

The initial component example we are looking for is outlined as follows.

We have 2 bank accounts.

We would like to associate a magstripe card to both accounts as follows:

We would like to swipe a magstripe card through a magstripe reader and software connected to a laptop as if we were conducting a transaction. We want to swipe the card through the reader, then prompted on the screen to input a value labeled "amount", we want to then press enter like a transaction. That value will be then recorded by the software on the laptop and/or relayed to an ach program that will automatically debit one account
2 x the value inputted on the laptop and credit the other account 2 x the value inputted on the laptop.

The swipe then value inputted on the laptop should have a "click to confirm" feature, and that click should automate and complete the ach 2x credit/2x debit process without any additional prompts or clicks, just like a credit card transaction.

We want to view and personally show this component online to our team.

Along with the link to the page where the card swipe, value input and execution of the ach transaction happens, we will need a home page with a link to this page. Aesthetic design template should be basic --w- logo and content that will be provided to you. The presentation is focused on function rather than image.

The magstripe card/reader/software is only to generate a value for the ach program via magstripe card, and can be any off the shelf product/program that completes this process.

Please contact Chris at 312-525-1021
title: Great Pay! Project for programmer -w- ach and magstripe exp.

Nous sommes la recherche de programmeurs, ayant de l'exprience dans la construction d'applications web en Python ou en PHP sur Linux

Vos tches consistent monter l'architecture et dvelopper les infrastructures et fonctionnalits de l'application sous votre responsabilit.

Qualits que nous cherchons chez les candidats:
  • passion et intrt: vous aimez ce que vous faites.

  • fiabilit et responsabilit: nous pouvons compter sur vous et la qualit de votre travail.

  • autonomie: vous avez le sens de l'initiative.

  • curiosit: vous lisez et restez la page. Vous essayez de nouveaux trucs.


Prrequis techniques:
  • Vous devrez travailler avec un Unix (Linux/BSD/MacOSX). Le seul moment o nous utilisons Windows ici est pour tester que Internet Explorer fonctionne bien sur les sites (mais ce n'est pas votre boulot). Vous DEVEZ tre familier avec Unix et l'avoir dans votre ordinateur de travail (qu'il soit fournit par la compagnie ou le votre).
  • vous devez tre assez bien familier avec les approches recommandes au dveloppement web en PHP ou en Python. Vous devriez tre capable d'installer et configurer un serveur web, le language de votre choix et ses modules et extentions.

  • une comprhension solide de l'approche au dveloppement en MVC tel qu'appliqu au web.

  • dispos travailler avec un framework (une exprience avec Zend ou un framework web composite en Python serait un atout).

  • une exprience sommaire en JavaScript/jQuery.

  • une exprience sommaire du HTML/CSS.


Exprience:
Nous nous attendons ce que les candidats soient familiers avec un ensemble de pratiques et concepts spcifiques leur position. Par exemple, les programmeurs web devraient tre capables de rpliquer des fonctionnalits communment trouves dans un environnement CRUD, tel que les cms.

Description de la compagnie:
Nous sommes une agence de dveloppement situe au centre-ville de Montral (proche des mtros Place-des-arts et McGill). La compagnie offre primordialement le dveloppement web comme service.

Nos politiques de travail sont plutt relaxes, nous priorisons les rsultats plutt que les processus. Notre intention n'est pas de surveiller vos moindres mouvements et nous sommes plutt soucieux de respecter votre temps et espace. Notre approche est de vous confier des responsabilits et de nous en remettre votre bon jugement pour l'accomplissement d'un certain nombre de tches. En d'autres termes, vous avez la libert et la flexibilit de dcider o et comment vous tes l'aise de travailler.

Pour arriver ce niveau de confiance, nous devons nous assurer de nous associer avec des gens honntes, minutieux, dvous et passionns par leur art.


FAQs:

  • Puis-je travailler de la maison?
    Comme l'indique l'annonce, vous travaillez de la faon qui convient le mieux votre productivit. Cependant, un des objectifs de la compagnie est de crer un environnement o des personnes partageant des intrts communs peuvent se retrouver et se motiver mutuellement en profitant de la prsence et des expriences les unes des autres. Vous n'avez donc pas de relles obligations d'tre physiquement prsent, mais il faut gardez en tte qu'tre considr membre de l'quipe est votre responsabilit sociale.

    Il y aura aussi certaines priodes o une collaboration plus troite sera ncessaire et pendant laquelle vous devrez tre trs disponible, que ce soit distance ou physiquement.

  • Je n'habite pas Montral, puis-je appliquer?

    Comme l'indique la question prcdante notre prfrence va aux candidats locaux, mais si vous pensez avoir des qualits qui compensent pour la distance, a vaut le coup d'essayer. Notre collaboration pourrait par contre tre sur une base contractuelle pour un dbut.

  • J'ai de l'exprience en C/C++/Java, puis-je appliquer?
    Vous tes certainement trs dou avec ces langages, mais en ce moment nous avons rellement besoin de programmeurs immdiatement oprationnels en PHP ou Python.



Autres considrations:
Si vous avez eu la patience de lire cette annonce jusqu'ici, a veut dire que vous avez fais attention nos besoins et ne vous tes pas juste empress de nous lancer votre cv aprs le premier paragraphe. Un signe que vous connaissez la valeur du temps et tes soigneux de ne pas le faire perdre aux autres. Vos efforts mritent un coup de pouce pour aider votre candidature. Le voici: il est habituel dans notre domaine d'enfler son cv de listes interminables de technologies, que la familiarit soit profonde ou sommaire. tant la personne qui ait crit cette annonce et qui tudiera votre application, sachez que a me m'intresse pas de savoir que:

  • vous connaissez cent langages.

  • vous pouvez crire des extensions pour Word, Excel et Powerpoint en assembleur.

  • vous tes un administrateur Windows du future.

  • vous tes un guru en buzzwordOfTheMonth().

  • vous avez fait des tonnes de petits projets scolaires, ayant des noms palpitants, mais qui ne servent rien dans la vraie vie.


Alors svp, soyons d'accord de couper dans le gras et montrez moi ce qui est intressant de votre candidature

  • votre exprience web en PHP ou Python

  • vos projets raliss sur l'une ou l'autre de ces plateformes

body:
We're looking for full-time server-side web developers, with experience in the development of web applications built using PHP or Python on Linux.

Your tasks will be to develop the architecture and build the infrastructure and functionalities of the application under your responsibility.

Qualities we're seeking in candidates:
  • passion and interest: you love what you do.

  • reliability and responsibility: we can count on you and the quality of your work.

  • autonomy: you can take initiative.

  • curiosity: you care to expand on your own skillset and are willing to try different approaches.


Technical requirements:
  • You need to be working with an Unix (Linux/BSD/MacOSX). The only moment we use Windows is to test IE on the front-end (not your job). You NEED to be familiar with Unix and have it installed on the computer you'll be using to work (whether company provided or your own).
  • good familiarity of web development standards in PHP or Python. You should be capable of installing and configuring a web server, the programming language's libraries and modules.

  • solid understanding of the MVC paradigm as applied to the web.

  • willingness to work with a framework (experience with Zend or a best-of-breed Python framework would be an asset).

  • some cursory experience in JavaScript/jQuery.

  • some cursory understanding of HTML/CSS.


Experience:
We expect candidates to be familiar with a variety of development patterns as they apply to their position. For example, web developers should have the ability to replicate features often found in a CRUD environment such as a cms.

Company Description:
We are a development agency located downtown Montreal (near Metro Place des Arts and Metro McGill). The company primarily provides web development as a service.

Our work policies are pretty lax as we tend to focus more on results than on processes. We don't intend to watch your every moves and would like to respect your time and space. This works by us entrusting you with responsibilities and relying on your best judgment to achieve a certain amount of tasks. In other words, you get to enjoy enough freedom and flexibility to decide how and where you work best.

In order for us to reach that level of trust, we need to work with honest people, with a level of minutiae, dedication and passion for their craft.


FAQs:

  • Does that mean I can work from home?

    Like the ad says, you do what works best for your productivity at any given time. However, we're also aiming to create an environment where people can be motivated and inspired by feeding off each others presence and experiences. You're certainly not obliged to be at the office all the time, but keep in mind that part of being in a team involves some social responsibilities.

    Also, there will be times during which some knowledge transfer will be necessary. It's usually better to be in-house.

  • I don't live in Montreal, can I apply?

    You will need to have compelling qualities to compensate for the distance. Our collaboration might also initially be on a contractual basis.

  • I have experience programming in C/C++/Java, can I apply?

    You probably are pretty skilled with those languages, but at this moment we have very little use for them and really need people that can be up and running in PHP or Python from day 1.


Other considerations:
If you've read this post all the way down here, it means that you somewhat paid attention to our need and didn't just stop after the first paragraph to pitch us your cv. A sign that you know the value of time and care not to waste others'. For this, you deserve a special reward, that shall come in the form of a tip. Here it is: it's customary in our industry to fill a cv with endless lists of technologies that one is "aware of", regardless of depth of knowledge. As the person who wrote this ad and will be reviewing your application, know that I don't care if:

  • you know a hundred different programming languages.

  • you can write Word, Excel and Powerpoint extensions in assembly.

  • you are a Windows sysadmin from the future.

  • you're a buzzwordOfTheMonth() guru.

  • you did tons of little academic projects, with fancy names, that are pretty useless in real life.


So please, let's just agree to trim the fat and let me see what I do care to see

  • your PHP or Python relevant web experience

  • projects on any of these platforms that you've done

  • experience using Unix



Save the rest to wow me during the interview.

Thank you
title: Experienced PHP or Python programmer

body:
Our Company:
Hey Apollo LLC is an early stage internet startup. I have to remain vague around business details at this point but, at its core, our product will be a vertical search destination for users seeking relevant service providers. Those who qualify will be asked to sign an NDA for this reason, prior to next-round interviews.

The Role and Responsibilities:
I am looking for a web developer to build the site 'from scratch' (some template use may be acceptable) . This is the first piece in what will become a much larger site with many more features. I am looking for a developer with a vision and excellent knowledge of clean, flexible coding.

What You Will Create:
A search engine for users to find and research relevant information and services.

There are basically two elements to the site:
1) Service providers (businesses) must able to create and maintain their own information "pages", much like a facebook page. Developer will need to create a database to manage the service providers' information pages.

2) Users will search for these service providers from a homepage and have those service providers appear in search results, ranked by relevance. The user can then click on the result to open the service provider's page.

A functionally similar example (different content/users): www.goby.com - PLEASE VISIT BEFORE RESPONDING and include in your application what Goby's logo is.

Requirements & Education:
Experience with search technologies like Lucene, Sphinx or others
Experience as lead web developer
Strong knowledge of PHP, HTML, CSS, XML and MySQL
Experience using CMS platforms (Drupal, Joomla, Ruby on Rails)
Creative, with a vision and eye towards growth

Compensation:
Hourly (between $20-25) with an agreed upfront timeframe. Compensation is negotiable and WILL BE A FACTOR in deciding whether or not to hire (hey, it's a startup on a budget). I am open to developer working from home, though regular in-person meetings will be conducted.

Timeframe:
To begin immediately upon selecting developer. Looking to have workable product within 6-8 weeks.

Note:
This is a really exciting project and I'm eager to bring someone on to what will be an impressive business. MUST SUBMIT PORTFOLIO OF PREVIOUS WORK along with your resume. All the best.
title: Vertical Search Engine Web Developer

body:
I run a small mixed-shore software development and IT consulting company. I work on both the LAMP and Microsoft stack and things are going well! My company offers Web Design and Development, CMS (Joomla, Drupal, Concrete5, etc...) installation, configuration and customization, eCommerce (Magento, osCommerce), etc etc etc. My company is a little over a year old and is an LLC. I'm also slowly setting up to begin mobile device development (Android, iPhone, etc) [I'm already a registered developer with Google and Apple.]

I currently work out of a home office as all of my resources are remote contractors.

I've built up a stable client base and am currently in the process of setting up for expansion (hiring project coordinators, interviewing new developers, etc.)

My focus has primarily been on the LAMP/Open Source side of the business, and this has caused me some problems as I have a couple of clients trying to throw .NET work at me. One of my clients told me today that due to my work history with them, they're considering contracting their .NET development work to me - within the next couple of weeks!

This is great news BUT - I don't have any highly available .NET developers on my team!

My average client is the small to medium business who has unique business problems/requirements that a typical developer can't handle. My clients appreciate me because they can give me an overview of what they need, I ask the right questions, and I can deliver with a minimum of maintenance. A summary of this would be "solutions architect/mind reader".


I need sharp, quick .NET developers. Not necessary senior level, but quick learners who code in their sleep and sometimes work through the weekend knee deep in source because they love it.

Does this sound like you, or perhaps someone on your team? If so, please contact me, as I have work that we need to get started on IMMEDIATELY and I want to tell my client that I'm ready for whatever they want to throw my way. I could also use some help on the PM / client management side.

Required Skills:

.NET 2.0 through 4.0 (most applications will be .NET 3.5)
LINQ
WCF
WPF
(X)HTML/CSS/Javascript - AJAX
jQuery
Multitier Applications
Desktop Applications
Web Applications
Web Services (building and consuming), REST, SOAP, JSON
SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2010
Code Documentation
Good Spelling
Ability to switch / handle multiple projects concurrently


Nice To Have:
cURL
Screen Scraping
SSO, Security & RBAC Concepts

Interested? Please send me a message and let's start talking.

Generic replies will be ignored. If you are a developer seeking contract work, you must include your hourly rate. If you are an owner interested in a partnership or relationship, please include some information about your clients/projects and what you're looking for.
title: Seeking .NET Developer / Possible Partnership

body:
We're a small (actually, well nigh microscopic) startup, looking for a Java developer to finish work on an exciting new social media site. And by exciting, we mean there's a non-zero chance that this thing could go big. And by big, we mean that Justin Timberlake may end up portraying you in a movie.

"People TELL me I look like Justin Timberlake," you say?

"There HAS to be a catch!" you say?

Well, there is. We have no money.

Yet!

Though we, the current stakeholders, have busted tail bringing multiple startups to success previously, we're still in the pre-angel investing phase on this bad boy. After many months of cheap-beer-fueled evenings filled with planning, design, development, and occasional foosball (one of us is actually semi-pro. Take THAT.), we've gotten the site well on its way to being ready to pitch to our stable of investors. (We keep them next to the ponies).

And that's where you come in.

We need a Java developer who is interested in getting in on something early, and getting a sizable equity share, before the startup even goes to investors. And not just any Java developer, we need someone who can stare down servlets and make them wet their pantalones. Because pants sound better in Spanish.

The gig is basically taking what our previous (awesome) developer has done, and pile awesome on top of that. After a few more layers of awesome sauce, we'll be ready for a public beta launch. Lots of potential, but other than the fun of putting it all together, it's all delayed gratification.

This probably isn't for you. But if it is, we need to talk.

// Basic Skills
Strong Java web application developer, including JSP/Servlet technology and JSTL.Strong knowledge of front-end web development technologies, including CSS, Javascript, and Ajax.
Object-Oriented Analysis & Design (OOA&D)
Working knowledge of Model-View-Controller (MVC) web frameworks.
Ability to design database schemas and optimize queries.

Tomcat - application server
MySQL - database
Lucene - search engine
JQuery - javascript library
Log4J - java logging
Stripes - MVC web framework
Velocity - templating engine

More details available after you sign a fancy NDA, and sit down over a beer with us.

Also, all replies must include the word "Pantalones" in the subject line, preferably in an insightful and/or humorous way. That lets us know you have a pulse, aren't a spam bot and actually read to the bottom of this post.

body:
Pay-per-Click Campaign Manager --

We are currently seeking an experienced Pay per Click (PPC) Campaign Manager to join our virtual in-house marketing team. This is a leadership position, in that you will be required to work independently and prove positive results through your work. The position also requires that you work effectively with other team members in SEO, email marketing, web development, and other disciplines. The ideal candidate will possess at least a working knowledge of each of these marketing channels in order to effectively communicate and collaborate. 

The PPC Campaign Manager will be responsible for the management and optimization of multiple paid campaigns for dozens of individual web properties.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

*Manage multiple PPC campaigns across all Search Engines (Google, Yahoo/Bing, Facebook, and others as necessary)

*Achieve growing ROI for all Ad spend on a regular basis

*Ensure optimal campaign performance on each search engine

*Improve current campaigns and ad groups, develop new campaigns and ad groups, and eliminate underperforming elements within each PPC account

*Analyze Clicks and Conversion data, ad expenses and ROI

*In-depth audience research for effective keyword research and segmentation

*Ad copy writing and improvement

*Landing page assessment and improvement (by assisting the marketing team in optimizing design, layout, and optimization for PPC effectiveness)

*Creating multiple ad copy variations and landing page versions for split testing

*Regularly research PPC best practices and put them into play as necessary

*Consistently analyze Click Through, Cost per Click, and conversion data as far down as keyword level, and work to improve all areas on a regular basis

*Identify and present new opportunities to continually add to PPC success

*Creating PPC traffic, ROI, and conversion effectiveness reports for management.

*Provide support to the online marketing team.

Other duties as assigned

Education, Experience, Skills, and Abilities:
2+ years Experience managing multiple accounts across various search engines

Bachelor's Degree in computer or marketing related discipline is preferred

Up to date knowledge of current PPC platforms, trends and strategies

Expert knowledge of Google Analytics

Proficiency in building and managing Excel spreadsheet analysis

Ability to multi-task and manage parallel activities

Solid understanding of the role PPC plays in the overall search marketing strategy

Excellent report writing, analytical and project management skills

Positive attitude

strong work ethic

The ability to work independently is critical in this position as it is a telecommuting position that must prove continual results. A self-starter with a drive to succeed and great attention to details will perform best in this position
title: Pay Per Click / Online Marketing Manager

body:
We have a great opportunity for a Java Programmer who wants to do the following:

-Willing to accept an aggressive pay plan as your reward for hard work
-Stay living right where you are, in Sacramento or move to the Bay Area, your choice with some modest relocation money if you want to move

Does this description sound like you?

We are a small consulting company based in Campbell California. We have a number of long term clients and partners who need help with modules, plug-ins and apps for industry standard products that we work with day in and day out. Some of this code will be distributed into user communities free of charge and some of it will serve as the backbone for some full-on applications that our company will also sell.

This is an opportunity for you to make an IMMEDIATE impact on our business, an impact that will earn you the respect of your team and a generous share of our quarterly profit sharing plan as well.

If we could have the ideal Java Programmer candidate, he or she would probably look technically like this:

3 to 5 years of working with Java
Development experience programming with GWT (or Java + Swing)
Experience with AJAX Client/Server Communications
Knowledge of CSS
Knowledge of JavaScript

Professionally they would have these characteristics:

A very organized person who is superb at multi-tasking
An independent, self starter who needs very minimal supervision
A detail oriented person who thinks clearly and produces accurate work product
Someone who listens and communicates well with all "flavors" of clients and team members
Someone who displays a positive, can-do attitude

This is a full-time position, with appropriate benefits, support and again, the pay that a great programmer both needs and deserves.

If you elect to stay put, living in your current non-bay area geography, there would be some travel to the bay area as well as client sites in other US locations, but we don't think it would be too much, not too bad!

If the above fit you as a hardworking professional, please respond to this ad with your resume, we'll take a look and see if we should talk face to face!
