body:
Sell Website Services for Small, Local Website Company

We are a small web design, development, hosting, and online marketing company located in St. Louis. We are currently looking for a motivated, disciplined, self-starter to sell our website services to individuals, businesses, and organizations. This is an outside sales position and you can work from home or your virtual office. You will report directly to the owner of the company.

From past experience, we have found that sales representatives with SOME experience tend to find website-related sales relatively easy compared to other industries because people and companies need websites and online services. This job is probably not for you if you are a very experienced sales manager or a sales person with decades of experience. Typically, a person with approximately 1-5 years of sales experience tends to be most suitable for this opportunity.

The responsibilities and requirements below represent an ideal candidate in our minds. We are somewhat flexible depending on the individual's charisma, personality, and motivation. For example, one of our most successful sales people has been a fitness trainer who sold our services as a side job despite not having the traditional characteristics of a sales person.

General Responsibilities

  • Develop and cultivate leads on your own using existing connections/pipelines or through online and offline sources of your choice.
  • Prospect, consult, and negotiate with local merchants, businesses, organizations, and individuals. Sell services related to:
    • Web Design
    • Web Development
    • Email Marketing
    • SMS Marketing
    • Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
    • Hosting
    • Additional specialized products that we develop

Requirements:

  • 1 to 5 years of sales experience is preferred
  • Comfortable with technology. Basic knowledge of websites, online marketing, and social media. By "basic" we mean that you understand the following:
    • What websites are and how businesses use them.
    • For a professional website a designer must design it and a developer must develop it.
    • Websites are hosted on a server and businesses have to pay for Hosting.
    • People want their websites to appear at the top of search engine results and this usually requires businesses to hire another company to make this happen.
    • The basics of posting on Facebook and Twitter.
    • Businesses can increase sales through Email Marketing and/or SMS Marketing (a.k.a. Text Message Marketing).
  • Detail-oriented, positive attitude, and energetic.
  • Experience canvassing and cold-calling into various types of local businesses.
  • Self-motivated with good communication skills.
  • Prior experience working from home or from a virtual office is strongly preferred.
  • Maintain deadlines and work consistently toward personal sales goals.

Compensation and Work Hours:

  • Hours are flexible. You work on your own time and at your own pace. You set your own sales goals. How much you sell is completely up to you. However, you are expected to bring in new customers regularly at margins that are profitable for us.
  • Available positions are independent contractors (1099) only.
  • 20% Commission. This is a commission only position. Top performers will receive additional bonuses. Commission averages $400 per basic website and $700 for an ecommerce website.
  • Considerable room for growth, as our company is always introducing additional services and partnerships.

If Interested:

  • Please email us your CV or work history in PDF or Word Format
  • Make sure that you include your contact information (phone #, email address) and relevant work experience.
title: ► B2B / B2C Website Sales

body:
Request for Qualifications
Project:
The Cultural Council of Santa Cruz County (www.ccscc.org) is seeking a firm to complete a full redesign of its website to more clearly reflect its mission, and to represent the vibrancy and breadth of the community of artists and arts organizations it supports. Desired site will include a simplified site map/architecture, social media integration, and dynamic navigation and roll over menus, video and other interactive components. Basic updates and maintenance to be performed in house; recommended platform must be easy to use. Project to be completed in 8-12 week timeline from approval.

QUALIFICATIONS:
This project will require the firm or individual to have the following qualifications:
Experience designing and programming a website from start to finish
Familiarity with and passion for the arts and the community of Santa Cruz
Description of your process and work style
Experience working with non-profit or public entities

SUBMITTAL REQUIREMENTS: Responses to this RFQ must include the following information:
A cover letter/statement of interest indicating the firm's interest in the project and highlighting its qualifications to perform this project
A summary of firm's experience, highlighting the firm's experience working with or passion for the arts
Statement of qualifications, including related experience with similar types of projects and specific qualifications or resumes of key team members
Two references relating to completed web design projects
Responses must be limited to no more than three (3) pages, excluding specific project examples (please include links to live work samples where possible), and references

PROPRIETARY PROPOSAL MATERIAL: Any proprietary information revealed in the proposal should, therefore, be clearly identified as such.

EVALUATION CRITERIA: Evaluations will be based on the criteria listed below:
Experience of firm with similar projects;
Experience of proposed project team and key team members
Overall quality of statement of qualifications and compatibility with CCSCC's process and work style
Ability of firm to start immediately and deliver within a short time period

RFQ Deadline: 6:00PM September 14, 2011.

QUESTIONS: Questions regarding this project may be directed to Sally Green via e-mail at sally@ccscc.org

We will schedule meetings with firms that look like a good fit for our project. If selected, project details, budget, timeline, etc. to be discussed at initial meeting.

body:
Hello,

Looking for a freelance Drupal Developer to:

  1. Troubleshoot and resolve issues with a current, customized drupal 6 implementation, including functional issues and theme/css issues.
  2. Provide services to migrate several dozen knowledge-base articles in XML (Dita) format into Drupal as book page nodes
  3. Provide services to optimize drupal implementation for best SEO effectiveness.

body:
**NOTE: Solo/Independent Contractors Only -- Local to Columbus, OH Only**

This is a small project relating to the Industrial manufacturing, maintenance, and parts industry.

We need to create a requirements document for a Wordpress plugin that will display flow control valves & sleeves (the products) and allow a customer to configure custom options (size, line pressure, air control pressure, etc) which are slightly different for each product. Once this document clearly explains what needs to be built, it will be posted on a software outsourcing website for the actual development phase of this project.

At this point we have an interactive HTML demo (customer facing, no admin/backend screens) built in Axure RP that can be used as a guide to explain how each product should be displayed to the customer. The problem is that it does not show the dynamic lookups and correlations that need to take place behind the scenes to populate each drop down menu. It further doesn't show session state (?) and/or what options a customer has selected in previous steps. Without this explanation the demo is relatively worthless - this is what will need to be determined first and then written up correctly in the requirements document.

There are additional requirements that we can explain as to how the plugin should function such as plugin installation, product/properties/menu/display setup, XML import/export, and shortcode embedding within a Wordpress page/post.

Requirements:

You *MUST* have strong experience with developing Wordpress plugins as there are ways in which the Wordpress platform can be leveraged to manage the plugin on the backend. Additional features will also be highly likely in the future, therefore version 1.0 needs to be spec'd out properly with this in mind.

You *MUST* be local to the Central Ohio area for in-person meetings so that we can give you an overview of the demo and explain how various products, data, and functions relate to each other - then have you outline and write out a spec that a developer can then work from independently.

The final deliverable will be a document that can be uploaded/attached to an online project posting. Additional deliverables may be asked for - such as database schemas, etc. -- if determined as necessary during project discussions.

If this sounds like a project you would like to work on contact us with your Wordpress development experience, general range on cost/rate, time estimates, and any other questions you may have.

**NOTE: Solo/Independent Contractors Only -- Local to Columbus, OH Only**
title: Requirements Document for Product Inventory Wordpress Plugin

body:
Our Core Values

Customer Advocacy

We believe that big banks put their self-interests above the interests of their customers. We want to change that. Amyx was created as a counterculture to Wall Street. We believe in customer advocacy. We believe that our total solution, fee structure and support model should reinforce this notion of putting customers first.

 

Building Strong Families

We believe that a for-profit business can also have a not-for-profit heart. We believe that it is our responsibility to give back to the community and society-at-large.

We believe that everyone deserves an opportunity to succeed. We believe that opportunity first starts at home with a cohesive, nurturing family. A supportive family nurtures the interests and passions of their children to realize their fullest potential. Amyx aspires to equip families to build a brighter, stronger future through sound family financial management that foster the most opportunities for their children to succeed in life.

 

Work Ethics

We believe in hard work. We believe that our team members should be self-motivated, intrinsically driven, and accountable for their work. We believe that productivity is a fine balance of working smart and working hard to produce meaningful results. Our team members should already come with this value system.

 

Business Sustainability

We believe in building a sustainable business. We are interested in building a built-to-last company that will become the new hallmark of financial services. As stewards of the business, our leadership and team members are expected to manage the financial metrics to ensure a healthy, vibrant business concern that is profitable and prudent with operational and capital spending.

If you share our core values, please read on.

 

Senior Software Engineer

Amyx has an immediate opening for a highly-motivated and experienced software engineer that can provide a technical leadership role to the engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in architecting and developing high-volume, highly-scalable, consumer focused web applications and services.

Responsibilities

Technical design and development of the core platform to support product requirements and business objectives.

Work with product management to break down requirements into tasks and timelines.

Provide leadership to the rest of the engineering team.

Help drive the overall architecture and technical requirements.

Qualifications

5-7 years of prior experience.

BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

Experience with PHP 5 in the LAMP environment.

Experience with MySQL critical.

Experience with CSS/HTML/Javascript/AJAX (experience with Mootools a plus).

Experience developing web applications that use the MVC Framework.

Prior experience with social media, networking sites.

Prior experience with online advertising models and platforms.

Experience with Agile development methods.

Talent for architecture and passion for development.

Experience working with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

Prior experience with account aggregation technologies such as Yodlee a bonus.

 

Software Engineer

Amyx has an immediate opening for a highly-motivated software engineer with strong analytical skills that can provide an immediate impact to the development team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in developing consumer focused web applications and services.

Responsibilities

Design and implement key features of the core platform and applications to support product requirements and business objectives.

Assist in design and architecture of the core platform and applications.

Assist front end engineers with the development of the user interfaces.

QA and performance testing.

Qualifications

3-5 years of prior experience.

BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

Experience with PHP 5 in the LAMP environment.

Experience with CSS/HTML/Javascript/AJAX (experience with Mootools a plus).

Experience developing web applications that use the MVC Framework.

Prior experience with social media, networking sites.

Prior experience with online advertising models and platforms.

Experience with Agile development methods.

Talent for architecture and passion for development.

Experience working with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

 

Interested candidates should submit a resume and a cover letter to advocate@amyx.co.

Compensation is in the form of company stock options and upon investor funding, salary that commensurate with experience and capabilities.
title: Senior Software Engineer

body:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.motionmathgames.com

Build the game suite that will transform learning and inspire kids around the world. As a founding member of the Motion Math development team, your decisions, energy, and ability to master new technologies will greatly impact the future of our company. If you want to work extremely hard, make learning more effective and more joyous, and are ready to have the best time of your professional career, keep reading.

Requirements
• Master of iOS.     
• Experience building complex published apps with dynamic interactive user experiences.     
• Use of numerous iOS frameworks beyond UIKit (MapKit, Core Animation, MediaPlayer, Core Data, Core Graphics, AddressBook, Calendar Kit).     
• Thorough understanding of the intricacies of core animation across different iOS devices. (We will ask you lots of questions about memory management!)
• Insatiable curiosity about designs across all categories of the App Store and new Apple frameworks as they come out. 
• Experience with and commitment to modern development techniques (TDD, scrum, pair programming, performance testing and tuning, etc).
• Ability to quickly prototype, and then return to the code, refactor, and build something very solid and modular.
• Demonstrable initiative, leadership, and communication skills.
• Degree in Computer Science or related field.

Bonus points
• Expertise in OpenGL
• Experience with physics or gaming engines on iOS (Box2D, Corona, etc.)
• Experience with mobile gaming and/or education.
• Participation with the larger professional Apple/Cocoa/Mac community
• Experience with other mobile platforms (Android, Symbian, etc)

Competitive pay, great equity, health insurance, a professional development budget, and the opportunity of a lifetime. Title and responsibilities negotiable depending on experience.

About us
Motion Math creates fun mobile learning games that let kids play with numbers. Our award-winning first product, conceived at the Stanford School of Education, leveraged iPhone and iPad accelerometers to make fraction estimation fun and physical; our second product was released in August to rave reviews, promotion by Apple, and reached #4 in the Education category. We're based a block from BART in downtown SF, backed by a world-class group of angel investors, including Mitch Kapor and Dave McClure, and we've been featured in TechCrunch, Wired, and the WSJ. More importantly: kids, parents, and teachers love our products. Our founders have experience in enterprise software development, media production, and teaching. www.motionmathgames.com

π! 1000!
Know someone who's right for this job? We're offering a π * $1000 – that’s right, $3,141.59 – referral reward. 
Details: http://motionmathgames.com/?p=925

To apply: Apply to jacob@motionmathgames.com
title: Motion Math: Lead iOS Game Developer

body:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

We are looking for an engineer to join our team to help get our first iPad application into the Apple app store and take us beyond version 1.0 and then to other devices/platforms. Position is virtual so no need to be based out of NYC where our office is located.

Our system is made up of (Java/SmartFoxServer) + (MySQL + nginx + Ruby on Rails) so we are specifically looking for someone with experience in the following:

- Objective C/iOS (a must)
- Ruby on Rails (a must)
- Java (nice to have)

SKILLS:

- Experience with mobile development (resource management++)
- Strong object oriented programming and design principles
- MVC
- Source control
- Agile
- Verbal/written communication skills

HELPFUL EXPERIENCE:

- SmartFox Server experience
- RESTful web services

ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

TV Dinner is a next generation social television platform that uses real-time interactions and game mechanics to provide a unique social experience around television. One of the platform's chief qualities is that it turns television into an event. Unlike Twitter and other social television startups, TV Dinner lets users express themselves with rich media items called Nibbles. These items currently take the form of comments, poll questions, and captioned images, and they will soon include a wider range of content types and feedback. All of these features combine to offer users an experience that goes beyond simple text and check-ins.

We have a talented four-person team in place and several quality contracting parties involved. Our venture is funded, and we're excited about our potential for growth.

body:
I ran an ad last week, and got quite a few responses, but I think that I must have given the impression that we were a Fortune 500 Company. We are a small growing business, but still small.

Read the information here and please advise if you are interested.

Background: We have a small firm that provides contracted services to the legal industry using independent contractors. We bill our clients and pay our contractors fees based upon the amount charged, and keep a portion for ourselves. We utilize a vertical software package leased from and remotely supported by the developer. The software includes modules for scheduling and billing, and contractor payments modules, as well as a web module that allows our clients the ability (via the web) to schedule as well as access documents prepared for them by us. The software includes both server and workstation components, which we currently run on the same machine under XP with SQL Server Express 2008. We run a peer-to-peer network; router is CISCO WRVS4400N. We have 5 static IP addresses.

Our intentions are:
1. To move from a peer-to-peer network, to a server based network running MS 2000/2003/2008 Server (our existing vertical package software will support either), along with SQL Server 2000, 2005, or 2008.

In that regard, what we'd like from you as part of your services is a recommendation of new server hardware and software (from choices noted above) which we will independently acquire (you'll be welcome to seperately bid on that, too, if you do that) and the appropriate introduction, installation and integration of the server into our network. Please note that our vertical software developer will migrate their software and related files to the new server, once it is properly installed.

2. As noted, we run a web site and it is also installed on our currently main XP machine. We want to make sure that IP settings are configured correctly with new server co so that it, runs properly.

3. We want you to provide recommendations for appropriate security hardware and/or software.

4. We currently have a network attached storage server, but not sure it is most effeciently configured (Netgear NV+ with 4 1TB drives). We'd like you to review current configuration and help us make choices about the best setup (or required changes).

5. Separately, we'll probably want to discuss an ongoing retainer for maintenance consulting.

If you have any questions in this regard, please advise. If you are still interested, please respond by Friday. We will contact you to discuss further. ...if you are able to, please give me an idea of approximately where you think the services noted above will end up, cost wise.

Thanks for your interest.

body:
Seattle Publishing
Programming Internship
We do three things at Seattle Publishing: we publish the Bicycle Paper covering all things cycling in the Pacific Northwest, we produce custom publications for many local wholesalers, and we build Gutenberg Publishing Systems which allow our clients to easily manage their data for both print and digital publications. Being a part of our programming department means supporting our past solutions, contributing to current projects, and researching the latest and greatest to keep us abreast of technological waves. We're a small shop that accomplishes big things by always striving to work smarter rather than harder. Programming is key to our success!

Who Are We Looking For?
We're looking for honest and enthusiastic developers who are eager to learn--and teach--new things. We expect an incoming intern will have a solid, not necessarily deep, understanding of both front-end and back-end web development; semantic (X)HTML, CSS, Javascript, Ruby on Rails and MySQL are the primary tools we choose to use. Being comfortable in a text editor is a must--you'll get no Dreamweaver here! Our past work has revolved largely around FileMaker databases while we see our future shifting toward the Cappuccino JS framework. Experience in these technologies is a plus; being open to learning them is a must.

What Do We Expect?
We expect you to be as committed to us as we are to you. Both we and our clients are heavily invested in our projects, and if we bring you in as part of our crew, we expect serious commitment and a willingness to work as a team member. The internship is part-time for 12 weeks, 20 hours per week. We're flexible in how those hours get fulfilled in our 8:30AM--5PM, Monday--Friday business week. If you are currently enrolled in a college program for which your participation in the internship could earn you school credit, we are happy to oblige; just let us know during the application process and understand that your school requirements are separate from our requirements.

What's In It For You?
The internship is unpaid, though we care greatly about our interns' compensation. This isn't the kind of internship where you'll get stuck with boring, menial tasks; you will be developing systems around which people's jobs depend; you will be working on honest-to-goodness, live websites; you will be making a difference. At the end of it all, you will walk away with valuable experience and solid portfolio pieces. And all seriousness aside, we think we're a pretty fun group to work with. We enjoy what we do, and are always looking to grow the Seattle Publishing family!

Application: To apply for this position, submit a cover letter, resume and portfolio by e-mail, fax or mail to:
E-mail: reply to this posting
Fax: 206-903-8565
Mail: 68 S Washington, Seattle, WA 98104
title: Programming Internship - Fall 2011

body:
Our small, Austin-based medical claim billing company is hiring a developer to write a screen scraping app using C# and WatiN (or similar). You will can work remotely from anywhere in the US, but you do need to be available for daily status updates on the phone.

Start Date: As Soon As Possible

Project Duration: Approximately 1 month

Pay Rate: Based on experience. Desired hourly rate MUST be included in your response to this ad for consideration. All responses without a desired hourly rate included will not be considered.

Essential Skills:
Expert skills in C# and screen scraping (ideally using WatiN, though we will consider non-WatiN solutions).
At least some proven experience using the Entity Framework and LINQ with SQL Server 2008 as that is how we access our SQL Server database.
Basic SQL Server admin skills using SSMS to manage SQL Server, and a solid grasp of database concepts.
Excellent spoken and written English skills. We will be writing a lot of emails back and forth, and we will also be speaking on the phone at least once daily for up to an hour to hash out various approaches to the challenges of this project as we encounter technical obstacles.

In Your Response Email: Include your desired hourly rate and your relevant skills. Emails with only resumes attached will not be considered. In fact, resumes are relatively unimportant. We are mostly interested in a brief description of why your skills would match the job at hand.

Project Overview:
Our small medical claim billing company currently submits Medicaid medical claims from medical providers to a State Medicaid program via EDI files. The turnaround time on submitting claims and getting feedback on the payment status of these claims is currently at least 24 hours using the state's batch EDI upload/download system.

The State has recently developed a very user-unfriendly site based on DotNetNuke (an ASP.NET-based content management system) that has much quicker turnaround. Our company has full access to this secure site, but it is painfully time-consuming to use manually. It is a slow site with a terrible user interface.

To improve our customer service, we would like to allow our customers to continue using our site as they always have to enter their claim data. However, on the back end we want to create an application that logs into the new state site (if a current logged in session does not exist), reads claim entry information from our database (provider, patient, service line information) and submits it via the site. On a scheduled basis, this app would also log into the state site (if a current logged in session does not exist), retrieve the status of any pending claims, and update the database with this status information. The app will also on a scheduled basis update our database with provider and patient data gathered from the site.

This project will require quite a fairly thorough reverse-engineering of the site to be scraped. The site seems to rely heavily on cookies, so being able to analyze what navigation elements to expect or not expect based on current cookie values will be essential. Also, an understanding of thread management will be important as we will probably need to manage multiple browser sessions to in order to process entries and queries more quickly than serial entry will allow.

Be sure to read the instructions above for what to include in your response email! Responses that do not follow these basic instructions will not be considered!
title: C# Short Term Contract-Screen Scraping/Form Submission App

body:
Living Honestly is a new Minnesota nonprofit which aims for lots of media attention with hopes of making a significant contribution to society. Early involvement at the ground floor means your contributions will be the foundation of something really big and potentially result in a lot of exposure!

Our mission:
to support and conduct non-partisan research, education, and informational activities to increase public awareness of food contents, efficient construction methods, and other ecologically-beneficial practices;
to increase public awareness of lesser-known organizations, methods, and associations which promote improved nutrition, family-owned business, efficient construction methods, and other ecologically-beneficial practices; and
to significantly improve the health and quality of life of the public.

That's IRS-friendly legalese of course, to help with 501(c)(3) filing. We will have original content but also offer a directory of organizations which promote honesty (via organic, eco-friendly, healthy offerings). This might include farms, restaurants, resorts, construction firms, architects, and teachers. We do not seek to recreate Facebook, Twitter, Yelp, Maps, etc. Instead, we will aggregate existing resources for these organizations and information in a clean, combined profile which allows folks to rate entries by honesty. If a restaurant says it is farm-to-table, is it really? If a product is marked "natural", are they being honest?

We will be creating a Kickstarter campaign to raise money for web hosting and the $800 fee which will give us federal tax exemption. First, we need a beautiful, clean online presence and 'branding'. The placeholder site is WordPress, so I am looking for a designer to contribute a nice theme to help our initial marketing efforts to best represent where we're headed.

Living Honestly will be neither political nor commercial.

If you have questions, please let me know. Thanks for looking!
title: WordPress theme and branding needed

body:
DATA ARCHITECT

SUMMARY

B2B Web Ventures, LLC is a successful eCommerce company located near downtown Dallas. We own several websites and have established ourselves as the leader in our market. We are looking for a candidate to fill a 6 month Data Architect contract position. This role will work with the development department to define requirements, analyze, design, and build database architecture.

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Analyze requirements and make architecture recommendations
* Data modeling of suggested architecture
* Implementation of approved designs
* Developing and supporting ETL, SSIS packages, and stored procedures
* Maintaining interoperability between an array of in house and third party systems
* Data validation, cleansing and mining
* Database maintenance and backups

REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS
* 5+ years of hands on SQL Server 2005/2008 experience
* Experience designing and implementing large-scale database solutions that are reliable, scalable, and perform at a high level
* Expert conceptual, logical and physical data modeling skills
* Widespread understanding of database structure, theories, principles, and best practices
* Familiarity with Entity-attribute-value model (EAV)
* Experience supporting MS SQL server database systems on Windows 2003 and 2008 platforms
* Competency with SQL tools and related utilities
* Extensive knowledge of ETL/SSIS principles and practice
* Working knowledge of MySQL
* Experience with eCommerce platforms

REQUIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS
* Strong analytical thinking capabilities
* Excellent interpersonal skills, both verbal and written
* Must be a team player, but also have the ability to work independently on other tasks
* Exceptional organizational and task management skills
* Extreme attention to detail
* Ability to explain technical scenarios and solutions in layman's terms

DESIRED SKILLS
* Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field
* Microsoft Certifications (MCITP, MCDBA, etc.)
* Understanding of Model-view-controller (MVC)
* Experience with LAMP
* Familiarity with Magento platform
* Experience with OrderMotion's OMX service
* Experience with Sage MAS 90
* Experience in ASP.NET, PHP, and C# environments
title: Data Architect / DBA Needed

body:
First

If you want to submit your resume, we also need an email from you telling us why your skills match this position.

Who We Are:

We're a highly energetic, profitable, ten person web development shop that's growing fast. We work hard, have more clients than we can handle, and need a talented developer that loves to be busy. You can find out more about us at www.dolphinmicro.com.

We develop in a wide variety of languages and frameworks like Ruby on Rails, PHP, and occasionally Java as well as HTML, CSS, and Javascript with JQuery. We also build iPhone and iPad apps and websites with Objective C, Webkit, and HTML5. Flexibility and a heartfelt yearning to learn new things is key.

What You'll Do:

You'll write lots of code, slice PSDs, develop cool front end UI, create custom ecommerce sites, and engineer streamlined business systems. Our projects are as diverse as our technology base and you'll get more variety working for us in a year, than you would get working for a big company in ten. You'll also get great exposure to small businesses, large advertising agencies, and everything in between. Your resume will rock and you'll have so much fun coding you'll never need it.

Skills We Require:

  • Degree in Computer Science or enough experience that we can't tell the difference
  • Extensive web development - front and back end with solid Javascript and SQL skills
  • Expertise in at least one server side environment (Rails, PHP, Java)

Specialties that will Set You Apart:

  • Extensive Rails experience
  • Strong PHP skills
  • iPhone and iPad work
  • Flash, Javascript, and HTML5 animation and effects
  • Social networking skills (Facebook and Twitter APIs, Wordpress integration, etc.)

Job Specifics:

You'll be a 1099 contract worker for the first 90 days. If you are what we need, we'll hire you on full time.

Hours are flexible and you can work either from home or our office with possible client on-site jobs occasionally. We will need you at our Louisville location at least once a week for planning and design meetings.

Pay commensurate with experience. Benefits currently include health insurance and as we grow, we'll be looking at expanding our benefits package and possibly offering ownership opportunities.

If you think you're a fit, reply with an email telling us why along with your resume and the words - "Rails Developer Found" - in the subject line.

body:
Location: New York, NY
URL: www.meetup.com

We're starting a local community revolution! Our goal is a "Meetup Everywhere about Most Everything", and we're on our way. We help people "use the internet to get off the internet" because Meetups change lives and can change the world.  

We are profitable, growing, and committed to building an all-star, all-NYC company. We are a company that values doers over talkers and mentors over managers. We are a company where people who take risks and win are rewarded and grow.  

Our team is ambitious and passionate; the environment is relaxed and fun. We get shit done that makes a difference.

As a UI Engineer, you will:
•    Work closely with both software engineers and product managers
•    Design and implement top notch products
•    Create clean maintainable code using primarily JSP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript
•    Advocate for best practices, great usability and exceptional quality

  An ideal candidate has:
•    Expertise in cross browser markup HTML and CSS
•    Solid experience in JavaScript and AJAX
•    Experience with a JavaScript framework (jQuery a plus)
•    Experience with designing end-user, web-based applications
•    Experience with a server-side web framework (JSP, PHP, Rails, .NET, etc)
•    Proficiency with Fireworks, Photoshop or related tools
•    User Interface design knowledge
•    Experience with a version control system (Git a plus)
•    A strong attention to detail and a feeling of pride and ownership over the quality of our product
•    Strong verbal and written communication skills
•    A passion and desire to work at a company trying to change the world

Our team is smart, ambitious, and passionate; the environment is relaxed and a lot of fun despite regular, tight deadlines. We are focused on quick, quality completion of projects and excited by what we do. We are looking for someone who is smart, collaborative, creative, and can get things done to a high quality and on tight deadlines.

 Every member of the Meetup Team is expected to: be an Innovator; be a Collaborator; be a Champion for their ideas; be an Expert; have High Standards; be dedicated to the power of self-organized groups and our mission of A Meetup Everywhere About Most Everything ("MEME"); and most importantly, Get Stuff Done That Makes a Difference! 

  Check out our dev blog:  http://making.meetup.com/

To apply: To apply: http://hire.jobvite.com/j/?aj=oSkNVfwE&s=37Signals

body:
Job Overview
As a Software Engineer at Handel you will be involved in developing the RiteTrack 5 framework as well as industry solutions built using this framework. We develop on the .NET platform using several technologies including C#, Silverlight, and SQL server. We are looking for an excellent problem solver with strong work ethic and the ability to think outside the box. As a Handel Software Engineer you are part of a small, cohesive, team of developers where each person's input is heard. As a company of under 30 employees, we offer an unparalleled atmosphere that is results driven and fast-paced, yet laid-back. As a Handel Software Engineer you are not just working on the greatest technology platform in the human services industry, but you are also having a long-term positive impact on the lives of the clients that our customers serve. If you meet the requirements for this job and you want an exciting career working for a fast-growing technology company in a small college town, then this may be the job for you.

Requirements
Applicants should have
Experience with Microsoft .NET (C# preferred)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
Client/server or web services application development, familiarity with Silverlight and web standards including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and XML
College Degree

Compensation and Benefits
Competitive salary based upon qualifications and experience
Performance-based bonuses and stock options
Home-computer lease and high-speed Internet subsidies
Holiday and vacation pay
Health insurance
IRA
On the premises fitness room
Fitness club membership subsidy
Wide variety of drinks and fruits available
Last Friday of the month Lunch
. . .and much more

About Handel IT
Handel Information Technologies, Inc. is a nationally recognized leader in the development and deployment of software solutions for child, family, and American Indian human services agencies. Founded in 1997 in Laramie, Wyoming, Handel today has customers in over 40 states and supports thousands of users of its RiteTrack software platform.

Handel sets itself apart from its competition through exceptional support, sophisticated technology, and most importantly, great people (both customers and employees). We employ some of the brightest, best-educated individuals from all over the country who have chosen Handel as the best place to develop their careers and Laramie as the best place to raise their families and to enjoy the Wyoming lifestyle to its fullest. During a recent survey we found that the average commute time for a Handel employee is around 10 minutes by bicycle, and under 5 minutes by car. However, with all the fiber-optics going through our state, sometimes we find that our employees can get all their work done directly from home.

Another thing that sets us apart is our work environment. At Handel we very much promote a work-hard, play-hard philosophy. Located in a historic building in old-town Laramie, our office environment reflects this philosophy both through resources available to our employees (fitness room, game room, break room, bar), benefits (home computer lease, broadband subsidy, fitness club subsidy, wellness program, just to mention a few), and activities (such as last Friday of the month lunches, summer family picnic, ski day, relays, Christmas party, etc.).

Our town is located in the southeast portion of the state of Wyoming in the scenic Laramie Valley, bordered by two mountain ranges. It is a wonderful place for outdoor enthusiasts and people who enjoy wide-open spaces, very little traffic or crowds, and a small college town environment. Laramie has slightly less than 30,000 people and that includes the student body at the University of Wyoming. The town offers superb quality of life with a low crime rate and a relatively low cost of living. By the way, Wyoming has over 300 days of sunshine, is home to Yellowstone National Park, the Grand Tetons, the Black Hills and Devil's Tower. Wyoming is where the Great Plains meets the Rocky Mountains. It is also the sacred land of the Arapaho, Shoshone and Crow Indians.
title: Senior Software Engineer

body:
I need at least 1 PHP dev for a two month(ish) project. You will be working with me and possibly one other developer on a highly interactive web application that will live in a LAMP environment. We have a dedicated designer, so no graphics work is required. This project will be more enjoyable than your standard website. To be considered, you're going to need the following in your tool belt:

  • Object-oriented PHP 5
  • MySQL - triggers, sprocs, views, knowledge of how to construct more than a basic query
  • Object-oriented JavaScript using prototype and jQuery
  • The ability to code without being reliant upon a framework. You need to be okay without Zend, Cake, CI, Yii, etc.
  • Obviously, you need to be up to snuff with your CSS and HTML.
  • Located in or around Austin. I'm in Temple, and we may occasionally need to meet. There's a reason I am posting this in the Austin section - don't even think about being from out of the area.
  • Don't have a toxic personality. No whining/complaining/bitching. We're a good group and we don't need anybody harshing the mellow.
  • Be open to sharing knowledge - this goes both ways

We are an established company with money, so you don't have to worry about any of that "partnership", "profit sharing" or "work now, pay later" BS. You don't have to be a world-class dev (but I certainly won't turn you away if you are), but you can't be a green horn either. You should have a few projects under your belt, and perhaps some formal education.

If you're interested, send me a link to something you've done - ideally with some jQuery and AJAX. If you have a resume, feel free to send that as well, or just give me a brief explanation of your experience. I'm really a lot more interested in seeing your code than your credentials. The pay is 25/hr on a 1099 and you'll be signing an NDA before work starts. If you're a troll that just surfs CL to respond to posters bitching about the rate, don't bother. With tech jobs going overseas and the economy the way it is, we've all seen more requirements for less pay.

In the subject line, put the name of the mascot for either UT or A&M. Don't care about your preference, but I'm not interested in interviewing a bot.

Thanks,

Chris
title: PHP Developer Needed

body:
Are you interested in getting experience at a hot, young Internet startup?

We will offer a stipend or a performance incentive based on your performance.

Way.com is working on an incredibly audacious opportunity in the consumer web/mobile space. We just started up 6 months ago, but the company is run by very experienced Internet entrepreneurs with a track record of successful startups (in addition to experiences at big firms like Apple, Oracle, BEA, Adobe, CSC).

The product and company is still in development mode and the team is very small (6 developers, 1 UI designer, and a product guy and 3 co-founders) so you'll have a huge impact on the actual product we launch. We believe we're going after one of the biggest opportunities in the consumer web/mobile space today (read: this is not some feature masquerading as a business), and we're not going to stop until we've succeeded.

The team is passionate, hard working, and working out of Sunnyvale business center.
We're looking for a super smart, tech-savvy, and independently motivated intern with a passion for sales and marketing, and Web 2.0 products. You need to have:

-Excitement about new and emerging web technologies and their potential to change people's lives -Excellent communication skills & writing -Ability to do in-depth web research, apply critical thinking, make sound judgments, and synthesize data to come up with detailed recommendations -A positive attitude and pride that stems from doing great work -Comfort with the usual suite of software productivity tools like Office or Google Docs Your projects will span a range of activities across marketing, business development. Our commitment to you is that you'll have the opportunity to have a major impact on our company and our product.

You'll also get to see entrepreneurship up close and personal as you work directly with founding team members. We have work some exciting projects in the following areas, but what you actually work on will be tailored somewhat to your experience and interests.

-Business Development
-Marketing communications planning
-Customer research and segmentation

Our office is located at the 830 Stewart Dr, in Sunnyvale. The possibility of becoming a full-time member of the team upon graduation is a very real possibility.

We're looking to fill this position immediately. We are flexible with schedule (weekends are OK too) but we do require a minimum commitment of 15 hours per week for 3 months.

To apply, please email your resume and a few lines about what you're looking for in an internship.

We look forward to hearing from you (and maybe working together) soon!

--The Way.com team

ADMIN ASSIST (Paid) needed 10 hrs per week (starting in late September) + INTERN (unpaid/paid) needed 10-20 hrs per week

DUTIES:
1) respond to AirBnB.com visitor requests to stay with me (I have 3 different apartments through early October, then only two BRs after that(moving to new place).
So last week in Sept is about 15-20hrs paid plus commission (average total pay $15/hr) and afterwards only perhaps 5-7hrs/wk paid
2) coordinate schedule of bookings to prevent overbooking
4) psych- and/or marketing and/or Biz Dev-related research, recruitment, analysis, etc. for a start-up company that will help unhappy couples (who cannot afford therapists) to save/revitalize their marriages/committed relationships using a robust breakthrough web application, individualizable, highly interactive.
Tell us which area you want to specialize in for your Internship, and we can send more specific jo description,

Pay: $8/hr for first week (4 hrs/day on average for this training week) plus 10% commissions, $10/hr for subsequent weeks.
Internship: Non paid until we are funded, which is expected within 2-3 months.

YOU:
> preferably undergraduate or graduate student in psychology or MBA program
> highly detail-oriented; familiar with xls spread sheets or similar ways to track stuff
> punctual and good communicator
> efficient and proactive in assisting PhD supervisor

DESIRED, BUT NOT REQUIRED:
1) Strong commitment to social justice causes (since profits from my endeavors go to these causes)
2) Strong passion for our startup's mission to use best technology in best ways to help couples have stronger happier marriges/committed relationships

1) Opportunity for director and eventually VP title (customized for career needs)

body:
We are a web design and development company located in the lower mainland of BC. We are looking for a *full-time* contract senior web developer/programmer to join our team. You must have at least three years of experience in web development, backend programming, database design, design and developing websites using the Drupal CMS 5.x, 6.x and 7.x, and have experience and knowledge in using APIs for e-commerce utilization. In addition, the ideal person will have 3+ years of experience in PHP, MySQL, XHTML, JS, CSS, jQuery and AJAX.

Must Have Requirements:

You must have your own equipment, work on your own time (within project deadlines), and work at your own location with your own internet connection and backup systems. Ideally you are excited about your work and would prefer to have contract work for the long-term. You must agree that you will be working on a contract basis and not an employee position. If you are the right person, a full benefits package is available after a probationary period of 3 months.

* You must agree to sign a non-disclosure proprietary rights agreement.

Skills Required:

PHP/MySQL 3+ years
HTML/XHTML, table-less coding in CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, Ajax libraries and functions
Post-secondary diploma or degree in computer science, software engineering, web programming or equivalency with a minimum of 3+ years experience in web development
Strong Quality Assurance skills -- able to review work and thoroughly test out the project to ensure all features are effectively working
Must be able to take a Photoshop source file and code it using XHTML and table-less CSS into a pixel perfect web site that works across browsers (IE 7/8, Firefox 3.x, Safari, and Chrome) and works
across PC and Mac platforms
Must provide along with your resume a list of at least 3 links to websites that were involved and explain what your roles was and for how long.
List any PHP frameworks that you have experience using and how many years of experience.
Must have Drupal CMS experience
List other CMS systems you have also acquired experience with, the number of years, links to these websites, and outline your role in the projects (i.e., what you did)

Please reply with the following information:

* Submit your resume in PDF format (Word will also be accepted)
* Provide link(s) to your online portfolio or a PDF version
* Include in Email Subject: Web Developer
* Include in Email: Numbers of hours available per week starting immediately

If this sounds like a role you are interested in, please contact us with your resume and a portfolio to set up an appointment. Only qualified candidates will be contacted and interviewed during the week of September 12th.

Individuals and/or companies looking for outsourcing opportunities either locally or internationally will not be considered whatsoever !!!

Your hours, your location, starts at $10 per hour.
San Diego County ONLY

We provide detailed tasking and a starting point. Objective is to support marketing tasks

Some assignments are simply fact-checking, validating assumptions asserted in business plans, credentials in resumes, achievements listed by companies in their proposals, etc. A few assignments cannot be completed online, and may require some telephone calls, but this is not a sales or tele-anything project.

The first project (or perhaps two) for any datasearcher may be assigned to a second person. Once performance has been demonstrated, a datasearcher goes solo and earns more per hour.

Fiction will instantly disqualify and there will never be a second chance. We generally know about how long a given task should take, and as long as your reported hours fall within our expectations we won't question your request for payment.

If this seems interesting, send us a mini-resume. No inflation. Assume that one of our datasearchers will do fact-checking. In the past, successful datasearchers have been university students able to dedicate a few hours a week to our projects. It's just a gig - nothing permanent or long term.

If this post is still visible, then we're still inviting applications. We will not respond simply to decline - sorry.

body:
Acutedge is a Philadelphia based Salesforce.com consulting partner. We leverage Salesforce and the Force.com platform to deliver applications that streamline processes, boost user productivity, facilitate collaboration; and improve bottom line. A large part of our practice today is dedicated to nonprofit consulting with customers ranging from smaller nonprofits to large global NGOs.

Role:

Acutedge is looking for a "rock-star" Salesforce Consultant (Advanced Administrator or Developer) to assist with current and future projects. This is a client-facing role.

Salesforce.com administrators/developers with requisite experience, especially with nonprofit organizations, looking to move into a consulting career are encouraged to apply.

Primary Responsibilities --

Advise Acutedge's nonprofit and business customers on Salesforce.com best practices
Assist in pre-sales activities such as work estimation and proposal creation
Develop project scope, gather new business requirements, develop design documents, and customize application
Create solutions using Salesforce.com and the Force.com platform
Provide post-implementation support as needed
Training customers in a group or one-to-one setting

Experience and Skills-

3 or more years experience in an IT/Software Development role

2 years hands-on experience with Salesforce.com CRM/Force.com platform, working as a Consultant or a Salesforce.com Administrator

Thorough knowledge of at least 3 of the below listed Salesforce Applications
a. Sales Cloud
b. Marketing
c. Service Cloud
d. Call Center
e. Portals

Hands-on experience with all aspects of Salesforce setup --
a. User Roles, Profiles, Sharing
b. Fields, Page Layouts, Record Types, Search Layouts, Custom Objects, AppExchange, Salesforce for Outlook, Offline Edition, Salesforce Mobile
c. Advanced Reports, Dashboards, and Analytical Snapshots
d. Assignment Rules, Formulas, Workflows,

Basic understanding of Apex Triggers, Classes, Controllers, Visualforce, Force.com IDE

Experience with Data Migration, Data Cleansing using ETL tools such as Data Loader, Excel Connector and DemandTools

Bachelor's degree in computer science/engineering or equivalent experience

Must haves --
Passionate about helping organizations achieve their objectives with a can-do attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently with little to no supervision
Ability to multi-task under tight deadlines
Comfortable with travel (at this point we anticipate occasional travel)

Preferred -
Prior experience in a consulting role with environments >50 seats
Experience working with Nonprofits
Experience with multiple end-to-end implementations of Salesforce.com
Salesforce Administrator/Developer Certification

What we offer --

Young, energetic environment where creative; out-of-the-box thinking is encouraged.

Competitive compensation based on experience + Bonus

How to Apply:

Reply with a brief summary of Salesforce projects completed.

- Send a resume highlighting relevant experience
- Include desired salary range

body:
We are looking for a software developer or team to help us produce one of two things. Either...

(1) Create a plugin for Final Cut 7 (part of Final Cut Studio 3 - not Final Cut X)

(2) Build a separate piece of software/app for MAC OS

...that provides a more efficient way to identify objects on the screen from various video footage. In short, we are a consulting service that produces many videos where we have to add arrows or circles in our edits that point to/highlight certain items on the screen while a voice over speaks about the items. We do not even know if this is possible, but we are interested/hoping that there would be an easier way to make the edits rather than old fashioned editing (copying and pasting the effects, tweaking the parameters, moving the effects around to the right place, etc.) This is very time consuming. Ideally, we would like a plugin/filter in FCP where we can click an item on the screen and a perfect circle is created around the object/an arrow is inserted that points to it from a certain direction/or anything else that makes it quicker to highlight the object and move on.

Any thoughts? We have a budget and are interested in learning if there is a possibility in making this process more efficient and/or if there are other pieces of software/apps that are already out there and are currently capable of doing this. Your time will be compensated.

Thank you.

body:
A newly formed local game studio is looking for programmers and artists/animators to work on a new PC/console/mobile RPG project called MURGE (Modular Universal RPG Game Engine).

The concept is based on Neverwinter Nights and it will be a Game design toolkit like Auarora/Electron, as well as a game campaign like NWN 1 & 2.

The game toolkit will be much more versatile though, as it will allow easy designing of RPGs for any style or genre, not just fantasy. The rulesets will be easily moddable so designers can make their own or use kits we will make or other users will make.

So designers will be able to make RPGs based on any game video or tabletop they could think of, and RPG producers can get adventures/mudules/campaigns made with the MURGE toolkit as well.

The toolkit will be upgraded every few years with more options and better graphics to make it a trully amazing product that will entertain for many years and be contemporary and up to date as well.


We have a couple of programmers and artists already.
If you have any interest in the project, can help. or know people who can let us know.


thanks,

body:
Location: New Orleans, LA
URL: http://www.bentmedia.com/

Bent Media Inc. is looking for a talented, full-time web developer to work on several large-scale e-commerce web sites for well-known direct marketers. He/She will be responsible for developing, testing and maintaining multiple websites. You will also build and test HTML emails. You must be able to communicate project status, issues, and resolutions.

Skills and Experience

  • Mastery of (X)HTML, CSS, and cross-browser compatibility issues.
  • Competence in JavaScript, PHP, and ColdFusion.
  • Thorough and creative troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Adobe Fireworks, Photoshop, and Illustrator.
  • Flash video/animation experience a plus.
  • Ability to work independently and in a small group.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.
  • Desire to stay updated on current and new technologies.
  • Ability to multitask and strong time management and organizational skills.
 
Responsibilities

  • Work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Development Team to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
  • Produce project estimates during development process.
  • Participate in internal meetings during development.
  • Convert raw images and layouts from a graphic designer into (X)HTML/CSS code.
  • Communicate to the Project Manager with efficiency and accuracy any progress and/or delays.
  • Alert colleagues to emerging technologies or applications and the opportunities to integrate them into operations and activities.
 
Typical Required Experience

  • Bachelors degree in computer science or 3-5 years related experience. Interactive agency environment a plus.
 

Bent Media is a New Orleans-based interactive agency servicing regional, national, and international clients. Since 1992, we’ve been creating rich interactive experiences by architecting, designing and building apps, web sites, communities and storefronts that connect brands with their customers. We work with our clients to build holistic digital strategies that address their needs, and we apply learning from research, analytics, customer feedback, and media performance to optimize results. Clients include McIlhenny Company – maker of TABASCO® brand Pepper Sauces, Oreck Vacuums, Smoothie King, Blanchard and Company, Kraft Foods, and more.

To apply: Send your resume to employment@bentmedia.com
title: Bent Media: Web Developer

body:
We're looking to establish a long-term business relationship with a good designer for ideally all of our current and future design needs (color palette, logos, web, mobile). We'll be starting with weatherspark.com, which is a new type of weather website, showing in-depth weather information using graphs and maps.

We need a new logo, and a website & webapp redesign. The website is live on: http://weatherspark.com, so you can check it out right now.

The site consists of two main components: a set of webpages with information (let's call that part the "site"), and then a flash application with the graphs and maps (let's call that part the "app", even though it's not a mobile app).

Your first job will consist of creating:

1. A unified and sensible color theme. There are *many* colors necessary to display all the information, and we want something that really works across the graphs, the map (& other parts of the app!), the site, and the logo.

2. A better front page. The "cool things" section should presumably be more graphical, rather than several lines of plain text. Note that we want to be able to update these, and possibly show say 4 random things out of a list of 20. We're also intending to tie this into a combined help/feature exposure page ( http://weatherspark.com/features_and_help ). Simplicity and tastefulness are the keywords.

3. The app: we're considering skinning it by making the background a photo representing e.g. the current conditions (gmail has a skin in that general direction). Not set in stone. Vertical space is at a premium, so keep that in design-mind. We like the current containment hierarchy (header section w search box, map to the left, graphs to the right), so try to keep within that box. Also, do check out the other tabs as there's more than one page to the app.

4. Logo. Currently the logo is effectively the name ("WeatherSpark"), though the favicon is a blue shield with a lightning bolt in it. The site is obviously weather related, so something that evokes weather, otherwise pretty free reins here. We're fine having the logo remain just the name.

5. Design of the content pages for the site, and the blog. Should go with the rest of the theme of course, but otherwise no specific requirements.

6. Sensible font choices. The current fonts were picked somewhat haphazardly, we'd be looking for a theme were the fonts used across the app & site work well together.


The ideal candidate has a strong sense of color usage, information structure & presentation, and an obsessive attention to detail. Having designed infographics is a plus.

You can be anywhere in the world you like, but we're in California and you will need to be available for phone/skype during some time of a regular 9am-5pm business day. Most communication will be written, but especially for agreeing on the initial direction and review of drafts/final deliverable voice communication can greatly simplify things.

We like to work iteratively, and like to see rough sketches very early to avoid chasing down the wrong rabbit holes.


To apply, please reply by email with:

1. Something that tells me you've actually read and understood the job description above (sorry, this is craigslist).

2. At least 1 and most 3 links to the specific entries in your online portfolio you feel are applicable to the tasks outlined above. If nothing in your portfolio fits the bill then a sketch of a front-page suggestion + color palette will do wonders. By sketch I do mean sketch - an annotated wireframe with some font references is totally fine.

3. A brief background on yourself and your design interests. This can be as simple as a short list of design-related books/blogs you've actually read that you feel are relevant to your field. We're looking for someone who cares deeply about design, colors, and layout, so you've probably taken classes or otherwise read up on things like color theory, how to use white space for effective communication and such.

4. Your compensation requirements. We're looking much more for the right person than for the "right" price, but please be reasonable.


This is a part time contractor/freelance gig and you will need to provide your own work space, equipment, and software. You will be paid on either an hourly or project-basis, whichever we eventually agree upon, and you will need to invoice us for your fees.

Jacob, weatherspark.com

meltmedia is looking for a Senior Java Web Developer to join a talented team in developing customized solutions for both client and internal projects. You will work with cutting-edge technologies within an agile methodology, to achieve results exceeding our clients expectations.

**Who We Are**

meltmedia is a fast-growing web development firm located in Tempe, AZ. We're an easy-going, slightly geeky group that likes to play as hard as we work. Our main focus is to produce great work, but our company also offers a modern office with a fully-stocked kitchen and a team that puts together everything from the "JavaScript Ninja Challenge" to a book club and happy hours. Our employees are able to explore and learn in the positive, collaborative environment that we strive to create.

-Experienced Back End Web developer with the ability to take a project from design all the way to release.

**What You'll Do**

**The Other Stuff**

If working in an uncompromising, high-paced, low-politics environment sounds exciting to you, drop us a line. We would love to talk more about how meltmedia can empower you to achieve greatness.

Please go to http://meltmedia.theresumator.com/apply/Xtqd14/Senior-Java-Web-Developer.html?source=CRAG to submit your application.

body:
We are a three-man team in the process of starting an online community for scientific research. Our team consists of two VC's and one PHD student. We will be well-financed and have a firm grasp of our future course, as well as a number of potential major institutional partners lined up. We do not want to get into too much detail regarding the content and direction of the site, but please contact us for further details.

We are looking for a bright, young ROCKSTAR programmer to partner with us as a Chief Tech Officer with an equity stake in the company. We do not wish to simply commission a programmer to build a beta site as we want our chief programmer to have a hand in the direction of the company. We are only looking for highly-skilled programmers in the New York area that have a strong desire to help adapt the antiquated method of Scientific Development for the better and wish to stamp their name on a revolutionary project. We anticipate a beta-version of the site to take 2-3 months to complete as much of the data and programs we wish to have encoded on the site are open-source. The site will require various implementations such as a pdf-reader, various searching functionalities, and an iTunes-esque Library set-up, among other things.

We are willing to barter with regards to compensation outside of equity, as your time would be equally valuable to us as it is to you. Time and place of work can be negotiated as well, but we foresee this being a full-time position that will require frequent face-time and discussion with the fellow management.

Only highly-skilled, excited candidates will be considered. We need an A+ programmer who can lay down a clean foundation to our site that won't require fixing in the long haul, and we are willing to pay what it takes. If you or someone you know is looking to be the next Zuckerberg, what better way to get a head-start than by partnering with a couple VCs and a PHD on a pre-financed, fully developed business plan?

Please email me with a brief description of who you are, where you studied (or study), what you have done, and how you could help our revolution. Resumes are cool too.

body:
2 Sr. QA-Consultant (Web Testing)/Oakbrook Terrace, IL/1 year contract

2 openings

Client is seeking a Senior QA Consultant with strong technical skills to join the team that is responsible for manual testing and some automated testing of web services and database validation. This role is a demanding, highly dynamic, technically challenging position. You must be a top-notch quality assurance analyst, detail-oriented, flexible, eager to learn, and committed to becoming an
integral part of our QA team.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Experience with manual testing of web-based or client/server applications;
Experience with writing SQL queries in either SQL Server or Oracle databases;
Create and execute manual and automated tests, document testing practices, and communicate results/recommendations to team;
Works with other IT and technology teams to refine technical specifications for test analysis and quality assurance;
Effectively communicate with developers and other QA engineers, understand effectively how the business works with the associated data;
Actively participate in team processes and use of methodologies, including customized flavors of Agile;
Follow all established Client QA policies and procedures.

Preferred Experience / Education:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or related area;
3 -5 years experience in software quality assurance, preferably in an Agile-like environment, with experience writing manual and automated test cases;
2-3 years experience in testing web services, preferably with a large scale e-commerce system;
Experience writing testing cases for web services using SoapUI tool;
Strong SQL skills with MS SQL Server;
Familiarity with credit card processing, in real time and in batch;
Strong written and verbal communication skills;
Creative problem solving skills;
Ability and aptitude to learn quickly and work within a team environment.
title: 2 Sr. QA-Consultant  - 1 yr contract

body:
Senior BI Developer/Oakbrook Terrace, IL / 1 year contract

The Business Intelligence Developer will report to the Business Intelligence team which is responsible for Data Warehouse modeling & design, ETL development, Enterprise reporting - analysis, requirements gathering and report development. The ideal candidate should demonstrate thorough knowledge of BI, data warehouse development, and data analysis.
Responsibilities:
Contribute substantially in the Data Warehouse development lifecycle including gathering and understating of requirements, data and ETL design, database and report development, and testing using SQL Server 2005 Business Intelligence Development tools - Integration Services, Analysis Services & Reporting Services.
Design and build new data aggregations for ongoing data analysis and reporting.
Utilize data analysis techniques and queries to provide ad-hoc reports, analysis, and datasets based on business needs.
Troubleshoot data issues, validate result sets, recommend and implement process improvements.
Provide expert advice and consultation on data structures.
Work with other teams to understand business rules and interpret data.
Maintain an ongoing knowledge of both the technical data model and the business' strategic needs.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
3-5 years of IT experience with core expertise in data analysis, query design, and reporting. Experience designing and developing simple to complex data models.
Highly proficient in Transact SQL.
Highly proficient in MS SQL Server.
Experience creating OLAP cubes using SSAS
Extensive experience using Microsoft's SSIS, SSAS, and SSRS.
Hands on experience building dashboard, scorecards, and KPI's.
Experience working with data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture.
Strong analytical, multi-tasking and problem solving skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Implementation, installation, configuration of business intelligence platforms.
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.

body:
2 Senior ETL Developer/1 year Contract/ Oakbrook Terrace, IL

2 Positions

Rapidly growing technology organization is seeking an experienced ETL Developer. The right candidate will possess good understanding of ETL process architecture and will demonstrate a solid grasp of data integration techniques. Primary job duties will include design, development, maintenance and support of ETL processes as well as working with internal/external teams to accommodate new and changing features and business system requirements.
Responsibilities:
Designs, develops and improves complex ETL structures to extract, transform and load data from multiple data sources into data warehouse and other databases based on business requirements.
Ensures accurate, appropriate and effective use of data; including data definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, and operational guidelines.
Performs metadata validation, reconciliation and appropriate error handling in ETL processes.
Augments application development support including updates to data models, creation and maintenance of data access code (typically stored procedures), and optimization of existing SQL.
Reviews database design and integration of systems and makes recommendations for enhancements or improvements.
Monitors ETL process activity and utilization, with particular strengths in performance tuning highly transactional data integration package in both the development and production environments including remotely located servers.
Troubleshoots data issues, validates result sets, recommends and implements process improvements.
Works with end-users to help identify issues and to refine requirements.
Has excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills, is a proficient problem solver, has the ability to acquire new skills quickly and thrive in a collaborative team environment.
Provide 24x7 on-call support for production systems.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
2+ years experience in design and development of complex near-real time and batch ETL processes.
2+ years experience with SSIS.
1+ years experience with SSRS / SSAS.
Deep understanding of database design and modeling principals.
Hands on experience working with data warehousing concepts, terminology and architecture.
Knowledge of data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Highly proficient in Transact SQL, stored procedures, query execution plans, etc.
Ability to proactively identify, troubleshoot and resolve live ETL process issues.
Experience running and supporting BI environments with multiple metadata sources.
Experience working in agile environment including creating of automated build, testing, integration and data refresh processes.
Knowledge of various data warehouse support solutions and software.
title: 2 Senior ETL Developer/1 year Contract

body:
2 Positions: This is a full time, 100% on-site, 4-week Android Developer job located in New York City. No telecommuting allowed. Local candidates only. Compensation is OPEN. Please provide day rate when applying. Seeking individuals only to work ON-SITE. No firms or shops unless you can spare 2 mid to senior-level Android Developers for the duration of the project. Thank you.

Our New York City client is looking for a contract Android Mobile Software Developer to work on developing several new Android mobile applications. Onsite ONLY / Weekend hours required / day rate required.

They are an interactive agency specializing in Mobile Applications, Web Design, Microsites, Online Advertising and a wide array of other innovative interactive projects. Their client roster includes Fortune 500 Companies and major global brands. Candidates should also be able to code in Java for Android and create cutting edge applications in the mobile space. You should also be highly motivated, energized and passionate about your craft.

Requirements include:

* Proficiency in Java and sound fundamentals of Java programming
* Understanding of Android architecture
* Understanding of Android memory management
* High level of skill with mobile User Experience and UI design/development
* Highly skilled in developing with one or more Android middleware frameworks
* Experience with Android UI Layout, Database, Multi-Threaded, etc
* Solid knowledge on Android System Architecture and Android source code
* Thorough knowledge of using Eclipse IDE integrated with Android Development Toolkit
* Strong experience developing Android applications including building complex apps with widespread consumer bases
* 3-7+ years of software development experience (Java, C++, C#)
* Android software development experience (1-2 years)
* Android SDK 3.0 (or later)
* APIs -- Android 3.0 API, Google 11 API
* OO design and development experience
* XML & SQLite experience
* Strong understanding of developing and consuming web services
* JQuery experience to leverage with hybrid web and native applications
* Mobile web background
* Understanding of the Google Marketplace and how to submit applications
* iOS and Windows Mobile app development experience a plus
* You must also demonstrate the ability to work both independently and within a team environment, have broad software development skills encompassing multiple programming languages and multiple platforms. Experience with complex, asynchronous distributed software systems is a plus

If you are interested in this gig, please submit your RESUME and DAY RATE to opensourcestaffing|AT|gmail.com

Thank you,
Beau J. Gould

body:
Seeking an Oracle Database Administrator to support a government contract. The successful candidate will be required to perform all administrative functions in an accurate and timely manner. These responsibilities will take approximately 20 hours per week, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. -- 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. The successful applicant will work from his or her own home using his or her own equipment and appropriate internet connectivity.

Essential functions will include and not be limited to:

Backing up and restoring an Oracle 11 database
Controlling and monitoring user access
Enrolling new users and controlling user access
Installing and upgrading the Oracle server system tools
Maintaining archived data
Modifying the database structure as necessary from information provided by application developers
Monitoring and allocating database storage structures
Monitoring and optimizing the performance of the database
Monitoring the primary database objects

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum two years as Oracle Database Administrator
Familiarity with Oracle 11 on UNIX and Windows platforms
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a CAC card

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with Oracle 10 or 11 on a UNIX/Windows platform
Current CAC card

Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply providing their resume and hourly pay requirements.

body:
Our client, a Nationally Recognized Professional Services Provider, will be assisting with a 2 months Desktop Support project in Jupiter, FL, starting Monday 9/19/11.

We are, Peak Systems, a technology staffing, and managed services consulting firm connecting technical consultants with various industry opportunities. Technicians who join us on this project will receive a certification for working with this Provider. We issue payments weekly, offer direct deposit, and have many nationwide opportunities.

To qualify for this assignment selected technicians will be required to pass a background check!

We are seeking technicians with the following characteristics:

We define Deployment Technician as 2-4 years of experience. A+ certification or equivalent skill set is required. Other certifications are a plus (MCP, MCSE, Network+).

Tech should have break-fix experience working on both PCs and laptops; ability to fix issues immediately or escalate and translate issues when appropriate; ability to identify and respond to assistance with sense of urgency.

Tech should have experience in servicing/deploying equipment (unboxing new computers, installing/uninstalling machines); as well as prior experience utilizing data and settings migration, imaging, application installation, and technologies. Techs should be able to understand written instructions and scripts; techs should be detailed oriented. Techs must be well-organized, able to work by themselves or with little supervision.
