body:
Position Title: Quality Assurance Analyst
Position Type: Full Time
Location: In or around Louisville, Kentucky

Overview

When you were young, you found flaws in things that no one else did. Over time, you realized this was a gift, not a personality fault. After all you didn't mean to be picky--you were simply fascinated by the idea of excellence, and things that fell short of it annoyed you. You were a tester, an assurer of quality.

As a professional, you've come to realize that not just any quality assurance job suffices; you need to be personally vested in the project you're working on, or else your resolve and work will suffer. You want to be able to come home from a hard day's work and talk about the great cause you helped with your quality assurance skills. You're also the type who needs to be stretched in these skills every day while maintaining a sense of your own unique approach.

Work with a go-to virtual team that shares the flexibility of distribution while maintaining the professionalism of a high-end firm. Our integrity and compassion produce innovative solutions for great causes. We specialize in the complex problems by putting the user experience first and implementing the latest in technology and services to produce cost-effective solutions that deliver results to nonprofits and social enterprises.

You'll need these skills to pay the bills:
* Agile Development methodology know-how
* Automation Experience with Selenium or other open source tools
* A solid understanding of testing browser apps
* Scripting experience with languages like JavaScript, PHP or similar.
* SQL knowledge (especially MySQL)
* Experience with Test Management and Defect Management tools
* Intermediate to Advanced skills in MS Excel and MS Word (iWork or OpenOffice are fine too!)

On a typical day you'll be heads down:
* Working with the QA Lead and developers to create automated tests
* Logging detailed defects in a bug tracking system with clearly reproducible steps
* Conduct manual test cases on mobile and web-based applications
* Chatting with your awesome teammates to collaborate on various problems via Skype

Our smile will be even bigger if you can say any of the following:
* "I've used testing automation tools to success, such as Selenium, Phone Monkey or PHPUnit"
* "Sure, I know all sorts of neat tricks and tools such as Wire Shark, HTTFox or Firebug"
* "I have LAMP configuration experience"
* "I have solid understanding of mobile device testing"
* "I'm always playing with new virtual or physical machines and devices to ensure I can test against a variety of hardware & software configurations."

About Us
We help our clients connect people to their cause with beautiful web campaigns, mobile applications, system integrations, and internet marketing services.

Compensation
* Salary dependent on experience
* A highly flexible virtual work environment with opportunities for meetups
* Group health plan with full premium paid for you and dependent(s)
* 3 Weeks' Paid Time Off per year
* Fast growth opportunities

Email via Craigslist to provide your resume and highlight the projects you've championed that best illustrate your skills. We'll take a look and start talking!
title: QA Analyst

SoftSlate is looking for an extremely smart, productive developer to help build great websites running our Java ecommerce application, SoftSlate Commerce.

This is a contract position for four months with a good possibility of an extension beyond that or a transition to a permanent position. We offer flexible hours and the freedom to work remotely. For the initial first few weeks we'll ask you to work in house in Schenectady, NY, as we get to know each other. After that, you'll be asked to come in weekly (or more if you like) and join in on the occasional conference call. Apart from that you'll have the freedom to set your own hours and work where you wish. The compensation depends on your level of experience and qualifications.

SoftSlate has a small team of developers who work closely with clients to build and maintain websites running our Java shopping cart application, SoftSlate Commerce. You will work both within the team in our ongoing development of their websites, and directly with clients to discuss requirements and deliver new features. We are an extremely responsive and agile team who bounce ideas off each other, hand tasks back and forth seamlessly, and work together to get the job done. You'll need to be communicative, consciencious, smart, and productive.

Java
JSP
HTML
SQL

Preferred:

We use Struts 1, Hibernate, YUI, CSS, Mercurial, MySQL, Apache, Tomcat, and SoftSlate Commerce, so experience with any of those will be a plus.
Strong communication skills via email and phone using English.
Experience communicating directly with clients, including non-technical clients.

body:
Location: Princeton, NJ
URL: www.ptsem.edu

Princeton Theological Seminary is seeking a XML Database Administrator in the library. Reporting to the Curator of Special Collections, the XML Database Administrator administers the MarkLogic Content Server for the Digital Library Team: diagnosing and resolving issues related to performance, availability, and scalability; managing security and data integrity; assisting with data modeling and indexing; creating lexicons and thesauri; carrying out regular backups and ensuring disaster recovery plans; maintaining technical infrastructure, including the source control server and the image server. This entry-level position requires a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or a master's degree in Library and Information Science, or equivalent experience. Candidates should have experience with database administration, a solid grasp of NoSQL/XML databases, excellent knowledge of XML and related technologies, particularly XPath, XQuery, and XSLT. Acquaintance with library metadata formats (EAD, MARCXML, METS, MODS, TEI) preferred. The successful candidate will be enthusiastic about collaborating with a small, cross-functional, agile team using the scrum framework.
 
We offer a pleasant, academic work environment in an attractive campus setting and a generous benefits package that includes 20 days’ vacation after one year of service. 
                                                                                      




To apply: Interested candidates should send resume with salary requirement to: PRINCETON THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY Human Resources Office 64 Mercer Street Princeton, NJ 08540 Fax: (609) 924-2973 E-Mail: apply@ptsem.edu We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer
title: Princeton Theological Seminary: XML Database Administrator

The Royal Astronomical Society of Canada is looking for an experienced Drupal developer to assist with the final stages of the implementation of our new website running under Drupal 6. The site is up and running in preproduction at http://www.rasc.ca/drupal. We need some specific help with some (relatively) tricky technical issues as outlined in the RFQ. The Drupal developer will be responsible for the following:

  • Root-cause analysis of specified issues or problems with the website.
  • Identification of additional modules that may be needed and/or configuration of existing modules as required.
  • Module installation / updates to the existing site to implement required changes.
  • Documentation of all custom code and/or non-standard configuration changes applied to the site for future maintenance. Documentation will consist of a listing of affected modules, snippets of code applied, description of code changes and any comments / issues for maintainability going forward.

For simplicity in development all adjustments may be done in the pre-production environment, however, as a final deliverable a test environment must be established to provide for future development and testing.

The Drupal developer will be assisted by an assigned volunteer resource who will perform Quality Assurance and sign-off on deliverables. This contract is expected to lead to a long-term relationship with the developer for further enhancement of this site in the next 3-6 months.

body:
Job Description

SunnyPoints is looking for a part-time web developer to help expand and enhance the online component of our business. We need to improve the design and functionality of our customer-facing web pages which pull data from our database. We need someone who has strong design and coding skills along with experience with integrating databases into web sites. Applicants may also be asked to help develop mobile applications in the future. Applicants should be familiar with HTML, JACA, CSS, SQL, and JSP.

Time commitment.
We are looking for a commitment of roughly 10 hours per week.
Preferably, we are looking for someone who is available to work for the next 90 days or more.
Responsibilities will include...
Planning and executing innovative, easy-to-use, and attractive changes to our current website.
Working closely with and integrating ideas from our business development team.
Depending on your skill set, you may also be asked to perform some data-mining tasks.
Perks...
Work on site or from home.
Flexible work hours.
If you decide to work on site, we offer a great work environment!
Potential for extended, full-time employment.
Desired Skills & Experience
We are looking for the following:
Associate to Mid/Senior level web development skills.
Strong communication skills, efficiency, and dedcation to your assignments.
The following skills will put you at a major advantage...
Experience with data mining.
Any knowledge of mobile app development and/or embedded systems.
Bilingual in English and Japanese. is a plus, but not necessary.

Company Description
SunnyPoints provides independent and local retailers with a complete loyalty solution to enable store-owners to better target, market, and engage with their best, loyal customers. Unlike deal-promoters, SunnyPoints is designed to allow retailers to improve their bottom line and to engage with their shoppers on an ongoing basis in and out of the store. SunnyPoints is using a single-branded program so that local retailers can access a larger number of like-minded shoppers that are looking to shop with local retailers. We are using near-field communications technology so that shoppers can move from a single-loyalty card to their mobile phones as devices are released with NFC capabilities.
title: Web and Mobile developer, Part Time

body:
Senior Software Engineer

Cloud Systems provides leading-edge web and mobile applications that control electronic devices on a network. Our trademark is Control | Simplified™ and this is the motto for the products you will be working on. You can see video demos and commercials of our current products on our web site at: http://www.CloudSystems.com We are seeking a full-time Senior Software Engineer to join our friendly team in Oakland, CA.

We are seeking an engineer with hands-on experience developing Java-based web applications and hosting them on the cloud: EC2, Rackspace, etc. You will help lead our effort to transform our current customer-hosted Java/Spring based web applications into a SaaS cloud-hosted platform. Our user interfaces are implemented using native Android, Flex and HTML web technologies, so experience in one or more of these technologies is required.

You will be also be building new applications using Scala, Java, REST, HTML5, MySQL, and NoSQL which will be viewed with web browser, mobile and tablet user interfaces.

We offer an enjoyable, flexible work environment, health benefits (medical, dental and vision), 401k, a generous vacation package, incentive stock option plan and competitive compensation packages. We are a venture-backed company, so start-up or growth company experience is a bonus. Our culture is very entrepreneurial and change happens quickly.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience configuring and running hosted Java web applications in the cloud
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven experience in developing and implementing complex architectures
  • 4+ years writing web applications with HTML
  • 4+ years programming in HTML and JavaScript
  • 4+ years JEE Java web applications
  • 4+ years of database programming with SQL
  • 3+ years Spring framework
  • 2+ years experience with ORM technology such as JPA and Hibernate
  • Ability to write concurrent, multi-threaded programs
  • Maven with automated build and test environment experience

Desirable Qualifications

  • Experience with device control programming (some subset of: serial device control (RS-232), telnet, HTTP, socket programming, etc.)
  • Scala programming experience is highly desirable
  • Android programming
  • Objective-C and iOS development
  • REST API design and implementation
  • NoSQL experience
  • jQuery experience
title: Senior Software Engineer - Cloud

body:
Expert Software Entrepreneur Wanted

1.5B people live off the grid and burn fuel (kerosene, candles, sticks) for home lighting. They spend 15% of their income on these poor lighting solutions and have only respiratory disease and accidental fires to show for it. Half of these households have a cell phone, and with that technology and what we are developing, these same folks can afford clean, efficient and modern solar lighting solutions.

We are a funded, for-profit social enterprise start up, founded by high tech engineers and development entrepreneurs, who seek to make a meaningful and measurable difference.

We seek a like minded expert software entrepreneur who needs to feed their inner technical nerd with work that makes an impact in the wider world.

If this person is you, you probably:

- code javascript & JSON-RPC like Crockford but would prefer to work in Python
- are pretty sure that all desktop applications of the future will be developed in GWT or Pyjamas and run in a browser
- understand the 3 or 4 things that separate a truly scalable web app from one that ain't.
- code Java if required, C# at gun point only
- carry nerd book that boots Debian
- are not pushed around by HW experts who mistakenly think that they know something about software architecture.

If this is you, then we want to talk with you. Drop a line to sonopro at frii dot com.
title: Feed your Nerd while Doing Something Meaningful

body:
Your hours, your location, starts at $10 per hour.
Must be completely comfortable with search engines.
San Diego County ONLY

We provide detailed tasking and a starting point. Objective is to support marketing tasks, looking for companies in defined fields, with history, financial background, intellectual property filings, names of and [access path to] specified leadership people, etc. Typical task involves 5-10 hours of online work. Payment is usually by paypal, and we can do cash or mail checks. Some of our work requires signing an NDA, or even a background check. Everything we do is totally on top of the table - nothing is secret, unethical, illegal, etc. but the fact that we've done it is confidential.

Some assignments are simply fact-checking, validating assumptions asserted in business plans, credentials in resumes, achievements listed by companies in their proposals, etc.

Some assignments cannot be completed online, and may require some telephone calls, but this is not a sales or tele-anything project. In one case, an extraordinarily enterprising datasearcher drove to a company, and at 5pm stood in the parking lot with a clipboard in hand, asking questions of people as they left the building. It was not at our request or part of the job description, but the result was highly profitable and a bonus was paid. Since then we've specifically told our datasearchers not to do such things, but it's mentioned here so you'll get a more complete picture of what's going on.

The first project (or perhaps two) for any datasearcher is always assigned to a second person as well. Once performance has been demonstrated, a datasearcher goes solo and earns more per hour.

Reports should be succinct, limited to a list of facts with brief substantiation and source list. Accuracy counts, and the datasearcher need never generate conclusions. We obviously pay more for analysis - that might come later, so there's some growth potential.

Fiction will instantly disqualify and there will never be a second chance. We generally know about how long a given task should take, and as long as your reported hours fall within our expectations we won't question your request for payment.

We will provide password entry to databases to which we have subscriptions, but they can be used only for our projects unless we provide permission to use those databases for personal reasons.

If this seems interesting, send us a mini-resume. No inflation. Assume that one of our datasearchers will do fact-checking. In the past, successful datasearchers have been university students able to dedicate a few hours a week to our projects.

If this post is still visible, then we're still inviting applications. We will not respond simply to decline - sorry.
title: Online data searching

Busy Long Island web development firm looking for a talented coder/programmer who has moderate to advanced experience in:

- Slicing layered PNG web designs into XHTML/CSS/jQuery
- Integrating XHTML/CSS/jQuery into ExpressionEngine CMS Templates
- Experience with Adobe Dreamweaver/Fireworks
- A good eye for layout and design

DO NOT CONTACT US IF YOU ARE OFFSHORE OR PROVIDE OFFSHORE TEAMS FOR WORK. DO NOT CONTACT US IF YOU ARE ALREADY VERY BUSY WITH LOTS OF FREELANCE WORK AND CANNOT GIVE US THE SERVICE LEVEL WE NEED.

DEFINITELY CONTACT US IF...

You:
- Are really good at XHTML/CSS/jQuery
- Are a Wizard with customizing ExpressionEngine installs to work with any template or website design
- Are an excellent, professional communicator and detail oriented
- Return emails and phone calls promptly and hit your deliverable deadlines
- Want to work with a company that is flexible and that you can really grow with - you want to become an integral part of the design/development team

You must:
- Want a telecommuting job and have the discipline to work at home
- Are physically located in the U.S.
- Have a reliable computer (Mac a plus) and Adobe CS4+
- Can work most of your hours between the hours of 9am to 5pm EST and be available for Skype chats to discuss projects

It is a BIG plus if you:
- Have experience with PHP and MySQL
- Have experience with Flash and ActionScripting
- Have experience with video graphics/editing
- Live on Long Island

This is a 1099 position, but we are ready to offer you a steady 30-40 hours per week of work if you meet all of our above expectations. We will start with a few freelance projects at first, and if we both feel like there is a great fit between us, will make you part of our full-time telecommuting team. This position is ideal for a Web coder/programmer who wants to work and grow with a small talented team of marketers and designers. We want to find a talented individual who will eventually become a key member of our team, so growth at this position is a definite.

We are not the typical design firm. We are a small group of dedicated designers/coders/programmers who are a tight-knit family. We're looking for that one-of-a-kind individual who works hard, but likes a laid back, fun work environment. We want someone we can trust and depend on who wants to build our company together. Our projects are very varied and are often unique. Salary is negotiable if you are a fast and accurate worker.

Work on exciting client-facing projects with our talented web and app geniuses on new platform features. Previous experience developing apps is a strong plus. This is an opportunity to begin a long-term relationship with the leader in branded mobile apps. Internships can be for (1) or (2) semesters and then potentially brought on as a junior developer. Days and hours can be flexible.

QUALIFICATIONS
Enrolled in a university degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related subject, or equivalent experience.
Knowledge of C++, Cocoa environment, Web developer, Java, objective C, SDK 3.O/4.O, iPhone, Android & Blackberry App Development
Understanding of the coding, testing, developing, enhancing, and implementing applications process.
Able to work both independently and in team-oriented, collaborative environments.
Strong communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.



If you are interested in this position, please send us your cover letter and current resume to donn@aurnh.com. Each application will be personally considered. Thank you for your interest. We look forward to hearing from you.

ABOUT US

Aurnhammer LLC is a creative media, design and development firm specializing in branded smart device applications for the mobile space. We create custom media tools that accomplish our client’s goals, while providing real utility and entertainment value for the consumer.

Company founders, Bill Aurnhammer and Paul McCarthy, have a combined 40 years media, design and development experience, providing creative solutions for clients such as: Sony Music Entertainment, Showtime Networks, Kohler, The New York Jets, Foxwoods Resort Casino, Lumber Liquidators, Bass Pro Shops, Mass Mutual, Getty Images, Oldcastle, The Milwaukee Bucks, Lincoln Center, Stanley Hand Tools, Russian Standard Vodka, Clorox, Century 21 Real Estate, and Viacom.

SunnyPoints is looking for a part-time web developer to help expand and enhance the online component of our business. Time commitment...
We are looking for a commitment of roughly 10 hours a week.
Preferably, we are looking for someone who is available to work for the next 90 days or more.

Responsibilities will include...
Planning and executing innovative, easy-to-use, and attractive changes to our current website.
Working closely with and integrating ideas from our business development team.
Depending on your skill set, you may also be asked to perform some data-mining tasks.

Work on site or from home.
Flexible work hours.
Potential for extended, full-time employment.

The following skills will put you at a major advantage...
Experience with data mining.
Any knowledge of mobile app development and/or embedded systems.
Bilingual in English and Japanese.

About SunnyPoints:
SunnyPoints is a new kind of social-media marketing company. We provide independent and local retailers with a complete loyalty solution to enable store-owners to better target, market, and engage with their best, loyal customers. Unlike deal-promoters, SunnyPoints is designed to allow retailers to improve their bottom line and to engage with their shoppers on an ongoing basis in and out of the store. SunnyPoints is using a single-branded program so that local retailers can access a larger number of like-minded shoppers that are looking to shop with local retailers. We are using near-field communications technology so that shoppers can move from a single-loyalty card to their mobile phones as devices are released with NFC capabilities.

body:
I. About 4Cs (Child Care Coordinating Council of San Mateo County)

Since 1972, 4Cs has worked in support of the healthy development of all children in San Mateo County. Over the years, 4Cs has anticipated and responded to the changing and growing needs of families, the child care field, and the community. Today, the agency operates more than 20 programs in 3 focus areas: quality child care and preschool, family support, and children's health and development. It has a staff of approximately 28 and a budget for more than $7 million annually.

You can learn more about 4Cs, our partnerships, and our services by visiting www.sanmateo4Cs.org.

II. Position Offered

4Cs seeks a consultant to design, create and launch a user friendly events booking interface between 4Cs PlugnPay payment gateway and our website that will allow users to make donations or pay and register for classes/events using a shopping cart where information such as class name, date, attendee names and contact details can be collected securely along with payment information. A consultant with experience in working with a non-profit is desired.

4Cs website, based on Joomla! 1.5.x, is currently able to accept payments (such as donations) using PlugnPay.com payment forms. Under this RFP, however, we would like to find a simple, cost effective way to allow users to add items such as class registration fees and perhaps other things to their shopping cart and then pay using a credit card through our PlugnPay gateway. Ideally, the interface would create reports that 4Cs can access with information about who signed up for what class, etc. See the attached Class Registration Flow Chart Diagram for an illustration.

III. Responsibilities of the Consultant (Deliverables)

1. Research and analyze the potential interface design options using a written cost/benefit format within 30 days of acceptance of the proposal.

2. Write the code within 30 days of selection by 4Cs among the options proposed above.

3. Install and complete testing of the interface within 10 days of completion of number 2 above.

4. Follow up on any post-launch problem solving for a period of up to 90 days after launch date.

5. Provide mutually agreed upon documentation required for upkeep and maintenance by 4Cs upon launch.

IV. Responsibilities of 4Cs

1. Access: Provide consultant with appropriate access and information to carry out the scope of work.

2. Communication: Make staff available for communication as needed regarding content, design, and other aspects of the project via in-person meetings, email, fax, and telephone calls.

3. Content: Supply layout or desired field information by email in Microsoft Word format.

4. Approvals: Approval on all revisions/corrections of layouts, mechanicals, and proofs.

5. Budget Management: Development and updating of interface design budget

6. Ownership of workproduct: 4Cs will retain all ownership rights related to the final work product.

V. Timeline

Proposals must be submitted by September 30 2011. 4Cs will accept e-mailed questions regarding the RFP prior to that date. Please contact yikwong@sanmateo4Cs.org.
Vendor selection and notification will be completed by October 15, 2011
All work, other than post-launch problem-solving, to be completed by December 31, 2011

VI. How to Apply

Submit your written proposal by email to yikwong@sanmateo4Cs.org no later than 5PM on September 30, 2011.

Your proposal must include:

1. Your individual or firm capacity statement, including:
(a) List all responsible staff who will work on this project and their resumes.
(b) List at least three similar website interface design projects you have developed since the year 2000 (preferably at least one payment interface), including one-paragraph descriptions, dates, and references. Please verify the continued validity of your reference's contact information. Include links to the websites.

2. Your proposed work plan, taking into account the dates and constraints described above. In the work plan, please describe the methods you will use, and clarify your role in securing any needed staff input.

3. Your fee proposal including hourly rate, maximum amount and schedule of payment. In proposing a maximum amount, please describe the assumptions on which your fee proposal is based, and indicate whether you are willing to negotiate your scope of services to arrive at a maximum fee that is satisfactory to 4Cs.

4. A brief written description of the challenges you foresee in taking on this work and how you would approach them.

5. A signed acknowledgment by you that, if selected as the consultant, the 4Cs Website Payment Interface will remain the sole property of 4Cs.
title: RFP for Web Interface Designer

body:
Good Afternoon!

I need a custom (database-driven) application built and here are the requirements:

- It needs to be web based
- It needs to be accessible by about 10 users
- It needs to be scalable
- It needs to have an order taking module (Inventory, Point of Sale, Shipping, Accounting)
- It needs to have a helpdesk module (where we can accept job requests, create and update tickets, and dispatch technicians)
- It needs to have an education module (where users can see a class schedule, book and pay for a class)
- It needs to have a GEO Matching capability (whereby if we enter a job, the system will find the closest technicians by zipcode)

I am less concerned with the person who says they can build this in 2 days! What is most important to me is the quality of the build, the user friendliness, the methods that will be used, and how much it's going to cost me!

If you are interested in this task, please reply to this ad with the way you would approach this project, and rough estimates of your time and cost to produce (hourly or flat rate for project).

Thanks in advance!

body:
CORRONA - We're a virtual company . . . our entire team works from home.
Corrona is currently seeking a senior software developer to join our core Informatics team. Corrona is a leading BioHealth/Research company. The CorronaBase Clinical Data application recently won a "2011 Life Sciences Innovation Award " from Microsoft. At Corrona we care deeply about our mission, we work hard and we get results.
Corrona is a leading presence in research on Rheumatoid Arthritis and related Inflammation disease areas. We have research & clinical partnerships with several universities in Boston, New York and beyond.
Job Functions
 Developing high-quality, highly-reusable objects and code for our clinical systems on demanding timelines.
 Design & Perform unit tests, systems tests and be closely-involved with our entire QA team and effort.
 Assisting with server setup & admin, Hosting config, researching new technology options, being active in the BioHealth & technology communities to enhance your own professionalism and the premier position of Corrona in the Clinical arena.
Qualifications
 Must be based in US.
 Development experience in SharePoint (MOSS), C#, .NET, InfoPath (forms) all highly-preferred.
 Extremely strong communication and collaboration skills, including remote modes such as Skype, IM, etc.
 Participation in complex health, biopharma or EDC projects a distinct advantage
 degree in Computer Science, BioStatistics, Mathematics or a related field preferred.
 Experience with Windows servers, SharePoint, Hosting, security, HIPPA, MCSE all highly-advantageous.

Culture - we're small , agile & entrepreneurial. One day you might be coding, another you might be setting up SourceSafe or a new Sharepoint environment. We need flexible, smart, resilient & mature people who won't be intimidated by small technology hurdles. Many of your stakeholders will be MD's -- you may need to translate technology concepts to their fast-paced world in the clinics. We might ask you to spend a day or 2 in a clinical setting to see the application in real-life, or to help an RN learn the system, and all the excitement and constraints that abound.
Benefits
Compensation includes a competitive salary, superb 401K & excellent benefits, and compassionate team members.
We're virtual -- you can work from home if you can handle it !
Sound exciting ? If so, please tell us about yourself and how you could contribute.

PLEASE EMAIL RESUMES TO :dominique.arnold@newcapitalsolutions.com




This is a global team and plays a mission critical role in Incident Management, Problem Management and Change Management in a demanding Investment Bank environment. The regional team in Americas would like to recruit an Incident Manager. It is a challenging role that provides extensive opportunities for learning new technologies, making new contacts throughout IT in Europe, Asia and the Americas, influencing the way the IT department operates, and also interfacing with senior IT Management.

. The role would report to the Manager, and is responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

▪ Providing team coverage throughout the trading day from 07:30 to 19:30 EST (on a rotational basis of early and late shifts shared with the all the other Incident Managers in the team).
▪ Management of Major and Severe impacting incidents primarily involving large scale infrastructure issues or high risk data / application issues. This includes:
-- Priortization of resources for sales and trading related (i.e. business critical) incidents.
-- Time sensitive communication.
− Running both technical conference bridges and business update calls.
-- Collating technical and business impact.
-- Driving decision making for incident resolution and minimising impact to the business.
-- Escalation to Senior IT Management.
-- Providing incident updates to stakeholders.
-- Capturing incident follow ups and completing formal Post Mortems.
-- Identifying stability trends and escalating them through the Problem Management process.
▪ Coordinate decision making and communication of critical, emergency break fix work by chairing conference calls and publishing formal communication.
▪ Work with sales and trading business unit aligned IT teams to coordinate critical business events (e.g. running pre-emptive technical calls for index rebalances, fiscal announcements, etc).
▪ Work with all IT teams in an effort to improve the overall stability of the production environment both regionally and globally (inc. process and product improvements both inside and outside of the ECC).
▪ Advising and consulting with other IT teams on processes relating to Incident Management, Problem Management and Change Management.
▪ Chairing daily 'Ready for Business' and 'End of Day' calls with infrastructure and business unit aligned IT teams, and reporting the Firm's status to senior IT Management and other recipients.
▪ Participation in the team's oncall rota when sufficient team experience has been gained. Note coverage is mostly follow-the-sun which substantially minimizes the oncall requirement.
▪ Assist in driving educational, training and communication programs surrounding the ECC.
▪ In time, further responsibilities in Change Management, Problem Management and planning for high risk planned events (like data center power downs) will become available depending on the abilities of the candidate.
Skills Required ▪ Excellent communication (both verbal and written). The ability to communicate confidently and clearly on conference calls, in meetings, via email, etc. at all levels of the organization is essential.
▪ Strong organizational skills -- the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
▪ Proven troubleshooting skills within a support environment including a strong sense of commitment and drive towards incident resolution.
▪ Technical aptitude. To demonstrate this an understanding of technology used in Investment Banking is required (i.e. one or more of: Unix / Linux, Windows, storage, networking, databases, IT security, market data, web / intranet infrastructure, messaging, mainframe or sales and trading application support).
▪ Client focus and ownership - use of own initiative and a proactive approach to work.
Skills Desired ▪ Bachelors degree or higher.
▪ 5+ years experience in the Financial Services sector (in multiple regions would be an advantage).
▪ A track record in Incident or Problem Management would be an advantage.
title: Command Center Incident Manager

PLEASE EMAIL RESUMES TO :dominique.arnold@newcapitalsolutions.com






This highly leveraged internal consulting position within an IT Security organization with excellent growth potential. The security architecture team works with IT groups on a global basis to ensure that IT projects are executed on a secure basis. The successful candidate will join a team of security generalists in IT Security with different areas of expertise. This team reviews a wide range of projects for security and interfaces with core security infrastructure and platform teams on major projects.

Specific role responsibilities include:
Work with network, platform, engineering and development teams in architecture design and review session.
Provide specific security expertise to engineering teams. Areas include secure network design, database access, security testing, authentication methods, implementing encryption, entitlement design, logging, input validation, secure storage design, secure data transfer.
Identify areas of risk on projects where security requirements cannot be fully addressed in the required time frame of the project.
Help identify areas of security the firm might want to invest in improve IT security.
Create documentation and guidance on the secure implementation of new technologies in the firm. This involves liaising with other technology subject matter experts to build consensus, outlining areas of improvement in written form and explaining concerns early on.
Conduct security training for IT groups.
Soft Skills:
Strong interpersonal skills are critical, since the candidate will working with developers and executives around the world, and must be able to effect change and influence decisions.
Ability to multi-task and handle multiple projects.
Strong organizational skills.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to build consensus across multiple silos.
Development Experience
Architecture/Implementation: The ideal candidate will have experience in architecting and implementing enterprise projects that touch all components of the IT stack to fully appreciate level of effort and appropriate roles in IT.
Languages: The ideal candidate will have experience with several practical languages such as Java, Perl, C/C++, C#, Python.
Security Experience

Knowledge of the common application and infrastructure level vulnerabilities - ability to explain these risks to developers.
Ability to evaluate technical and functional specifications early within the software development process, identify possible threats or areas of weakness.
Experience in taking part and contributing to design sessions.
Platform: Although this role is not systems administration position, the candidate must have deep knowledge of at least one primary operating system (Unix or Windows), the configuration and management of that platform at an enterprise scale, the security risks to that platform, and how to mitigate those risks.
Network security: The candidate will be expected to understand thoroughly the standard network model and the risks present at each layer, the functions of network equipment such as switches, routers, firewalls, proxies, vpn, and load-balancers, and to understand network architecture.
The candidate should have expertise with security-related topics such as authentication, entitlements, identity management, data protection, data leakage prevention, validation checking, encryption, hashing, principle of least privilege, software attack methodologies, secure data transfer, secure data storage etc. Genuine expertise is required here, as the candidate will be extensively tested on security principles.
In-depth knowledge of network technologies such as SFTP, firewall, DMZ design, IPSec, VPN, Wireless, network topologies and protocols.
In-depth knowledge of Single Sign On technologies such as SAML, Kerberos, and Siteminder.
In-depth knowledge of entitlements and access control as well as the various protocols for tracking records such as LDAP
Some experience in testing tools, at least one of Fortify, OunceLabs, AppScan, WebInspect, Burp. The successful candidate will be able to explain the 'hows and whys' of the tools, as well as being experienced in using them.
Technology background in the financial sector
Frameworks, protocols and subsystems: J2EE, .NET, Spring, RPC, SOAP, MQSeries, JMS, RMI, JMX, Hibernate, Applet.
Ability to review code of enterprise applications (Java required, prefer candidates with C/C++ and .NET) and identify possible security vulnerabilities
N-Tier application design and implementation, particularly web-based applications that cross company boundaries.
Knowledge of JSP /Servlet/EJB or ASP.NET, HTTP/HTTPS, Cookies, AJAX, JavaScript, Flex / Silverlight.
Knowledge of mobile computing
Database design and programming experience
Experience presenting complex security problems to senior management
Experience of liaising with external penetration testing vendors
Experience in conducting penetration tests, dynamic vulnerability assessments and static vulnerability assessments
Experience in delivering a developer training for software security
CISSP or other industry qualification
title: Infrastructure Security Architect

body:
Our company is not actually called "Secret Drupal Shop". We simply want to remain anonymous while looking for the perfect person to work with.

A completely virtual US based company is looking globally for a new person to join our team. We are looking for real Drupal project experience. We will pay competitive rates because we understand "you get what you pay for". We are not recruiters. Our team works on projects directly. Needed is someone who can meet deadlines and has great communication skills -- written as well as verbal.

Majority of work is theme related, but we need someone who knows more than CSS. We need someone who actually knows Drupal's theme functions, Drupal best practices, and basics of PHP. Knowing more about Drupal's API will help you take on even more tasks handing off to our ninja module developers.

If you don't have a degree from an accredited university, don't apply.

If your d.o profile is less than 1 year old, don't apply.

If you don't know how to use version control, don't apply.

If you don't have a portfolio to show us, don't apply.

If you don't have a stable Internet connection at home, don't apply.

If you don't use Skype/IRC, don't apply.

If you can't provide references, don't apply.

If you have never attended a local Drupal user group, you probably shouldn't apply. We are looking for truly dedicated nerds.

Contact us with your resume, skillset, examples of work, hourly rate, and drupal.org profile URL.

As you can probably tell from the format of this email, yes, we have wasted time on multiple untalented consultants. We don't want to waste time teaching you version control, how to use an IDE, or finish tasks you failed. There is a big gap in someone who "works with Drupal" and a "professional". We work on big projects, write custom code, and can't simply download a module to finish a job. We are looking for someone to build an on going relationship, with on going work, from good quality honest people. Let us know if your interested and we can setup a time to talk further. Seriously applicants who are currently available for work only.

email - secretdrupalshop@gmail.com

Marketplace

This is a global team and plays a mission critical role in Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, and Event Management in a demanding Investment Bank environment. The regional team in Americas would like to recruit a Project Manager with Incident Management experience. It is a challenging role that provides extensive opportunities for learning new technologies, making new contacts throughout IT in Europe, Asia and the Americas, influencing the way the IT department operates, and also interfacing with senior IT Management.
. The role would report to the Global Planned Events Manager and is responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

▪ Planning, execution and/or consulting of critical infrastructure or business events. (Please be aware that this will incorporate weekend work)
▪ Risk profile development of a program at the work stream and infrastructure service level.
▪ Coordinate and document all exercises according to the Planned Events framework including event Runbook development, risk assessments, and communications to the organization on service impacts.
▪ Collaboration with global team members to ensure that governance and standardization remains consistent across the regions.
▪ Oversee command and control during the execution of a major event.
▪ Providing incident team coverage when supplemental staff is required (based on availability).
▪ Management of Major and Severe impacting incidents primarily involving large scale infrastructure issues or high risk data / application issues. This includes:
-- Prioritization of ECC resources for sales and trading related (i.e. business critical) incidents.
-- Time sensitive communication.
− Running both technical conference bridges and business update calls.
-- Collating technical and business impact.
-- Driving decision making for incident resolution and minimising impact to the business.
-- Escalation to Senior IT Management.
-- Providing incident updates to stakeholders.
-- Capturing incident follow ups and completing formal Post Mortems.
-- Identifying stability trends and escalating them through the Problem Management process.
▪ Coordination with BCP/DR team for regulatory testing that leverages Planned Events programs.
▪ Excellent communication (both verbal and written). The ability to communicate confidently and clearly on conference calls, in meetings, via email, etc. at all levels of the organization is essential.
▪ Strong organizational skills -- the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
▪ Proven troubleshooting skills within a support environment including a strong sense of commitment and drive towards incident resolution.
▪ Technical aptitude. To demonstrate this an understanding of technology used in Investment Banking is required (i.e. one or more of: Unix / Linux, Windows, storage, networking, databases, IT security, market data, web / intranet infrastructure, messaging, mainframe or sales and trading application support).
▪ Client focus and ownership - use of own initiative and a proactive approach to work.

The role is for an expert with Kerberos, authentication technologies and protocols in general, and Unix system security. The successful candidate will join an engineering team in IT Security in a multinational enterprise. This team manages, evaluates and creates the core security infrastructure for the Firm including Kerberos and related utilities, identity management, SecurID, RADIUS, and more. The candidate should be the subject matter expert in one or more of these areas.

The ideal candidate must have a very strong technical foundation in networking and Unix systems. The candidate must be a technical leader, have strategic visions, and have excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to collaborate well with global partners.

Duties and responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:

- Analyze problems to determine the best solution
- Design solutions to challenging security problems
- Collaborate with peers to vet proposed designs
- Enhance existing in-house and vendor software
- Create new software to solve the Firm's core security challenges
- Review designs and assess risk from app dev and other teams in subject area
- Write formal security reviews in subject area
- Provide engineering escalations to services and operations teams
- Able to support afterhours escalation
- Provide expert level troubleshooting and resolve problems
- Create, review and maintain documentation
- Create, review and make presentation
- Lead and mentor junior members of the team in technical areas
- Provide training to services and operations team members
- Run projects and take it from inception to turnover to production
- Collaborate with peer teams globally and communicate frequently
- Meet with vendors to assess commercial products for use in the Firm
This is a deeply technical role requiring enterprise experience and suited to a true product/subject matter expert. The role is an engineering position and as such is suited ONLY to those with previous system engineering or architecture design experience.

- Excellent communication skills, both spoken and written
- Solid understanding in one or more: Kerberos, RADIUS, SecurID, identity management
- Solid understanding of common network and system attack methods
- Solid understanding of security best practices
- Expert level PERL programming
- Strong C programming
- Strong Unix system background
- Strong knowledge of Unix networking (sockets)
- Solid understanding of IP networking (TCP/IP and standard services)
- Prior experience in multinationals and large infrastructure
- Ability to write technical and operations documentation
- Ability to describe technical concept verbally and on paper
- General understanding of Kerberos, RADIUS, SecurID (where not expert)
- Interoperability between Unix and Windows authentication
- Challenges in identity management
- Knowledge of SPNEGO, SAML, single-signon, multi-factor authentication
- Project management

The role will focus on the security products and tooling utilized to manage the platform. The role is suited to an experienced Systems Administrator or Platform Engineer with a proven understanding in enterprise platform security. An additional key component of this role is project based, with numerous activities to expand and enhance the services provided within the environment.

The Platform Security Engineer group provides a stable, yet agile and dynamic infrastructure platform to support the business functional requirements whilst managing associated risks.

The core responsibilities of this role include:
- Analysis and Development of platform security initiatives

Company seeks a qualified goal oriented candidate to fill the position of Senior Data Center Mechanical Project Engineer for our New York City office. Our facilities are highly critical in nature requiring 24 x 7 uptime operation. The candidate shall posses an appropriate balance of engineering expertise and leadership to successfully fulfill strategic initiatives by working with the various in-house and external consultants, facilities operation personnel, clients and management. This role requires a comprehensive understanding of how large financial institutions operate, key challenges faced in this environment and an ability to navigate the evolving requirements both strategically and operationally. In addition, the candidate shall demonstrate a high degree of critical thinking skills to develop innovative design solutions to complex engineering issues.
Responsibilities

Provide a high degree of cooperation and team building among the various stakeholders. Develop and maintain strong relationships with all Company personnel and outside consultants
Direct and manage the design of critical facilities mechanical infrastructure to achieve the project objectives, resiliency requirements, schedule and manage project risk goals
Provide support to the facilities operations team to improve, remediate and upgrade existing systems
Provide input and support for commissioning efforts to determine completeness and accuracy of procedures in an effort to demonstrate compliance with the design intent
Work with the project managers, contractors, operations engineers, landlord, consultants, etc. to implement the project design/upgrades in a timely and cost effective manner
Review and recommend actions on property leases or acquisitions to accommodate the existing or proposed mechanical systems to meet the project objectives
Develop and maintain corporate standards and specifications governing critical facilities and critical infrastructure and ensure proper and consistent implementation
Provide global engineering support to regions outside of North America to assist with projects, peer reviews, development of standards, etc (occasional travel required)
Coordinate with key stakeholders to ensure capacity planning for future requirements
Work with our sourcing team to develop a Scope of Work (SOW) for incorporation into Request for Proposals (RFPs) for engineering, architectural, commissioning, cable plant design, construction and project management services. Interview and make recommendations for vendor selections
Benchmark the Company critical facilities in relation to industry best practice
Maintain industry awareness/knowledge of new technology infrastructure hardware, trends, and future requirements and potential applications to our portfolio

Customers / Stakeholders
Work with Company project management team to effectively deliver projects within schedule and budget
Develop and maintain a strong professional working relationship and trust with executive and senior management of IT/Enterprise Data Center, Real Estate, Property Operations, Business Continuity, Security and Multi Media groups

Challenges
Develop highly reliable engineering systems to maximize uptime and mitigate risk to the firm
Coordinate designs and standards to ensure consistent and adequate resiliency, maintainability, capacity and performance across global critical facilities
Assist in managing and participating in major power shutdowns and Pull-the-Plug tests during non working hours
Work in a dynamic team setting where diverging ideas and points of view are the norm and part of the value creating process
BS in Mechanical Engineering, MS in Engineering and/or PE is a plus
10 years + experience in the design, management and trouble shooting of data centers systems
Experience as an engineering manager, working directly with financial institutions is preferable, but not a requirement
Excellent interpersonal, communications and people management skills
Consultative and client-centric approach in service delivery, supported by strong problem solving skills
A high degree of professionalism and discretion in managing internal clients and other stakeholders
title: EDC Data Center Mechanical Engineer

The Business Intelligence Solution Architect/Engineer's role is to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Business Intelligence Solution Architect/Engineer is also responsible for ensuring high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.

We are looking for a BI practitioner/expert, that has spanned the full BI Stack, from ETL to Database Development to Reporting and Analysis; Yet, hands-on skills are also critical in order to stay agile and connected with the team as well as staying abreast of technology/products in the BI space

Serve as point of contact for user community with the Enterprise Business Intelligence and Services (EBIS) team. Provide technical consulting and advice to application development teams across the firm that are either current or prospective users of the technology that our department offers to support Data Integration, Reporting and Analytics.

Manage and/or consult on the architecture and design of solutions in the BI space. Developing innovative solutions or improvements that will result in enhancements to current methods, procedures and processes.

Responsibilities
* Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.
* Act as evangelist for BI/DI across the organization; promoting BI usage to relevant departments.
* Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems.
* Solid understanding of Business Objects XI product installation, architecture and security
* Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs.
* Development of the semantic layer, meta-data, reports, and report definitions.
* Development of graphs and portal interfaces where appropriate.
* Assist in the design of databases and data warehouses to ensure interoperability with BI solutions.
* Assist with installation, configuration and maintenance of new/existing hardware and software infrastructure. For example: Setting up user accounts, permissions and passwords; interacting with other infrastructure groups (i.e. Windows engineering)
* Ability to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues in an efficient and timely manner. Coordinating with other team members to resolve problems as necessary
* Support hardware/software installations, upgrades and migrations
* Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, design functional specifications for BI front-end applications.
* Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.
* Conduct job duties and responsibilities according to the organization's business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology.
* Design and deliver end-user training, best practices and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.
* Troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary.
* Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.
* Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team.
* Project documentation, status reviews
* Working with other internal infrastructure teams to build, manage and problem-solve
* Participating in team's on-call rotation, providing after-hours support and handling of escalated issues
* Working with BI technology vendors to resolve problems and suggest enhancements
* Working in a high-pressured environment
* This is not an entry-level position.
* University bachelor degree (Computer Science, Information Systems or Computer Engineering)
* Minimum 5+ years of combined experience in data warehousing/business intelligence/analytics and reporting systems.
* 3+ years of SAP Business Objects (BOXI) and/or IBM Cognos administration or consulting experience (deployments, troubleshooting, and installation)
* Hands on management of reporting infrastructure.
* Solid Windows server administration skills
* Experience with integrating 3rd party products into enterprise infrastructure
* Sound knowledge of BO XI Universe Design, DeskI/WebI, Data Integrator, SAP BW, including Administration and Configuration Functions.
* Strong ability to analyze user requirements, make recommendations and implement solution
* Experience working in a complex and distributed BOE/Cognos environment
* Experience in configuring and administering security in BOXI and/or Cognos
* Experience in migrating content between various BOXI environments
* Self driven and should be able to troubleshoot and provide quick resolutions to server related issues.
* Must have a solid understanding and hands-on experience of Business Objects XI Applications (Webi, Infoview, Crystal, Deski, Universe Designer)
* Strong working knowledge of relational database structure, theories, principles and practices (Sybase; DB2; SQL Server)
* Full project management and development life cycle experience
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
* Ability to prioritize and execute in high-pressured environment
* Business Objects certification
* Work experience in Business Objects XI R3.1
* Work experience in Cognos 9
* Experience with Windows AD and siteminder (SSO) configuration

* Experience with ProClarity/Microsoft Performance Point analytics

This role is for a Sr. Architect specializing in the areas of high performance and ultra-low latency networks. The candidate must have demonstrated experience and ability to architect, design, configure, and troubleshoot large scale high performance networks in support of financial institutions.

Key Responsibilities for the role include (but are not limited to):
Provide local and global leadership, direction, and ownership for high performance financial network designs and standards.
Work with internal, external, and industry partners to facilitate strategic solutions and help drive competitive innovations.
Provide governance, support, and operational escalation for the production environment.
Representing the global team at cross divisional and external forums to discuss strategy, direction, plans, and status.
The successful candidate will be expected to possess a complete set of network engineering and personality skills including:
Analysis - Identify an issue and determine a solution
Scoping - Ensure the business and technical needs are addressed. Design a solution based on the requirement
Configuration - Create a configuration based on the design and solution
3rd level troubleshooting - Assist and provide technical leadership
Educate & Train - Coach peers and colleagues on new technologies and ideas
Presentation Skills -- Prepare, construct and deliver formal and informal presentations to illustrate ideas, solutions and issues
Review - Continually review and challenge themselves, others and the firms perceived norm
Innovate - identify opportunities to enhance, improve and use new ideas and technologies within the environment
Technical Skills Required
The successful candidate will be expected to possess the following technical skills:
Exceptional and extensive knowledge of LAN, MAN & WAN architectures; design, protocols, troubleshooting and packet-level analysis.
Familiarity with financial applications and protocols.
Thorough understanding of internetworking protocols, products and services including Multicast, OSPF, RIP and BGP.
Current knowledge of Vendor products in the High Performance Computing and Low Latency Network space.
Ability to supervise technical support staff.
Ability to communicate effectively emphasizing both written and oral presentation skills.
Education and Experience
BS Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
10+ years of work experience within network industry with a preference for Financial or equivalent sector.
Demonstrated experience with High Performance Computing or Low Latency Network technologies.


PLEASE EMAIL RESUMES TO :dominique.arnold@newcapitalsolutions.com
title: SR Architect Engineer

body:
This is a management position within the Global Release Management (GRM) group. The GRM group supports the technology organization across in terms of Software Configuration Management (SCM), Environments Management, and Release Management processes. The Environments Manager would be responsible for managing the overall usage, maintenance, and delivery of the various controlled environments (QA, P/T, Staging, and Production).

Responsibilities
- Work with QA, Project and Release Managers to coordinate environmental needs for the various controlled environments (QA, P/T, Staging, and Production).
- Act as Moody's control tower for environments (much like an air traffic controller in airports) providing plans, tracking and approval for environmental deployments.
- Liaise with development teams and Technology Operations to ensure efficient usage of infrastructure components.
- Liaise with Build Managers, Development teams, DBA's and Technology Operations to manage and coordinate environment deployments (hardware, software, and service management processes)
- Create project plans and coordinate activities specific to environmental build outs, refreshes and upgrades.
- Identify environmental contentions and work with appropriate parties to address these issues in a timely manner.
- Document the various environments and keep environmental diagrams up to date.
- Ensure environments are maintained with the appropriate data sets for testing and production support efforts
- Design a tracking procedure that allows all parties to identify exactly what version and what components (application code, hardware, software, database, middleware etc) resides in every environment.
- Keep up to date the CMDB - a database that lists all environment components organized by hardware, by application, by environment.
- Ensure that environmental deployments are carried out according to defined procedures (For example: up to date Release Notes are provided)
- Work closely with Technology Operations to ensure environment availability, stability and functional readiness
- Management environments Forward Schedule of Change (FSC) for all controlled environments
- Actively manage and identify opportunities to optimize existing processes and usage for overall cost savings (i.e. - server consolidation, multi-application environments, etc.)

Qualifications
- 3-5 years project management/coordination experience
- 3-5 years experience within Infrastructure.
- Experience and understanding of the principles applied in Technology Operations deployments and refreshes, software configuration & build management and quality assurance processes.
- Experience managing consultant resources (offshore and onsite)
- Knowledge of application and infrastructure concepts and technologies:
*Databases: Sybase, MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2
*Middleware/Other: WAS, Informatica, FileNet, and Cognos
*Concepts: Database Replication, ETL, DST, Control-M, hardware profiles, application / hardware monitoring
- Ability to quickly understand systems from an end to end architectural perspective.
- Ability to understand data flow across 100+ applications.
- Ability to read and understand architecture, network and database design documents.
- Self-starter
- Results orientation
- Excellent communication skills

PLEASE EMAIL RESUMES TO :dominique.arnold@newcapitalsolutions.com

The Information Security team is responsible for helping the organization balance risk by aligning policies and procedures with business requirements. The team is responsible for the development, enforcement and monitoring of security controls, policies and procedures, and for the delivery of security services. The Information Security team sets strategic direction for security within the organization and aligns with stakeholders throughout the company.
Responsibilities
Information Security Group is looking for an AVP of Information Security to join its growing organization. This is a challenging position requiring a strong background in Information Security practice, deep knowledge of Information Security standards and relevant regulations, and solid communication and organization skills. The candidate is very motivated and willing to take on challenges, able to multi-task to succeed and has the ability work independently and with minimal oversight.

Functional Responsibilities

-Manage the successful delivery of Information Security projects and services for our customers by working directly with key business stakeholders, IT executives and project teams.
-Manage the Information Security vendor assessment program including incoming requests regarding policies and controls.
-Develop and oversee Information Security metrics.
-Develop, maintain and align Information Security policies and procedures with industry best practices and business needs.
-Ensure that policies and procedures are followed during the security request lifecycle.
-Manage Information Security reviews of internally developed and acquired software and services.
-Assist other technical teams in resolution of security incidents and outages related to information security controls, including coordinating of information security resources and root cause analysis.

Qualifications

Minimum education and work experience required for this position include:

-Minimum 7 years experience in IT industry, preferably in a financial services organization.
-BS or BA degree, preferably in technology/business or equivalent.
-Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM or PMP are a plus.

Key Tech and Non-Tech Skills

-Ability to think with a security mindset. The successful candidate has a strong IT background with expert level knowledge of a key security practice area: access control; application security; network security; monitoring; endpoint; etc.
-Strong knowledge of regulatory standards that govern Information Security practices such as SOX, PCI, and state and federal privacy laws.
-Experiencing managing and developing an ISO-27002 aligned security program.
-Strong written and oral communication skills including the ability to interact directly with customers that do not have an IT background.
-Proven ability to work within a large enterprise that spans multiple continents is governed by change management and has a tiered support model.
-Proven ability to lead projects and initiatives within schedule and budget.
-Strong experience using Excel to produce effective reports and using Visio and MS Project to create process diagrams, workflows and project plans.
title: Information Security Engineer

body:
Objective

The Senior Quality Assurance Engineer performs various lead performance duties. The role applies performance testing techniques to ensure predictive performance engineering focus for applications. The goal is to ensure that systems hardware configuration together with architecture allows for most optimal capacity, performance and scalability. The Senior Quality Assurance Performance Engineer applies and maintains test documentation such as test plans, test cases and automated test scripts. The role requires expertise in modeling and simulation and day to day tasks will be performed with cutting edge performance engineering technologies (such as CA Hyperformix, Shunra and HP Performance Center).

Functional Responsibilities - Specific responsibilities for this position include:
-Applying Predictive IT Management techniques to assist with configuring systems in the most optimal manner
-Provide performance analysis to assist with hardware and system consolidation efforts
-Create models and run simulations to analyze performance and capacity characteristics
-Setup and configure performance testing tools to gather complete results. Analyze these results to determine next steps. Provide various teams (Infrastructure, Architecture and Development) with recommendations on tuning
-Writing and revising automated test scripts and test documentation for a variety of financial applications, working with other performance engineers, business analysts, product managers and developers to ensure adequate coverage for upcoming production releases
-Planning testing approach, executing tests and reporting the results according to IT Performance Testing standards
-Making recommendations, assessing industry best practices and striving for constant improvements to ensure most effective performance testing and engineering approach

Scope/Supervision and Interaction
Likely interactions are with AVP of Performance Testing and Performance Engineers to collaborate on testing workload. Application Development Managers, Technical Leads, Developers, Product Managers, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Manager and Leads. Interaction will also occur with DBA?s, Systems and Network Administrators.


Qualifications

Four-year degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics and at least 7 years experience in computer systems, software engineering, performance analysis, or at least 10 years equivalent professional experience.

Must have knowledge of mainstream operating systems (i.e. Linux, Unix, Windows); basic networking concepts, such as TCP/IP and routing, as well as common hardware architectures; database concepts. Understanding of the client/server paradigm; demonstrated programming skills, preferably in an object-oriented language; knowledge of the following skills: modeling, load testing, or benchmarking; and knowledge of the scientific method. Also, individual should have written and oral communication skills.

The key competencies for this position include:
-Strong understanding of automated performance testing approach, including implementation of automation frameworks.
-Strong understanding of modeling and simulations
-Strong understanding of server virtualization concepts
-Expertise in CA Hyperformix
-Experience with workload planning & estimation and test documentation.
-Strong understanding with monitoring concepts and tools
-Excellent skills with object-oriented development languages
-Strong understanding of Web 2.0 technology and testing
-Strong understanding of Server, Network, and database concepts
-Strong understanding of software development life cycle, quality assurance life cycle and testing methodologies.
-Good understanding of test metrics concepts
-Proven expertise in analyzing and understanding business requirements and translating these into test cases and test scripts.
-Excellent oral and written communications skills
-Strong analytical skills
-Ability to multi-task and display flexibility
-Ability to work effectively both in a team environment and independently
-Familiarity with HP Performance Testing Tools: HP Performance Center and/or LoadRunner is a strong plus
-Familiarity with Shunra / any WAN emulation technology is a plus
title: Lead QA Capacity Engineer

The Client Service Specialist is responsible for delivering the face of production management to specific business areas. This role ensures the corporate delivery of production management services reflects the needs of each individual business unit, aligning the production management groups that provide services to each business

Client Service Specialists foster solid and meaningful partnerships with customers and service providers which is key to delivery and the ongoing improvement of technology delivery within the organisation for the benefit of clients.

Tasks / Responsibilities:

Customer Management:
 Responsible for the relationship with key stakeholders in each business line.
 Gather requirements and sets up Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
 Manage Financials
o Manage statement of account
o Maximize return on investment ensuring real value in all services
 Drives detailed project integration.
 Understands and integrates the goals and objectives of each business into production management requirements and delivery
 Conducts performance reporting.

Process Management:
 Ensure all interfaces between Client Services process and all other Production Management processes function efficiently and are clear and fully understood by all parties
 Maintain Client Services position within the full process orchestration
 Remove wasteful / inefficient process through continuous improvement
 Measure and report on efficiency of process
 Improves and adapts processes, where necessary, to align with the changing needs of the business to ensure optimum service availability and delivery.

Tasks / Responsibilities:

Product / Business Service Management:
 Serve as IT Product Manager (ITPM) for all production applications under management of each client group.
 Face-off to Application Services and any change (CTB) teams to gain additional knowledge on applications
 Prioritize and request development of applications to increase Stability and reduce run cost (RTB)
 Approve / signs-off for productionisation of new components and services
 Approve / signs-off for changes to existing components and services.
 Interface with Production Management workstreams to ensure increased stability:
o Change Management team -- Retain ultimate approval for any Global Change Management (GCM) item that affects specific business production environments
o Problem Management -- Ensure remediation plans are understood by App Services and business stakeholders.
o Deployment Management -- Approve and agree to schedule for deployment
o Governance -- Ensure all responsibilities for each business area are on track and delivered.
o Manage scheduled Market, Internal DB and regulatory events.

Governance, Compliance & Risk Management:
 Validate Configuration Management production data for each business
 Manage any business specific production management related Audit and Compliance issues
 Facilitate better preparedness for the Production Services team for each business specific audit, compliance and regulatory reviews
 Work with COO team for central compliance
 Provide business specific metrics for production management for current and potential issues -- provide thresholds to ensure timely remediation

Programme Management:
 Support PMO activity.
 Present and coordinate PM activities within respective business and technology groups affected.
 Display awareness of the Client Services book of work, projects prioritization and resources related to all deliverables for the businesses that are under management.
 Provide project management support across Client Services.

Key Functions :
- Main face off to Clients & Business Solutions
- End User Services
- Service Desk
- Knowledge / Configuration / Service Level Management
- Incident / Problem Management

Experience | Exposure (Recommended):
- Strong Communication Skills, be able to interact across variety of audiences
- Tactful but a firm partner to the Business, besides impeccable skills, the successful candidate will have the confidence to scale back business/IT decisions or requirements where
appropriate, Diplomacy is a must
- High level Understanding about Finance Business Processes and the key submissions like GAAP & Regulatory reporting is the key
- Good understanding on SAP, BW and BCS especially with expertise on FI/CO & COPA Modules
- ''Change Agent'', ability to drive things forward and hold responsible teams accountable
- Good Analytical, networking and relationship management skills
- Able to work effectively with distributed teams, experience working in Global teams, Vendors & Matrix organization is a must

Education | Certification (Recommended):
 Financial / Technology industry trade
 Bachelor Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in IT-related discipline (or equivalent)
 ITIL V3 Certification (or equivalent)
 Project Management accreditation PMI
