To be effective in this role, you will have at least two years experience in Investment Banking IT Application Support

Working as part of the Global Finance and Foreign Exchange (GFFX) IT front office production service team; you will provide first level support to the Trading & Sales business for a suite of applications and their associated components.

Summary:

The Production Management Analyst acts as a hands-on technician executing several tasks in relation to the required services within the production environment. The Production Management Analyst role supports the respective functional teams and provides expertise and assistance to ensure effective services are provided by production management.

The main tasks of the Production Management Analyst are: monitoring and tracking activities, analysing issues, supporting the resolution of issues and conflicts, and preparing reports and meetings. The Production Management Analyst has knowledge of and experience in all relevant tools used in the Production Management environment.

Tasks / Responsibilities:
Provide technical advice around the applications ensuring that all issues are recorded
Act as second level support and escalation to the offshore production service teams
Management and communication of major production incidents
Liaising with Development teams on new Application Handover and 3rd line escalation issues
Investigate and resolve issues escalated by users globally
Drive Incident & assist in the Problem Management Functions
Liaise with Development teams on new Application Handover and 3rd line issue escalation
Roll out application releases

Areas of Specialty:

Service Desk Management
The PM Analyst with focus on Service Desk Management will support the management in all activities providing a single point of presence for all IT Customers to report incidents and forward requests for service. The PM Analyst will assist the incident management process and operation to restore production service as soon as possible and to mitigate the impact to production during an incident.

Area specific tasks / responsibilities:
Receive all calls, emails and web enquiries on incident
Record incidents (incl. request for service), classify and prioritize them
Support implementation of workarounds


Experience | Exposure:

To be effective in this role, you will have at least two years experience in Investment Banking IT Application Support plus the following;

Global Finance and Foreign Exchange (GFFX) production support experience
Good working knowledge of Oracle SQL
Knowledge of UNIX
Understanding of Network/Firewalls
Ability to conduct Level 1 diagnostics analysis and trouble shooting
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and work in a fast moving environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - ability to liaise with front and back office
Ability to work as part of an existing support team
Ability to multi task and manage multiple projects
Understanding of Project Life Cycle and release procedures

Education | Certification (Recommended):
Bachelor Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in IT or Computer Science related discipline (equivalent diploma or technical faculty)
ITIL V3 foundation certification (preferred)
title: Production Management Analyst

body:
The role is on the Business Solutions team as a Program Manager for the Alternative Funds Services business. This AFS business is focused on providing middle and back-office administration services to all forms of Alternative funds; Hedge Funds, Fund of Hedge Funds, Private Equity, and Infrastructure funds. The Program manager will be responsible for the entire book of work in this space, and there is an opportunity to expand the role coverage to other areas in the Trust and Agency Services business over time.

Summary:
The Program Manager under direct supervision of the Global Head of Business Solutions for TAS and GES is responsible for all aspects of the AFS Program including scope, timelines, resources, budget, risks and issues, relationships, and communications. The books of work will includes multiple concurrent initiatives that need to be managed and coordinated to meet the client expectations for an timely accurate delivery.

The Program Manager will interact with senior management on the business team to formulate and synthesize the strategic book of work. The role requires advanced communication and presentation skills. The Program manager will be required to facilitate meetings with senior leaders of the business and IT to drive consensus across all stakeholders.

Tasks / Responsibilities:
Manage the AFS program to ensure high quality and timely delivery
Meet regularly with stakeholders to report status, arrange priorities and manage expectations.
Management of the Business Analysts assigned to the AFS program, including direct management responsibilities
Facilitate the annual budget planning process and then track the financials through the year to ensure adherence to the agreed budget
Establish appropriate governance structures for the program and the associated projects, and facilitate the meetings where appropriate
Ensure strict adherence to the methodology and artifacts detailed in Methods
Work with the multiple Application Services domains to coordinate project delivery and strategic alignment
Work with external counterparties such as clients and prime brokers during the client on-boarding phase to facilitate the technology integration with their transaction activity
Guide any the Top 100 projects in the AFS space through the "Getting to Gold" process
Formulate long-term IT strategy for the business and structure the program and deliveries accordingly
Timely escalation of any risk or issues that may affect delivery
Manage the collection of global requirements from AFS service locations worldwide


Experience / Exposure (Recommended):
Minimum 7 -- 10 years experience in Financial Services industry
Previous Program Management experience across large, complex programs with a track record of delivery
Previous experiences working with both development and client teams distributed globally across multiple locations
Strong understanding of technology best practices and industry standards
Proven track record of working effectively with vendors and consultants
Strong communication skills and presentation abilities
Understanding of the Alternative Funds space, and the service offerings of an administrator
Knowledge of various asset classes and instrument pricing approaches


Education / Certification (Recommended):
Undergraduate Degree from an accredited college or university (or equivalent diploma / work experience)
PMI Certification
Project Management (Bootcamp) Accreditation
title: VP GT Program Manager Alternative Funds Services

body:
Strong and growing distributor of industrial processing supplies (25+ years) is revising its internal and external marketing plans and needs to fill a new in-house position for a marketing graphics/marketing communications specialist. This is a flexible, multi-faceted position still in development and can be shaped to fit the right candidate.

This position will interact continually with our advertising and marketing agency and share responsibility for delivering all needed materials. It is expected to grow in responsibilities and capabilities to absorb functions from the agency and provide them in-house. It represents an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate to develop as a broadly-skilled graphics and information developer, with a chance to learn from established sales, industry and marketing experts. Support for individual continuing education (online courses, local college extension classes, etc.) is possible.

The basic job description is as follows:
Provide marketing graphics support to sales staff, using existing library of product images and information and creating new elements when needed.
Produce, from both scratch and existing templates, new, updated and customer-specific sales and marketing materials in both print and electronic form.
Organize, update and continually create and develop product image library (photo, video, 2D CAD and 3D modeling) as well as written descriptions and specifications.
Maintain and update product-oriented web site.
Assist with all marketing efforts including advertising, targeted customer materials and trade show materials and presentations.
Learn the basics of our industry and its applications in the field so as to be able to provide intelligent support to the sales staff and through them, customers.
Act as in-house liaison and support for our advertising and marketing agency.

You must have all or most of the following skills and experience:
Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite 4 or later (5.5 will be used in-house), especially the print, web and graphics tools. Proficiency with or aptitude to learn the CS5.5 video editing
and creation tools and Flash is a big plus.
Experience with recent versions of TurboCAD or an equivalent tool, especially in creating 3D models (illustration quality, not necessarily CAM quality).
Experience with Acrobat Pro, from document creation through detailed modification and assembly from multiple sources, including embedding of 3D model images. (We will be using Acrobat Pro X and Tetra 4D.)
Proficiency with Microsoft Word for editing and basic document creation (InDesign will be used for all formatted documents) and Powerpoint for sales presentations.
General proficiency with Windows 7 including print management and ability to create and organize an extensive library of graphic materials.
Good writing, editing and composition skills.

Highly desirable skills you should have or be prepared to acquire include:
Product photography & videography, including image and video editing and video creation.
Web site design and basic structural coding, including remote file management.
Social media management (a maybe. . . not many of our customers tweet).

The hours and conditions of this position are flexible and adaptable to the right candidate's preferences and circumstances. There is more than enough need for a full-time person but we can consider part-time and flexible hours, especially to accommodate related continuing education. Part-time telecommuting is possible after the position is established, if you have an equivalently-equipped workstation and fast internet or VPN capabilities. We offer competitive pay.

Send a resume and a cover letter detailing both your strengths and weaknesses related to our position's needs -- we don't expect to find a perfect candidate so knowing exactly what you can bring to this position will be important.
title: Marketing Communications Specialist

body:
Hi,

We are a web development firm working on a project where we require the assistance of experts in 3D modeling and Scripting to work with the open source applications Blender and Make Human. Specifically we need to build a human model and rendering with different configurations of clothing such as changing the cut of the model's shirt, changing the colour or pattern, collar shape, etc. There are really two people that we need:

1. 3D modelling specialist that can build a realistic model of a shirt, and compose a nice scene for it in Blender. We also need a model of a person but this can be generic such as a Make Human stock model. The clothing must be built to adjust to the Make Human model's body. i.e. if the body is fattened, the shirt should adjust accordingly.

2. Programmer who can automate the rendering of all the different human model and clothing possibilities. So this would include pulling a variety of human models from Make Human with different body types, improting them into blender, swapping colours and materials of the 3D models in the scene, swapping different 3D models in and out of the scene, rendering the scene from multiple viewpoints and finally saving all the rendered images in a raster format like PNG. Thre will probably be millions of images generated so EVERYTHING must be done programmatically and be fully automated. We would also require the script to be built in an intuitive way so that we can update it later with new 3D models, colours or textures on the 3D models without having to dig through the whole mess of code.

If you think you have the skills to do one or both of the above jobs then please respond to this ad with either a portfolio of your 3d modelling work, or a brief summary of your Blender / Make Human programming experience. If it sounds good we will have a phone conversation and then likely request a formal proposal or quotation.

Thank you
title: Programmers and 3D modelers with Blender and Make Human Experience

body:
I need several macros to insert in forms. I am using Office 2010 word. Here is a summary of what I have to work with and the macros that are needed.
The forms are to be on the Web and downloadable by the end user. He should be able to fill in the forms and print them.
First macro: I have several forms which will require the input by the end user of a "name" and "date" and/or "state". I would like a macro for each which will put a "insert name" or whatever into the space on the form template. When this is checked and the person types his name, the "insert name" will disappear.
Second macro, I would like to insert a comment at the same time. Thus, when I put in the "insert name" there will be a comment box off to the right which will say for example, insert your full legal name, etc.
Third macro: Some of the forms may have a choice between two paragraphs in the form. The user will check one of the boxes representing his choice. The paragraph he choses will remain. At the same time, the unchecked boxes and their corresponding paragraphs will disappear and the form will be one continuous form.
Fourth macro: Some forms require setting forth the State. This is generally at the top of the form. Therefore need a drop down menu to select the "state" from.
Fifth macro: Depending on which state is selected, (from above if possible) a paragraph (from another document) will be inserted into the form, at the end of the form, corresponding to that particular state's requirements.
Sixth macro: After the form is filled in, need a box with a question asking if all the information such as name, State, date, etc are filled in to their satisfaction and they are ready to print the form. If so, then be able to print the form without the comments. This can be by a macro eliminating the comments or anyway that is feasible.
title: Macros VB for Word 2010

The Society for Arts and Technologies [SAT] (http://sat.qc.ca) is currently looking for a web integrator, html5/css/js:

http://sat.qc.ca/post.php?post_id=2187&lang=en

The selected candidate will join a team of developers and researchers and participate in the development of a virtual, interactive exposition on the web, linked to a mobile, augmented reality application..

Position type: Contract
Start date: Immediate





Responsibilities




In collaboration with project members, the web integrator will be responsible for :


  • Create stylesheets and html templates in conformity with W3C coding standards.

  • Ensure of the validity of the code (must pass W3C validator)

  • Ensure of the accessibility of the generated pages.

  • Integrate pages and components in Wordpress.




Competencies




  • Excellent knowledge of html and css.

  • Kwowledge of html5 and web semantics

  • Knowledge of web microformats

  • Knowledge of government and W3C web accessibility guidelines (WCAG 2.0 A, AA).

  • Asset: knowledge of Wordpress and php

  • Asset: knowledge of javascript (javascript code must be valid), jQuery, json

  • Asset: familiarity with Python Django framework (if not, somebody will be available to guide you through it)

  • Asset: knowledge of software configuration management tools (Git)




Soft skills




  • Team work

  • Be autonomous and proactive

  • Curious

  • Attention to detail

  • Ability to propose solutions to respond to the various project constraints (creative, technical, ...) structured and organized

  • Interest in open and accessible development

  • Interest in arts and culture, an asset.





About the SAT



Founded in 1996, the SAT is a transdisciplinary center dedicated to research and creation, production, education, and the dissemination of digital culture.

As a meeting place, the SAT brings researchers and creative communities together via its productions, prototypes, research programs, publications, educational programs and public exchanges. The center strongly encourages creation, scientific advancement, and the transfer of knowledge.

The SAT provides digital art amateurs and professionals with a collaborative forum and a practical context wherein they can develop innovative projects as well as debate current issues related to emergent technologies.

body:
My partner and I are a small web design company. We build a lot of customized wordpress websites. Recently, we're taking on larger projects that require more and more custom programming. I would like to establish a relationship with a competent programmer that can handle programming tasks from time to time. These tasks will be different every time, but here are some recent jobs that I would have liked to hire someone local to help me with:

1. Write a basic Wordpress plugin that calculates the number of posts/comments of a user, and assigns a numeric score (I know there are some plugins like this already out there, but this one needed to work differently...)
2. Write a widget that displays a list of users who perform certain tasks on the site.
3. Write a custom loop to display certain category of posts on a specific page (this is a small job).

If these sound like things you would know how to do, than you are probably qualified to do this work. In addition to technical ability with PHP, MySQL, and Wordpress, it's really important that you are able to work independently. The main reason why I want to hire a helper is that I have my hands full these days. I have no desire to oversee your every move or micromanage you.

I'm open to negotiation about how much money you will get paid. I don't really like the idea of hiring by the hour (I'd prefer to pay by the job), but I'm picturing paying approximately $25/hour. An average "gig" might pay between $100-$300, depending on the complexity. If you do one or two jobs, and prove that you're reliable, I'll have TONS of work for you.

Let me know if you're interested.
title: Wanted: PHP & MySQL programmer

body:
We have an immediate need for two well-rounded LAMP resources. We service a number of development contracts - in Atlanta and remotely - as well as manage some internal SaaS apps and are looking to fill a number of positions in the coming weeks, so please send along a resume even if you are not an ideal fit for the role listed below.

Note: To be considered, you must provide a resume and a ballpark hourly rate range you would require for the work listed below.

Role #1: Internal SaaS Development and Support
Our most immediate need involves LAMP/JQuery work. We need assistance in supporting and adding new modules to an internal (and mature) Software as a Service app that we maintain. This resource will be tasked with the following:
  • Creating new modules (using PHP/JQuery/MySQL) for a SaaS application that have been spec'd out by senior resources.
  • Updating/Enhancing existing modules (written in PHP/JQuery/MySQL), so the ability to quickly read and understand existing code is important
  • Providing email and phone support to our existing customers.
  • Content Management Updates - This requires a fundamental understanding of HTML and CSS (table-less design). Occasional graphic design contributions are also welcome if you have that skill, but are not required.


Role #2: Client Contract Development
We provide software development for a number of customers around the Atlanta area and beyond. If you are in the Atlanta area and possess the skills listed below, send us your resume and we can quickly staff you on one of these projects. These tend to be shorter term in nature, however they are a good way to get to work quickly and to eventually transition to internal work with our company.


Technical Skills Required:
  • PHP
  • MySQL
  • JQuery
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Javacsript

Non-Technical Skills Required:
  • Friendliness
  • Technical Well-Roundedness
  • Ability to Self-Start
  • Desire to succeed


Resources will work on an hourly basis (billed 1099 or corp-to-corp). Resources that are a good fit with us will have the option of converting to W2.

If the above roles don't suit you perfectly, just send along your resume, and we may have other ones that will. Most of our projects involve straight PHP/JQuery/MySQL work, but we occasionally take on other projects that could involve anything from Ruby on Rails to .NET to Visual Basic. We also get occasional Front End Development work that involves wireframe markup, hand-coded html, CSS, client side scripting and UI effects.

The key here is versatility. We like a resource that isn't pigeon-holed into one discipline over another. We also like someone who is flexible and can comfortably move from project to project. If you're intelligent, easy-going, well-rounded, and hard-working, we can probably put you to work!

Some of our projects allow remote work, so communication is critical. We communicate extensively through tools like IM, audio chat, and phone. It's critical that you be a self-starter and self-motivated. Our projects do not typically involve someone staring over your shoulder, but we place high expectations on resources to deliver results in a timely manner.

Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter or have a "team" you are trying to staff. We are looking for an actual resource to begin work immediately and who will report directly to us and our clients

Thank you for your interest
title: Full-Time Well Rounded PHP/JQuery/MySQL Resource Wanted

body:
Location: Boston, MA
URL: www.brightcove.com

This is a great opportunity to help shape the future of interactive media and television. As an engineer building this exciting new media platform, you will help invent and deliver video experiences that touch millions of people around the world. You will join a talented team of software, Web and media veterans from companies such as Allaire, ATG, Comcast, Macromedia, Lycos and News Corp., led by the company's founder and Internet pioneer Jeremy Allaire. Visit www.brightcove.com for more information.

The right candidate must be an exceptional Software Engineer with strong academic background. Candidate must be a self starter, a strong communicator, work well with others and be able to adapt to changes quickly in a high pressure startup environment. This role is on the Professional Services team, where you will be working directly with some of the largest media companies in the world in helping them to launch their Brightcove-powered video experiences. Previous clients have included Showtime, The New York Times, Sun Microsystems and many more. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to build exciting solutions that touch millions of people.

Responsibilities: 
  • Lead architecture and conceptualization of complex web applications focused on front-end technologies.
  • Manage a small team of software engineers with varying levels of experience.
  • Work with Creative Designers to develop completed Human Interface designs with high attention to detail.
  • Participate actively in software design discussions.
  • Analyze, scope and design solutions based on customer requirements and architectures.
  • Write code that is functional, elegant and standards-compliant.
  • Document technical specifications and completed work and share internally and externally.
  • Collaborate with other team members on various components of projects.
  • Help support client-facing Sales efforts.
Qualifications: 
  • MS/BS in Computer Science or related background preferred.
  • Experience with complete software development processes a must.
  • 5-10 years of software development experience.
  • Expert in ActionScript and Flash.
  • Strong knowledge of JavaScript and DHTML.
  • Expert in designing and developing front-end solutions in Flash and JavaScript.
  • Experience building scalable Web applications and consumer online services.
  • Proficient in XML, Web Services and unit testing frameworks.
  • Knowledge of Java, PHP and XSLT a plus.
  • Excellent knowledge of Object-Oriented Design, Analysis, and Programming.
  • Excellent technical communication skills in both written and spoken English.
Location:
This position is based in Cambridge, MA.

Why you want to work for Brightcove:
Brightcove is the leading online video platform. Media companies, businesses, and organizations worldwide use Brightcove to publish and distribute video that reaches more than 135 million unique viewers every month. We've worked hard to create a company where talented, passionate people can thrive in a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration. Working at Brightcove gives you the chance to reshape how media is published and consumed worldwide while you develop your skills, grow your career, and have fun.

To apply: http://hire.jobvite.com/j/?cj=ojDPVfwq&s=37Signals and complete the easy-to-use on-line application process in the Careers section of our website. Brightcove is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).
title: Brightcove: Principal Solutions Engineer

body:
I am in need of game programming talent.
What does this mean exactly? Let me answer that with a couple questions.
Do you find yourself constantly in front a keyboard throwing together code for the simplest or complex of projects?
Do you enjoy the prospect of working on something that challenges your skills?
Does the idea of becoming a full time programmer for a game studio excite you?
I need someone to whom most or all these questions apply.
My dream is to create a viable full time pass time that pays as well as rewards creative development.
Who am I? My name is Curt Reinert, a graduate of a Bachelors in Digital Entertainment and Game Design seeking to create some fun projects that will bring success, fans and of course, income. I have some promising designs in tow and I hope you have some as well.

Now for the Musts:
Java, C#, C++, Python, LUA, OpenGL, Android SDK and/or Cocoa Touch experience.
Free time or potential free time of at least 10 hours a week. (Saturday meetings from 12pm to 3pm as well.)
PASSION for games. Not just playing them, but the ability to dissect them and use them as inspiration
Open to creative solutions/problem-solving.
Positive attitude (all about team work)

Pluses:
Love for all things nerd; Movies, Comics, Dungeons and Dragons, Expos, etc...
Previous projects (games, user interfaces, small applications, etc...)
Not treating this like work (Work doesn't always mean fun. This industry doesn't work off of the slacker, procrastinator attitude. Enjoying the development is just as important as the end product. Some days will be tough but it's all about PASSION!)

So, if you love to build projects, seek challenging prospects and don't mind putting in the time there is a good chance we can work together!
As of now this is a free time, voluntary "position". If/when we release a game, there will be payment from that at a predetermined rate/amount.
title: Video Game Programming

body:
Brave New Films ( http://bravenewfilms.org/ ) and Brave New Foundation http://www.bravenewfoundation.org/ are looking for a full-time Web Developer to guide and implement our online efforts. This is a unique and exciting opportunity for the right person to use their tech talents to help build vital an organization focused on progressive politics and social change (non profit).

Responsibilities include:
- Build HTML websites with light PHP code as well as more robust sites/online games with programming languages
- Develop queries to pull list segments for our emails deployments (using MySQL)
- Be on top of developments in social media, trends and technologies to guide and inform our distribution strategy
- Help determine new ideas using technology to reach people
- Manage ecommerce and donation infrastructure including set up donation pages on our sites
- Leverage design template of an existing site to build a new landing page on that site.
- Address technical aspects of online distribution as needed (post videos to RSS/podcasts/itunes accounts etc.)
- Develop and execute SEO for our sites

Skill set:
- Excellent knowledge of MySQL to be pull email and donor reports from database
- Experience in building HTML websites with PHP as well as WordPress for blogs
- Ability to quickly develop a landing page on an existing site that integrates with our email and donation database (ActionKit)
- Good time management and organizational skills.
- Good attention to detail
- Enjoys fast-paced environment of politics
- Experience in Ruby on Rails, Django, PHPCake, or other programming languages preferred but not required

We use technologies and services like PHP, MySQL, Wordpress, Disqus, ActionKit (email/CRM tool), Google Analytics, and Authorize.net.

We care less about writing perfect code or complying with every standard, and more about birthing the clever idea that'll wreak havoc on the establishment.

Politics moves fast. We have some pretty intense deadlines, so we're pragmatic. Think startup meets non-profit political rabble rousers. We also get along well with people that have an excellent work ethic, juggle multiple tasks under tight deadlines, and realize this is not a 9-5 job.

Our offices are located in the shadow of Sony studios in Culver City, CA (LA) and we're open to the person working on-site or living elsewhere in the U.S. Must have designated office space if home office.

** In your cover note, provide a list of sites you have developed. Your cover note needs to indicate you have visited our website; no automated or generic applications, please.***

Please forward cover note and resume to Laura.
**No recruiters and no web consulting agencies, please.
title: Brave New Films/Foundation seeks a full time web developer

body:
Wanted! Preferably Alive:
Professional Creative Director / Graphic Designer for a serious partnership opportunity

GetAHost is soliciting the services of a serious and highly advanced level creative graphics designer with an excellent track record who would like to put their skills and faith towards a collaborative effort in a partnership. Finding a graphics designer is the final frontier in our quest to fulfill our vision of becoming a leader not only in the web hosting market but beyond. This position will demand part to full time commitment and in turn "partners" can expect a direct slice of profits. You're no longer just a free lancer, you're a key component in a long term project.

Why would you invest your time in GetAHost?

You many be rightly wondering, "sorry to burst your cloud, getahost, webhosting is already over saturated!" Our answer to this is simple, we know what other hosts offer and we have the raw hardware and knowledgebase to beat them. Once you join us you will soon realize our vision which fundamentally shows that we work differently and think differently than many current companies in the web hosting space while still earning high ratings and high yields.

Not a one guy operation: We already have a coordinated and result oriented team filling all marketing, programming, and technical needs. The team has dozens of years of web hosting experience combined with each individual being expert in their field of expertise.

Long Term Potential: We retain our staff using a different type of incentive; each staff member has a vested and recurring ensured interest due to their retaining a stake of the company and subsequently having a direct incentive to do their best for the operation.

Starting a few steps ahead: Each person on the team is an expert, but that wouldn't make up for any hardware lapses. We have some of the latest and most cutting edge web servers out on the market dispersed across multiple datacenters.

For this position the following criteria as listed below must be met -- GetAHost.com reserves the right to revise or terminate these requirements at any time.

Applicant Criteria:
Minimum age to apply: 21 years at the time of sign-on.
No prior felonies or convictions in any jurisdiction throughout the world.
Minimum of Three years' experience in the web design field: We will be asking to see samples of prior work.
Consent to signing a total non-disclosure and confidentiality agreement.
Fluent and conversational English spoken, read, and understood.
Proficient in MS Office Suite and at least one high end web design software: i.e. Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator etc.
Prior experience in one or multiple corporate web design projects.
Willingness to work on all graphics projects at the highest level of commitment and quality that GetAHost.com may need for its purposes for the entire duration of GetAHost.com
Willingness to constantly be in communication with other officers of the company including the CEO, CMO, and others including staff.
A Commitment of at least ten to fifteen hours a week of dedicated graphics works for GetAHost.com as a base minimum.
Next steps: If you think you're up for the challenge of being a partner in our project then take the first steps:
Send us a one paragraph write up describing why you think you'd be our best choice for our advanced level creative graphics design partner going forward and link us to some of your best work.

body:
Hello There . We are a start up building a social publishing site based on Wordpress CMS and the Buddypress plugin. We would like to customise the theme and plug in as well as make some changes to the CMS to adapt it to serve our needs. Primarily we are looking at having the following functionailties:

1. A CMS that allows users to post URLs (like bookmarks )into various categories of interest. Think examples like Delicious, Digg etc (without the voting element) . WP typically is oriented towards blogging as opposed to social publishing. But we love the social networking feature provided by Buddypress , hence we wish to go with Wordpress . This will mean you will have to edit the WP PHP code to allow bookmarking or simply collecting URLs as opposed to full length articles.
2. Edit the stylesheet to develop a new theme/style i.e place all the available features in WP+BP in a new layout that is minimal and quick to load.
3. Design the logo and associated slogan.
4. Help install everything in a hosting account that we will purchase.

We believe most of the core functionailty is already available with WP+Buddypress but a certain amount of customisation will help us get to what we are envisioning. As such we do not estimate this work to run into the thousands. So if you are averse to taking up smaller projects , this may not be up your alley. However if the work is satisfactory, we may have ongoing projects.

Please send us your contact details, portfolio etc. You need to have prior experience /familiarity working with Wordpress and Buddypress. No offshore agencies at this point in time. Thanks.

Vic
title: Wordpress + Buddypress Developer / Designer For Ongoing Work

body:
We have an opening for a mid level PHP/MySql developer with a background in CakePHP. This will be an open-ended contract based position where the individual will work as a full time hourly employee (1099). We will only consider local candidates willing to work from our office in Torrance, CA. No firms or agencies will be considered, individuals only. Please DO NOT reply to this ad if you don't meet those requirements.

We are a small web start-up consisting of a very tight knit team of talented designers & developers. As much as we are focused on getting things done, we offer a very relaxed, friendly and flexible working environment where you can always help yourself to soda & snacks, challenge your co-workers to a PlayStation game and maybe even have a beer or two on a Friday! :)

We have been in business for about two years and rapidly growing. If things work out, there are lots of opportunities to learn and grow with us in the future. This is a great opportunity for someone with a strong work ethic, a can-do attitude and who prefers to be outside of the typical conservative corporate office setting.

We are looking for someone who can meet the following requirements:

Must Haves

* 4+ years of solid PHP/MySql experience
* Experience with at least one PHP MVC framework such as CakePHP or CodeIgniter
* Ability to write good/clean code with appropriate documentation
* Ability to use DVCS such as git
* Exceptional oral/written communication skills
* Self-starter who can work well in a team environment or individually, with a positive attitude
* Interact well with technical teams, business owners, project managers and technical vendors

Pluses

* Familiarity with Netbeans, Eclipse or other IDEs
* Experience with JavaScript frameworks like jQuery
* Experience with other programming languages such as .NET or RoR

Please send us your resume, links to a few sites/apps that you have worked on and your desired hourly rate.
title: CakePHP Developer

body:
Our site is strictly WP and we need someone who is quick, efficient, creative and reasonable.
This would be a project-by-project basis, but very long-term (up to 12 months) as things morph and change for this fast growing concept. We are not asking for anything that complicated, but someone creative and innovative would be awesome. We are a start-up and really looking for the right person to create a relationship with. This is an awesome part-time gig for someone who wants "extra" income NOT PRIMARY income. We can decide together how many hours it will take to accomplish what we need. Ideally you are in the South Bay so we can meet from time to time.

YOU ARE:
Creative, innovative, energetic, focused, brilliant, inspiring, loves fashion and style, has a sharp eye and incredible attention to detail.
Must have a minimum of 8 projects under your belt. Please send resume + your projects and websites you have worked on.

WHAT WE NEED:
One of the objectives for website is to track conversion from the three target markets that we have identified: Clients. Stylists. Community.
Another objective is to create a Members Only site. Similar to a "Social Club". Familiar with GILT GROUP? It's members only. No, we are not selling many items.

Our three channels:
1. Clients: prospective clients will be tunneled through the site using compelling arguments and personalized search techniques to put them in touch with compatible Stylists and presumably booking appointments -- we need some kind of conversion tool.

2. Stylists: potential stylists will be tunneled through the site using compelling arguments and an automated inscription process to facilitate their purchase of our license.

We need DYNAMIC webpages for each stylist as they come on board (thus the as needed-project basis)
*create photo galleries of their client work
*post videos
*blog posts
*show personal twitter feed and your Facebook or LinkedIn profiles

3. Community: (needs to be built out) a combination of clients, prospective clients, stylists, and fashion enthusiasts, this group will be tunneled through the site using compelling editorial content, creating an audience for our advertisers, partners and affiliates, and otherwise building brand loyalty. The creation of a community is essential. This community will open the site up to a network of registered users who will be able to interact with each other. The current thinking is that we'd like to federate groups geographically, in the hopes to encourage and stimulate localized interests and business.

4. Build a shopping page for a few items

5. Other things as they pop up. Like pimping up our FB page :)

Skills Required:
Wordpress, Project Management, HTML, Shopping Cart,

Ok, ready set go... !!! Wordpress expert for build-out of fashion site
title: Wordpress Guru for build-out of fashion site

Coherent Logix leads the industry in ultra-low power, high performance processors that enable the next generation in software defined systems. With development offices in Austin, San Jose, and Portland, we have many opportunities for out-of-the-box creative thinkers to join our team.

We are seeking an experienced, creative, self-motivated SW Quality Engineer who is passionate about quality to be a part of our fast-paced team, producing powerful software tools for the HyperX® architecture. As part of our Software QA group, this person will help define and develop innovative software development procedures and tools; as an integral member of the software tools development team, this person will participate in delivering high-quality, leading-edge products to our customers.

Responsibilities

  • Participate in design process with development engineers
  • Develop and execute test plans, including test automation frameworks, scripted tests, and manual testing procedures
  • Maintain and augment suites of automated/regression tests
  • Participate in evolving Software Development Lifecycle definition and development
  • Minor web design for reporting test results

Qualifications

Required

  • 5+ years of experience in software QA or development engineering
  • Proficiency with C, Linux/Unix shell scripting, and Tcl or Python
  • Embedded systems experience
  • BSCS/MSCS or equivalent

Desired:

  • Software QA team experience
  • Web authoring/content tools like TWiki, Plone, etc.
  • Eclipse development environment
  • EDA tools/terminology familiarity
  • Graphical testing tools (Squish, GUI Dancer, etc.)
  • Simulink/MATLAB tools
  • Java, Perl, Make

More Information

For more information, see our website. Apply online at http://www.coherentlogix.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=89&Itemid=72.

body:
LOCUS New Media is looking for a Drupal Module developer. This is a contract position with down-the-road opportunities for full-time employment.

LOCUS developers are intellectually hungry, quality-obsessed, and technically formidable talents who believe in making the world better, one line of code at a time. A bit about how we'll work:

You'll work off-site with a remotely distributed team and communicate with us using the latest collaboration tools: Skype, Basecamp, GoogleDocs, etc.
You'll need a solid, high-speed Internet connection. Good coffee optional.
We'll synchronize at least 1-2 times daily via Skype. We also expect you to be reachable and responsive via email, IM and phone during normal PST business hours
We're in Los Angeles and we prefer local talent as we meet up occasionally for work and client presentations
We're on the lookout for talented potential employees. So although you'll start out as a freelancer, if there's a connection and budding relationship (we get you and you get us), we'd like to hire you on full-time (serial or moonlighting contractors best leave this position to those who the availability to work during normal business hours and have a long-term goal of becoming an employee)
We work with some amazing A-list clients and expect you and your work to be as unique as our clients are

Responsibilities:

Help lead Drupal development team; ensure all milestones / deliverables meet deadlines
Design, develop and implement custom modules in PHP/Drupal, including any supporting front-end and back-end technologies
Provide all documentation, including code, test, and user documentation (as needed)
Develop release and deployment plans
Help prepare and give customer presentations and demonstrations (as needed)

Requirements:

You live on the west coast
You develop web applications, and you know you're a bad-ass at it. Minimum 6+ years
Drupal is your first love. You have the battle-scars to prove it: 4+ years Drupal exp.
Your communication skills make you shine -- both to clients and to your teammates
When we say "let's SCRUM" you say "hell yes, these guys get it!"
People don't scare you, because working with a dev team sure beats going solo
You can prove your value in working with: Business Executives (requirements gathering), Project Managers (defining and estimating tasks), Technology leads (translating requirements into technical tasks), Developers (implementation) and Junior Developers (implementation -- require mentorship)
The way you see it, "either build software that's elegant, scalable, and bullet-proof, or stop calling yourself a pro already you hack." (and we mean "hack" in the bad way). In other words: best practices are what it's all about, foo!
Mastery of object-oriented design and programming practices. Design patterns are practically your religion
Mastery of the overall Drupal architecture and development process, including deep awareness of available Drupal modules, distributions, best practices and conventions
Mastery of custom Drupal module development, theming (template manipulation), and application configuration
Mastery of commonly used modules, such as CCK, Views, ImageCache etc... Perhaps you've even contributed to and extended existing modules
Mastery of Drupal tools and resources, including Drush, Drush Make, Features, and other necessities to setting up development environments
You're in your element when working in a multi-stage environment (dev, stage, production, etc.) -- one that involves shared codebases and version control (SVN / Git, since CVS is old school)
You understand the value of testing and can demonstrate how it fits into your process. In fact, you even have war stories of how great QA saved your ass
You drink this alphabet soup on a daily basis to get your vitamins: OOP, PHP5, MySQL, LAMP, HTTP, XHTML, XML, XSD, XSLT, REST, DRY, SOAP, HTML5, CSS, JS, JSON, AJAX, SVN, GIT, W3C
Your bookshelf weighs 3,000 pounds thanks to all the O'Reillys you own
You have extensive experience using and configuring Web servers (Apache) and making Drupal fly with performance and scalability techniques
Solid background in Linux server development / deployment and administration
Deep hands-on experience using the tools of the trade: Eclipse (or comparable IDE), SVN / Git, Jira (or other ticketing system)
To you, a command line is a road to infinite possibility, not hell and heartache

If you made it this far, pat yourself on the back for actually reading our full job description. Prove it to us by including the phrase "Hello world, I mean, Locus," in the first sentence of your reply. In fact, responders who don't include this phrase earn a one-way ticket to the lower bowels of our spam folder. That's not you. So thanks for being a pro and paying attention to details. Good luck.

We are a vibrant and growing boutique agency. If you are interested in this position, please email your resume.
title: Drupal Module Developer - Freelance to Fulltime
